review_content: jasne żółte średnio smaczne, bez goryczki, bez aromatu, wad też nie można wypić tylko po co. na koniec coś nie przyjemnego w przełyku.

0,33l bottle from local store, drinking it on 2/08/2021 Pours light golden still body with thin white foam on top. Not very pleasant aroma, some malt, grain, corn and straw notes maybe, but i would expect it to taste at least ok. Taste is very bland and weak with really not much flavour and sweetish overall, watery, grainy and corn notes, a bit buttery but not much to it really.. maybe quite smooth and easy to drink but not in the best way overall I would say.. Watery, light body and moderate carbonation, simple watered taste and uninteresting.. I may have to try a fresher bottle but not immediately..
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.

Powiem wam w Polsce nie ma co kupować amerykańskich piw. Wziąłem by podnieść statystyki z USA ZUPEŁNIE NIEPOTRZEBNIE. W topkach królują wyszukane piwa rzemieślnicze od wujka sama co (pamiętajcie) nijak nie wpływa na koncerny z tej części świata. 
Syndrom buda - puste, mętne, zerowe. Jedynym wyróżniającym się elementem jest zapach bo czuć taniego polskiego koncerniaka  pokroju żubra. Tragedia, wykalkulowana pod niedoświadczone amerykańskie podniebienia. Został mi po nim kapsel i żal.

The perfect beer if you want something easy to drink, without any empowering notes. It has a slight bread taste with some hops but very light. I'd say it strikes above the regular commercial beer but not much further.
Too watery, light taste, weak finish and I don't know, probably the worst beer I've heard in a while
Clear golden beer with white head, watery and light taste with subtle apple like finish. Surprising sweet hopes middle taste

Color amarillo-dorado transparente con espuma fina blanca de poca retención y residuo nulo. Aroma a masa de pan o levadura con notas a minerales y metal. Sabor a pan blanco y minerales con notas a maíz, lúpulo noble y ligera fruta blanca. Dulzor y amargor ligeros y alcohol medio-ligero con regusto corto. Textura acuosa, cuerpo ligero y carbonatación media. Una Pale Lager sosa, sin gracia pero sin grandes defectos. Plana.
Cseh gyártás. Egyet meg lehet inni belőle, de az ember valami nagyobb kihívásra vágyik már utána.
500ml Dose. Klares Goldgelb, hoher wattiger Schaum. Getreide Geruch. Sanft süss. Könnte schlimmer sein. Leider täuscht es was vor. Der Geschmack ist übel! Kork, nasse Pappe, Stroh. Bäh!

330ml clear bottle. Probably not enough hops to worry.
Crystal clear gold, small white head, decent retention, sound is fizz-tastic! Aroma is quite malty, some vegetable extract. Taste is also malty but with slight cardboard and butter notes and a mild bitterness coming through. Good smooth body and carbonation though. I was expecting worse, its far better than Budweiser.
Offer from boss.  Pale gold body with thin fast dissipating head.  Faint malt aroma.  Weak taste with watery finish.  Still, better than their other beer.
Nice golden color.  Has a nice smooth taste due to the cold filtering process

Riecht und schmeckt schon sehr nach Mais und etwas künstlich, bisschen Malz, recht dünn. Aber nicht so schlimm wie ich es befürchtet habe - keine Fehlgeschmäcker. Das kann man aus der Dose irgendwo in Texas schonmal machen - als Durstlöscher.

Musky dusky like a Russian’s armpit or peritoneal area. Quite unlike those craft beers that choke you with hops or gag you with grains. This is a drinkable beer and isn’t that why we drink beer? Funny phrase “drinkable beer”. Like there was a pukeable craft brewed from a bull turd shat on a Monday in the hot August sun. Or one like pussy Coors pissed from twice drank urine and looks the same going in as it does going out. Or like Hamms, brewed from the land of sky blue water in Chesapeake Bay (watch out for the floaters, might be rotting gangster parts). IT’S BEER. I’M NOT TALKING ABOUT GUINNESS OR OTHER STOUTS (YUMMY). IT’S A BEER!
jasne żółte średnio smaczne, bez goryczki, bez aromatu, wad też nie można wypić tylko po co. na koniec coś nie przyjemnego w przełyku.

https://www.instagram.com/czgr_

Dose 0,5l: Helles Gold, glasklar, stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; sehr leichte + milde, dezente malzige Süße, Malz, Getreide, helles Brot, sehr dezente Hopfennoten, kaum wahrnehmbare Aromen; sehr leichter Körper, ähnlich aromenarm wie die Nase, Malz, Getreide, Weißbrot, dezente trockene Säure, wässrig, deutliche Kohlensäure, keine erkennbaren Hopfennoten; leichter malzig-wässriger Nachgang

Una lager americana, che subisce un filtraggio a freddo sotto gli zero gradi, dal colore giallo paglierino. La schiuma è poca e l’aroma è debolmente caratterizzato dai malti. Il gusto è poco inteso ma comunque dolciastro e il corpo è light e il tutto la rende molto bevibile. Niente di particolare da segnalare.

The aroma is not the best. You get some malty nose but is very weak. The taste is very sharp and crisp with a lot of carboration inside and that satisfied you. The aftertaste begins with some sweet watery flavor and i do not like that but after a while the beer give some short bitterness and that was good.
Overall one "ok" beer but nothing special.

Kitöltésre tökéletes habja van, rég láttam ilyen tömör tömzsit.
Íze már elég borzadály, nem is ragoznám tovább.
330ml bottle. Light gold + white head. Watery, corny, light malty, light stale grainy, light skunked, light paper / cardboard, starchy, oily + grainy, light sweetness. Not good.
co to jest XDDDDDD sikacz pierwszej wody. Nic, pustka. W dodatku wali  kukurydzą i gotowanymi warzywami
Smells like nothing tastes like nothing, small hopsy ground, carbonation strong on the front tongue, but it can be refreshing if u r thirsty
Can at home, Golden beer, small head. Aroma is malt, grain, not much. Taste is the same, not much flavour, but bitter, some buttery smooth aftertaste, drinkable,
Żółte klarowne, piana szybko znika. Jak zimne to praktycznie bez aromatu i smaku, totalnie nijakie. Jak ciepłe to wychodzą nuty kukurydziane. Może rywalizować z budweiserem

Die Schaumkrone ist winzig, bzw. nicht vorhanden. Ich rieche nichts. Der Geschmack ist wässrig. Ich nehme minimalen Malz wahr mit minimaler Süße. Aber das wars. Dieses Bier bedient leider alle Kliscgees die es in Deutschland über amerikanisches Bier gibt.

From screw-top bottle (BB 24Jan'21) in shaker. Pours clear honey gold w/thin white head that settled into modest lace, grassy aroma. My 3rd of 3 US macro lagers for the 4th of July, this is the tastiest

A light sweet smell of straw. The medium large white foamy head has a medium duration, the body is pale yellow.
A taste of nearly nothing, light sweet corn and a lot of water...
The body is more than light, a little bit dry with a lively carbonation.

Złotej barwy, klarowne.
Piana słaba.
Aromat słodowy, niezbyt przyjemny.
W smaku słodowe, wodniste, bez goryczki.

330ml bottle (Tallinn Crap Beer Festival 2020) (4:1:3:2:7=1.7)
Perfumey aroma, lagery. Pale gold, white head, -1 because of clear glass. Watery mushroomy taste. Dull, but inoffensive. Not crap enough.

Bottle at Tallinn Crap Beer Festival. Clear golden colour, small white head. Aroma is grainy, very sweet, cormy. Taste is watery, grainy, sweet malty. Light body, average carbonation. Poor, but not offensive
Very solid as commercial lagers go. Best enjoyed fridge-cold after a long day at work.

Bottle - Clear pale yellow colour, small white head. weak malty aromas with some sweetish corn and some weak hops. Taste is quite blank, and a bit too sweetish. Light body, average carbonation, watery mouthfeel and dry finish. Not good.

License brewed beer in Russia.
Golden straw color. Thin film of foam.
Nose . Malt, slightly grassy.
Taste. Watery, dry. harsh. a little malt, aftertaste
Pours pale golden with a thick white head. Aroma of grass, slightly floral. Taste has light amber Pilsen malt, continuation of the floral notes. Palate has light hop notes on the tongue. Fantastic.
Aromat nikły kukurydzy, smak gotowana kukurydza i trochę kwasku. Kolor mega blady. Czyste zło :)
aromat mokrej szmaty, metalu. Dramat. Złote o bujnej grubopęcherzykowej pianie. Smak pusty to mało powiedziane. Jedno z najgorszych piw forever
Pours clear golden with a full, white head.  Aroma is caramel, light hops and light metallic notes.  Taste is caramel, moving to light hops.  Finish is caramel and light metallic notes.
Bez goryczki, słodki finisz, nie nazwałbym mdłym, ale też sam nie lubię gorzkich piw, więc dla mnie idealne.

Appearance: golden, clear, lots of carbonation, dense one finger head.
Aroma: malt, metal, a bit of citrus.
Flavor: sweet, a bit of malt.
Aftertaste: none.
Overall Impression: best described as water witb alcohol and carbonation. No character. Weak taste, no aftertaste. Good when thirsty.
Classic American lager. Weak aromas and light taste. Good beer just for refreshing.
Straight from the clear bottle. Clear gold, tastes corny. Fizzy, light-bodied with corny finish. Happy new year ratebeer!

Low carbonation.
Watery mouthfeel.
A small portion of bitterness.
Refreshing.

clean and edge also great flavor.drink with a pringles or another salty foods as popcorn or nachos or KFC,pizza. salty flavor is best option for MGD in my opinion. but end flavor is not that much good.

Market "ГРМ"  19.7 lei - 0.45 l
Aromă uşoară de paie şi ceva chimie.Gust de apă gazată. Post gust puţin amar.Nu prea seamănă a bere
Great hot day refreshing lager,goes down smooth as.serve cold can't go wrong. Mmmm
Some pretty harsh scores on this one, but I like it a lot. Especially in a glass straight out of the freezer, makes me feel like I'm actually at a bar. A decent replacement for actual draft.

Pale golden color, weak white head.
Bready, malty aroma, with some unpleasant hay notes to it.
Weak taste. Too watery, almost zero malt, light hoppiness and some unpleasant sour aftertaste. Weak body, weak mouthfeel. 
Just plain wrong.
Tried it in Serbia,beer was produced in Hungary for european market,it wasn't bad actually,a bit watery and a bit sweet but it was actually a pretty good beer.

grew up on this beer.
loved it cold.... ice cold.

reminds me of good times.
Schmeckt einfach nach nichts. Hab allerdings davor auch ein Porter getrunken.
Do nebe volající hnus, který jsem koupil jen tak ze zvědavosti, když jsem na něho natrefil v čadském Tescu.

Barwa: złota
piana: duża, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, pozostaje na szkle
smak: woda z pustym piwem
aromat: słodowy
goryczka:brak
nasycenie: małe
sranje, baš veliko govno, kurcu ne valja, nikada ponovo ne bi ovo govno kupila jer je sranje i govno. jebiga

Tomada en varias ocasiones, última el 29..08..2019 en el Kraken. No se puede decir mucho salvo que es agua con ligero sabor a cerveza o Malta de cebada.
Corriente corriente
Trochę taka woda z piwem. Marka znana ale jakości mało wolę Desperadosa wypić bo ma smak
Cerveza ligera, de carbonatación media con una cabeza espumosa casi inexistente. Aroma débil lúpulo y algo de herbáceo. En boca es acuosa con poco por destacar.

Brewerd by: Staropramen Pivovary, but remains the same I guess. It's the most neutral, uncharacteristic beer, that I have ever drunk, that's why it has a gentle pleasant taste. Like it's not even a beer. No foam, yellow color. Acceptable, and drinkable.
Coż można napisać o tym ,,piwie"  -eurolager w sumie  USA-lager , piwo do picia w upalne dni i nic więcej brak w nim czegokolwiek o czym warto wspomnieć.
Water with some beer taste. Pretty refreshing of you are thirsty and sitting in the sun, otherwise stay away :)

Reasonable beer with a refreshing taste when chilled. Quite a weak taste and doesn’t get a good head which makes it look flat, which it often isn’t. Not my first choice but wouldn’t turn down a free bottle.

330ml bottle of the Czech-brewed version from Perla in Lazur, drunk overlooking the Sea Garden. Pours clear straw with a brief, thin fluffy head, plenty of lacing and fast-rising carbonation. Gentle honey and bread aromas with floral and herb hints. In the mouth, smoothly fizzy at first giving way to a slick texture with creamy carbonation all the way through, mild bitterness rising to a dry aftertaste, minimal sweetness, soft flavours of biscuit, bread and floral honey with a crisp finish. Not bad for a mega-macro.
Very similar to corona and Heineken. None of the nasty chemical taste of Budweiser products or Miller Lite or Coors, strange as it may sound. Easy refreshing summer beer.
It is a sweet, malty , a little bit chimical lager. Overall decent but not good.
For me this is a good summer beer! I can definitely knock back a couple easily on a hot summer day!!
Backlog, Bottle, yellow golden with medium head. Notes are corn, grain, dead hops, and poison. Nothing smooth about this drinkability.
God sommaröl och riktigt fräsh med lime i. Rätt mycket mycket lime i var perfekt.
Sommar sommar sommar, med en lime blir en fräsch. Inte lika ljus som Corona.
Quite ok beer, but not as smooth as it says on the pack and olso too expensive compared with other beers from here. I saw good beers fot under 1$, and this one was 2$ (romanian prices in RON).
Do not buy canned! The bottled miller 'gold' is very refreshing with a remembalable taste. One of my favourites party beers

It’s really not too bad. It’s definitely drinkable. I mean, let’s be honest, it’s beer. Having it served nice and cold is best. Personally, to me, it has a almost grassy taste. Not good, but not bad, hence my rating.

Clear pale straw with a foamy white head. Light grassy straw aroma with some lagery adjunct and just a kiss of pear. Crisp semidry flavor that’s light and grainy and a hint fruity with a lagery finish.

You beer nerds with all your analysis of every little thing about the beer are a bunch of assholes did any of you read this shit that you wrote?  It’s fucking beer shut the fuck up and drink it. And get a fucking life other than posting dumb shit on the internet
Shitty corn smell. Clear golden, thin head. Grain, corn. Light body, moderate carbonation.

The score is as a representative of its style:  American Adjunct Lager.  Quad-hopped IPAs and  isn't the right beer for all occasions.

MGD is a sessionable malt-forward lager that tastes great cold and goes down smooth and fast.  This is a crisp, refreshing beer that's at home at a barbecue during 112 degree weather.

There's little complexity to it at all.  This isn't a demanding beer that challenges you to identify the regional hop notes.  There's nothing on the nose, and on tasting MGD leads with a wheaty malt, continues into a mild hoppiness, and finishes on a mild saltine cracker note.  All of this is quite mild.

The best of America can be found in good times with good friends that are uncomplicated.  MGD is the American beer for that occasion.
Szerintem teljesen elfogadható minőségű sör,arra teljesen jó hogy a haverokkal isztok 1-2 korsóval.
Malty sweet lager. Outstanding design and color. Malt and corn in taste are completely spoilt by cardboard notes. Drinking Miller slowly kills your love for good beer...
Bu sarı malt aromalı damakta tat bırakmayan tipik bir Amerikan Lager soğuk içilmelidir.
Clear golden color, with white head. Buttery, malty aromas with some maltiness, bit cardboard flavor, but really any special. Almost have no palate, thin and easy to drink.

I bought a 16 ounce can last night.  Didn't realize I hadn't reviewed this yet.  Anyways, you know what this is.  Standard 'merican bland lager, I never felt jackshit from the supposed alcohol in it either.

La birra, da bere bella fredda, si presenta chiarissima e con una schiuma poco consistente che svanisce molto presto. È chiaramente pensata per dissetare e si lascia bere piuttosto bene se non fosse per la carbonazione un pelo eccessiva. Non un gran aroma ma il gusto tutto sommato non è male, emerge il piacevole dolciastro del malto mentre il luppolo resta sullo sfondo. In bocca lascia un bel sapore e nel complesso è migliore di altre birre pensate appositamente per dissetare.
Se cercate qualcosa di particolare e complesso però statene bene alla larga!

Bottle exploded in my fucking fridge. Tastes mediocre. No surprise - filtering probably killed all remnants of taste there were originally. Looks nice, though.
Brewed by Russian Heineken in Nizhny Novgorod.

Color giallino, limpida e trasparente, schiuma fine e bianca che sparisce subito. Al naso leggerissimo malto e dolciastro. Al palato si riprende il poco percepito olfattivamente. Acquosa e carbonizzata. Appena si scalda si percepisce del mais e del dolciastro appiccicoso. Da bere (se è da bere purtroppo) freddissima.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Aroma and appearance unremarkable... Not much to speak of... Hints of corn, maybe some malt.. but it does go down super easy
The only thing that could improve it would br to make more available where I Dine.
De color amarillo espuma de media retención,nada de lúpulo y muy poco de la Malta para tomar cuando hace mucho calor

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Completely expressionless, strawy-grainy aroma. Taste is minimally sweet grainy and wet strawy, mineral overtones. Light and watery.
Out of all the commercial beers from the US we get in the UK this is undoubtadly the best one.

Sampled from 0.355 l can from local 'Trink & Spare', canned in August 2018. Clear, pale golden with a thin, slightly fluffy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sweetish aroma of grains and corn. Slightly sweet, moderately bitter, minimally grassy-spicy taste of grains, corn and traces of straw, followed by a short, just slightly bitter and a little grassy-spicy finish. Thin body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Pretty crappy, still drinkable.

EIn verdammt einfaches Bier, das einfach so nichtssagend ist wie seine omnipräsente Verfügbarkeit. Es ist sehr hell, leicht und einfach langweilig. Ein amerikanisches Leichtbier, dessen Beliebtheit mir nicht ganz klar ist.

Bottle 0.33l. Czech version, brewed at Pivovar Staropramen, Prague. Clear, straw colored. AROMA- touch of malt. FLAVOR- neutral, no bitterness, water, old paper, touch of malt. Light bodied.
Really bad.
Meer dan een standaard Amerikaans bier. Heeft meer smaak en diepgang dan de Amerikaanse concurrent. Zoetig van smaak en licht hoppig. -backlog de BierApp-

One of worst rated beers I tried.. how bad it can be ?
Smell - quite weak, bit strange not good, maybe some hops.
Foam - thin, not watery, soft, weak weak toothpaste flavor. White, medium height.
Appearance - clear yellow, very few single bubbles.
Taste - weak watered down bitterness, some citrus.

/its not good, but surely not as bad as it is rated, if you are drunk you will not care, same as other light beers.

Nisam ocekivao puno od ovog piva i mogu slobodno rec da sam bio u pravu..bistro zuta boja,slabija pjena i puno mjehurica..izgled je cak i relativno dobar al je okus los..previse vodenasto i vuce na kiselkasto..
Neprimjetna gorčina, blagi okus limuna ili slično. Odlično za ljetne dane i uživanje na moru, vrlo pitko.

Bottle, 330ml. Pale golden, decent white foam. Brutal carbo is feeding the head. Actually it looks OK,  but cz of the white glass bottle, the beer is photocontaminated, so the primary aromas are not relevant. Secondary aromas are overrun by sweet barley, hay and fodder. Taste is pretty much nothing, weak malty palate, short aftertaste. For 1.35 € it's definately not a good value.

33 cl. bottle @ home, served in a teku glass.

Aroma: almost no aromas. Very subtle metallic and unfermented grains overtones. Some malt, cooked vegetables and sulphur nuances in the background.

Appearance: pale gold to straw yellow color with perfectly white head. Low to medium head thickness with low retention and low to medium Brussels' lacing. Crystal clear.

Taste: medium sweetness, low bitterness, low sourness. Flavors are metallic, unfermented grains, corn, sweet corn. Hints of citrus, lemon. Balanced but lacking of flavor.

Palate: low to medium body, silky/oily to watery texture, medium to high carbonation, medium long dry and sweet finish with low bitterness and low to medium sweetness and the same aforementioned (lack of) flavors. Alcohol is not noticeable. No astringency.

Overall: more a joke than a beer. Carbonated water with hints of metallic, corn and sweet corn flavors. Bad, even for a mass brewery. Too much carbonation. Almost no aromas nor flavors, and the noticeable ones are quite bad.
0,5l can. Most a dobozos verziót tesztelem. Könnyed malátaaromával rendelkező sör. Nyilván nem a legjobb, amit valaha ittam, de ennek a sörnek nem ez a célja. Egyszerű szomjoltó és kész.

Warzone w Czechach butelka 13.04.2019 r.
Aromat: słodowy, lekko owocowy
Wygląd: kolor żółty, klarowny, piana błyskawicznie znika
Smak: wytrawne
Duże wysycenie, lekki chmiel, lekkie, gładkie, smaczne piwo

Since everyone seems to be a Beer Genius...this is what I think. MGD is amazing. It quenches your thirst and makes you want a little more. Its taste hits the spot perfectly, even the foam is something a Greek God could not have done without thr help of ones lips hitting the glass bottle just at the right time before it overflows as your eyes marvel in its greatness. MGD is a great beer and it goes we'll with any occasion

Looks great ( golden straw, nice white head, carbonation bubbles) but thats as far as it gets. First taste cereal i.e. corn/maize like a south american beer. Very carbonated, sweet. No hop aroma or taste what so ever. Overall very weak flavour mostly of cereals, sweet, fizzy and bland. I surpose you could say easy drinking because it so bland/tasteless. Aroma is sweet corn flakes with tiny hint of yeasty bread. Not one for me or anyone who enjoys a hoppy beer.

Barwa ciemna słomkowa. Piany brak nawet przy agresywnym nalewaniu. Klarowne, iskrzące. Aromat mokry karton i nic więcej. Smak pusty, wodnisty. Goryczki brak. Na finiszu również pustka. Mocno wysycone. Nieprzyjemne w ustach.

La vendian en el aldi por 1€ y queria probarla. Cerveza americana hecha rn la republica checa.
De sabor a cualquier cosa menos cerveza, color amarillo dorado, sin casi espuma, es tan industrial que parece un meado. Es modelo de birra de verano, refrescante, pero al no tener cuerpo, y tan mal sabor, decepciona terriblemente.
Muy mala, huid de ella.
Flaska z tesca. Farba taka priesvitna vinova. K voni len tolko, ze smrdi. Chut odporna. Ani som to nedopil.

If you have ever drank a Guinness beer   from Ireland the head of the beer stays the same from the top to bottom of the glass. I have drank a lot of different beers over the years and MGD is the only beer I have  had that keeps the head of beer from top to bottom its a great tasting beer . A secret  too all  a cold glass in the freezer then pour your MGD into your glass its so refreshing after a long day at work CHEERS TOO ALL

Definitely refreshing and with a good balance of hops, body feel and sweetness. For some reason I enjoy the flavor the corn-based beers. There's kind of a toasted taste to it. I would rate this higher than the other standard macros mainly because of the balance of the hops and the refreshing taste. Some of the others seem to have an astringent quality to them.

24 ounce can into lager glass, best before 6/11/2018. Pours crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger fairly dense and rocky white head with awesome retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of cracker, corn, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light nuttiness/pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Touch of fruity aromas, but not overwhelming. Nice and pleasant aromas with pale malt/corn and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, corn, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light nuttiness/pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, grassy, peppery bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, corn, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light nuttiness/pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice robustness and balance of pale malt/corn and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with zero yeast notes present. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation and medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, and fairly sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.7%. Overall this is a very good pale adjunct lager style. All around nice robustness and balance of pale malt/corn and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. very flavorful and never watery for the ABV. Perfectly clean pale malt/grain flavors, and nice earthy hop presence for the style. Not overdone on adjuncts at all, plenty of barley presence. A very enjoyable offering, and well made style example. Best macro adjunct lager I have tried so far.

Pours a clear, light golden coloration with a medium, fizzy heat that almost instantly dissolves. Smell is quite watery, with a hint of light caramel malt and a touch of grains. Taste follows the nose, being quite watery with a light, slightly sweet touch of caramel malt and just the faintest hint of grain. A slight note reminiscent of corn syrup coming throught as well. Lacks any kind of finish, maybe turning a little sweet in the aftertaste, with almost no discernible bitterness. Watery body with very high cabonation. This basically tastes like corn syrup flavoured water, it has very little in common with beer in my opinion. Wow, I mean, I kinda knew what to expect, but this level of bland tastelessness is quite something else. I actually had to raise my rating just a little bit after tasting Coors Light though.

It just doesn't taste of anything other than slightly sour corn and mineral water. Even the alcohol is difficult to spot. A beer with no redeeming qualities whatsoever (it's not even cheap in Sweden!).

This is another old school (high school) beer for me as well. This actually might be the best of all the Miller's that I tried. Still have to try MG64, though I'm not really in a hurry.

From the bottle in my flat. For review purposes, I’m reviewing this against other lagers, not against the beer scene as a whole. 

Aroma: It’s okay for a lager. Faint kind of corn smell? 

Appearance: I love the way this beer looks... The bottle is classy and refined, and the beer itself is perfectly clear. 

Taste: Better than most other macro lagers in my opinion. Miller Genuine Draft has a kind of spiciness that distinguishes it from other macros like Calrsberg and Budweiser. 

Palate: It does the job here. It’s cold, wet, and slightly fizzy. All you can really expect from a macro lager. 

Overall: Compared to some of the great craft beers out there, Miller Genuine Draft is never going to pull up any trees. As a lager though, it’s a pretty solid effort and I wish it was more available in the UK.

12 ounce can. Pours a very clear, light yellow with a white head. The head retention is good, but this is due to the foam enhancer which Miller uses called propylene glycol alginate (food grade, of course!) The aroma is extremely clean. The flavor is full of corn sweetness with low hop bitterness. The carbonation is quite lively and refreshing. All in all, a very solid adjunct (not all malt) beer which is a great thirst quencher. In the realm of international lagers, this is a very good one. I often hear the craft beer snobs criticise and denigrate beers like this, but they are very wrong because they refuse to accept the consistently high quality of a beer like MGD simply because it does not fit their taste profile.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 1B). Bottle 33 cl - Batch L6 249 2 17 (BBF 05/06/2017). AROMA: low cereal aroma with a grainy component. nop hop aroma present. APPEARANCE: gold color and cristal clear. medium-low white head with low retention. TASTE: medium-low to low malt flavor with a slight grainy-sweet character. medium-low to low bitterness with a semi-dry finish. no hop flavor. clean lager profile. PALATE: light body with medium-low to low carbonation. OVERALL: a regular american lager with fewer carbonation.

Corn, cooked vegetable, maybe a touch of banana. It’s like breakfast in a bottle. Except for the vegetable part, who eats vegetables for breakfast?

Taste is grainy. Lots of cooked vegetable. Sweet corn. That’s about it. Eh.... While it isn’t flavorful, it doesn’t taste "bad."

Mouthfeel is very smooth, very dry. The aftertaste is even drier. It’s smooth, maybe a little oily. Medium light body. Has an odd bitterness on the swallow. It’s not so much bitter, maybe sour instead.

Overall, it’s not real good. I’d take High Life over this. It’s not undrinkable, but not far from it. I wouldn’t buy it again, and I wouldn’t recommend it.

Dorata limpida, schiuma bianca pannosa di ottima persistenza.
Aroma di malto d’orzo, leggerissimo pepe.
Al palato attacca leggermente citrica, malto d’orzo, finale di crosta di pane.
Corpo leggero, non molto carbonata.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso devia su orzo e mais. L’intensità olfattiva è flebile e la persistenza olfattiva è corta. Il cappello di schiuma ha una scarsa tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è media mista a grossolana. La carbonazione è media. La consistenza del liquido è limpida. Le bollicine sono fini, spinte all’insù da una carbonazione media, vivace, persistente ed insistita. Il colore è giallo ambrato. Il corpo è snello. L’amaro è moderato. C’è un accenno di aspro. L’intensità gustativa è normale e la persistenza gustativa è sufficiente. Il finale è bruschino e semplice. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. L’aroma in bocca riporta sentori di pane, mais e orzo.
33cl bottle. Pours golden with small white head. Corn, weak herbal hops. Quite smooth thirst quencher. Watery.

Jednym słowem dramat. Tutaj nawet nie ma się czego doszukać w aromacie ani smaku. Wysokie wysycenie. Od wody gazowanej odróżnia tylko słomkowa barwa

0.33l bottle with a twist-off cap brewed in Italy, purchased at a Lidl store in Zagreb. Strange I didn’t try this earlier. Golden-yellow shiny body with lively carbonation, medium white head that went away relatively fast. Fruity, sweetish malty aroma, corn I guess, slightly oily, maybe vague caramel. Eh. later on becomes strangely dry and with vegetable notes. Overly sweet, fruity taste, just sugary water, vaguely fruity, some fruity touches, smooth, no bitterness. Vague vegetable maybe, even maaaybe alcohol. Eh. Maltose syrup rules the flavor profile, and makes this just, well, wrong. Once the vegetable notes start popping out, this quickly turns into something terrible. I would not want to try this warm. At all.

Przezroczysta butelka 330 ml. Typowy amerykanski masowy jasny lager. Słaby aromat, słodowe, wodniste, zbożowe. Kolor dokładnie taki, jak na zdjęciu butelki. Piany brak, klarowne. Płytkie. Szału ni ma.

Pours clear gold with a fair rocky eggshell head that leaves some clumpy lace behind. Nose involves faint corn flakes, some light noble hop influence, light sugar and faint toasted notes. Fairly sweet, lightly bitter. Light to medium bodied, somewhat oily but fairly watery, with a toasted corn flake crisp finish. Kind of in that no man’s land where it’s a little too heavy to really enjoy in mass quantities, but there isn’t much to contemplate and enjoy. Probably surviving based on the small group of very brand loyal MGD drinkers. Could use a packaging update, but I’m not sure Miller-Coors cares a lot about this brand.
Aromat slodowy, lekko trawiasty. Barwa zlota. W smaku przecietnie, wodniste, dosyc nagazowane. Pijac zimne mocno orzezwiajace.

Primer sorbo: Peculiar. Un tono a malta fresco, pero apagado de entrada. El amargor es muy débil, pero hay un “algo” final que no es malta. Es como un frescor que para nada resulta amargo, más bien dulce.

Es muy suave esta cerveza. ¿Dónde está el lúpulo? El trago es amortiguado y con sordina. Destaca por su ausencia de amargor. Quizá, muy al final, hay un regusto que parece querer ser ése amargor que esperaríamos. El acto comienza por ser malta, una malta que me parece un poco maquillada de alguna manera, pero que, hay que reconocerlo, resulta apetecible. Pese a todo, encuentro un tanto aguada la cerveza. Cuando se está finalizando un trago, que el líquido está ya cayendo más allá de la lengua, sobreviene una especie de sabor suavísimo y liviano. La fase de malta, con todo, se hace agradecida, y más en un día de calor.

Es como una cerveza hecha para gustar y refrescar. Como una cerveza que quiere ser refresco. Se bebe rápido, y más si está bien fría. El lúpulo se esconde. Hace un trabajo en la sombra, apoyando a la malta cuando va ya a terminar su fase, pero luego, en vez de salir y manifestarse, todo queda disfrazado por ese sabor más o menos dulzón, fresco, y que nos puede engatusar como a niños.

Es un tanto peculiar, cuando menos, la cerveza en conjunto. Pasa bastante bien, muy fluida, que digamos. Quizá lo más intenso que tenga sea la fase de malta. El amargor es un eco muy posterior. El trago último queda algo aguado, la malta y el jarabe se mantienen, aunque quizá sutilmente alterados.

Dorado intenso con claridad, buena espuma con retención. Lúpulo herbal-cítrico moderado, malta maltoso bajo, sin presencia de DMS. En boca malta maltoso bajo, lúpulo bajo-imperceptible, amargor bajo. Final fresco dulce prolongado. Carbonatación moderada con cuerpo medio-ligero.

Thanks to a friend's leftover housewarming party brews. Pours an average size foamy white head and has a straw coloured appearance. Lacing is sticky. Aromas are malty, grassy and grainy. Flavours are fairly sweet with strong notes of malt, grains, wheats and grassy hops. Good for a constant brew, for parties and such.

The aroma has little hops and the beer has gradually moderate foam. It tastes relatively much of the flower and thus becomes easy to drink and almost summer-like. Palate is limited and hop bitterness is only a faint whiff. As a European pilsner type it falls far short of expectations, and its little watery aftertaste with residual sweetness full flower is in the length almost synthetic. It is certainly not worth going for depth, and therefore I do not want to write more than above about this beer. It is a beer that can be drunk, but be forgotten quickly.

* Bottle. Pours golden, clear, with a white head. 
* Aroma is sweet, grain, honey, cardboard & bread. 
* Palate is light, crisp, medium carbonation, very fine bubbles. 
* Taste is light, sweet, cereals & corn. 
* Finish is moist.

Overall it is a beer that I really enjoy. it’s light and crisp and sweet. To me its a barbecue beer and can be paired with seafood or spicy food. Good on a sunny day.

Single clear bottle from Liquor Depot, served in a footed lager glass. Pours a light golden straw hue with moderate carbonation and a pearly, milk-white head that retains a little longer than most light lagers, leaving thick lace webs. (The larger of the bubbles pop so that the cap begins to show tunnels and crevices before it disappears.) Aroma: the usual complement of sweet cereals, a bit husky and dusty. Flavor: sour creamed corn and sweet grains, a bit foul. Thin, slick texture and a standard dry finish. Due to the high visibility of its uglier characteristics, I rate MGD lower than most other big-name adjunct light lagers. Definitely best experienced as a commercial only, watching draft taps spewing out gallons of sparkling, golden nectar and rafts of snow-white froth in slo-mo.

330ml bottle from a supermarket in Torfyanovka, Russia, brewed in Moscow by SAB-Miller/Efes. Clear yellow colour, small fizzy mostly vanishing white head, some lacing. Light to moderate maltiness of grain corn and bread with a hint of grassy hops. Taste is initally slightly sweet, turning into a mildly bitter finish with a chalky feel. Light body, slick mouthfeel, average carbonation. Genuinely boring, though less awful than Budweiser.

Poured from bottle into a snifter
 Appearance – The beer pours a clear golden color with a one finger head of pure white foam. The head has a light level of retention, fading rather fast to leave a light level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.
 Smell – The aroma of the beer is heaviest of a slight bready and corny smell as well as a little bit of a cardboard aroma. Along with these smells are some light aromas of a metallic nature.
 Taste – The taste begins with a corn syrup and bready taste with the overall flavor being a little on the sweeter side. As the flavor advances the bready and corn fade a bit and a little bit of caramel takes it place. With this flavor transitions comes some light papery tastes as well, leaving one with a still somewhat sweet and papery like flavor to linger on the tongue.
 Mouthfeel – The body of the beer is on the average side with a carbonation level that is on the slightly higher side. For the style the feel is quite appropriate and makes for an easy drinking brew.
 Overall – Not the most offensive, but nothing too special. A good tailgating brew, but otherwise, not a go too.

Rating #1003, gylden øl uden skum. Duft (lugt) af list korn, metal og plastic. Vandet og metallisk smag med list karamel og alkohol. Let bitterhed. Tynd og vandet fylde.

Geruch und Farbe sind stimmig, Schaumkrone ist unterdurchschnittlich, aber nicht unagenehm. Einstieg ist frisch und relativ anständig herb. Fazit: Ein überbrückungsbier bei einer US Wahl-Party oder Ähnliches - mehr nicht.

Tasted from draught. Among the endless series of fantastic craft beers, we would almost forget that the U.S. have their mass-market standard lagers as well, and this is one of the biggest - in terms of quantity, that is, because this belongs to the most bland and boring lagers I ever had, thin, vaguely sweetish with almost no hops in the finish.
Free bottles at work summer party. An all round shocker of a beer. It’s got more flavour than bud but that a bad thing in this case.

Looks like any pale lager, but has very little to say about it. The overall taste is rather watery, with just the slightest tinge of citrus and malt. Thin feel, might just as well be drinking soda.

Clear yellow body with medium white head. A faint malty aroma with some breakfast oats. Which is handy since this is so weak you could probably have it for breakfast. Really watery, very low bitterness. Could have been one of those beers that you can have a lot of on a hot summer day but no. The aftertaste is bad. Tastes like paper. Seriously.
Pretty much as bad as it gets for beer. Flavourless. Weak attempt at corn and straw flavours but mostly tastes like water.

Niestety w smaku jak woda. mam wrażenie jakby ktoś wlał tylko polowe piwa do tej i tak malej butelki, a resztę dolał wody. smak nie jest zły, ale ten napój przypomina raczej jakiś podpiwek niż piwo sensu stricto. raczej na słabe amerykańśkie głowy niż na polskie mocne łby.

Bottle, 33cl. Oh my... Light pale color with no head or lacing whatsoever. Aroma is corn, weak malt and citrus. Watery mouth-feel and taste. Not much to report. Cardboard, acid sourness, metallic undertone. Pretty much as bad as it gets. Avoid it.

Can. Well, I always thought of pale macrolagers that they’re at least consistent, without taste, yes, but also without flaws. But this one, apart from a light but annoyingly sweet maltiness that was just too much given how watery this beer is, had plenty of cardboard and onion (sulphur derived) notes. Undrinkable.

33cl bottle @ home as a gift. Clear fizzy pale body, white fully disappearing no lacing head. Aroma light malt and citrus tons of water. Taste light sweetness, lightly bitter. Light body, thin feel, average carbonation, light bitter-sweet finish. Good soda.
Pours a faint yellow colour with a very thin head. Very light on flavour, body, and carbonation
I feel bad giving this 0.5. Why is there no 0 option? Tastes like water with some alcohol

33cl flesje via AH, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 4,3%

330 ml bottle at a party. Pours clear gold, no real head. Corn aromas. Sweet taste. Astringent finish. Not very good, not surprisingly!

Pours a clear light golden colour with 60 second head. Slightly metallic on the nose, musty as well. Watered down taste with no real malt or hop character. no hop flavour. Thin mouthfeel, not very carbonated either.

33cl. bottle from AH supermarket. Clear pale golden color, small fizzy white head that disappears within seconds, a bit of lacing; aroma sweet, honey, corn, grassy, citrus; taste is sweet, slightly bitter, rather neutral; light body, watery texture, lively carbonation; light bittersweet finish.
Bottle. Pale yellow with small foamy white head, doughy aroma, high carbonation, crisp slightly sour taste with abrupt finish. Another boring pale lager, although one of the better examples.
Clear light golden colored body. Off white head. Aroma and taste very weak. Aroma is malty, bready and yeasty. Taste has some metallic notes and skunk. Highly carbonated. Watery.
Bottle @ White Horse, Parsons Green. Pours deep gold with subtle citrus aroma. Has a light fruitiness with very little bitterness. Just about drinkable.

3.1 - 0.2 /5
bread, hay, toast, floral, grass, citrus, dough, leather, skunky, pale, golden, hazy, medium-hite sweet, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, slick feel, lively,

Color amarillo oro con media capa de espuma de burbuja grande que no permanece mucho tiempo en la copa; aromas herbales y a lúpulo, en boca entrada suave y refrescante con notas a maíz, cuerpo y carbónico ligeros, una cerveza lager de sesión con amargor muy comedido pero sin matices reseñables.

0.33 l bottle from local supermarket. Light yellow colour, very small head, bubbles. Taste has CO2 and water with hints of malts and hops. Too smooth for me. It actually tastes better from glass than from bottle.

MGD will always be my highest rated big brewery beer. When I was young, Miller Lite was my go to beer. I eventually graduated to MGD due to the amount of taste and how smooth and drinkable it was. I do tend to not drink it anymore because if I’m out partying I tend to go to Miller Lite because it is easier for me to watch my alcohol intake.
Can to plastic cup, at us cellular field. Cold, crisp and drinkable. I don’t choose to drink lite lagers, bit sometimes I have no other choice. This though is one of the better ones.

Pours a clear golden color. There’ s an average white head and medium retention.
Malty aroma is mild, slightly skunky and easily picked up.
The taste is sweet and grainy, some bitterness only in the finish. 
Not much taste, light but drinkable.

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma of corn and a little malt. Flavour is corn, malt and a slight hoppy, bitterness in the finish. Light body with watery texture and soft carbonation.
Pours a clear golden color with white head. Enjoyed a lot in college, mainly grain for the enjoyable part of this one.

330ml clear bottle with an embossed logo and a nicely designed label, poured into a lager glass. Apperarance is clear pale golden with a small white head that settled quickly, leaving no lacing. Aroma of corn, wheat bread and grains. Flavour of wheat bread and sweet corn. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Palate is light bodied, thin watery texture and average carbonation. Refreshing and watery without any off flavours, just a bit too sweet.

Pure commercial Pale Golden Lager. Slight foam that quickly disappears. Poor aroma, sweet, which highlights the malt and some corn. Taste is the same, emphasizing the malt, with some corn and a not very intense but persistent hop hints.
0.33l bottle. Golden color with quickly disappearing head. Weak grainy aroma. Taste is sweet and grainy. Average carbonation and watery palate.

Just gonna keep on going through the Miller brews.
Various times this was poured in a pint glass and other times a pilsener, I couldn’t distinguish much of a difference either time.
The appearance was a pure golden yellow color with less than a finger’s worth of white foaminess of a head that ended up fizzling within several seconds.
The smell tried to have some corn adjuncts but honestly, I barely got that. There really isn’t much to this one at all.
The taste tried to be sweet but had more of grassy, somewhat off herbal flavor to it. There was no aftertaste nor finish.
On the palate, it sat exceptionally light and had a great sessionability about it. The carbonation was there and decent for the style but came across pretty watery to me.
Overall, this is just another American Adjunct Lager to me. Its nothing special and its nothing bad.
Bottle boot n shoe ossett. Froch v groves b4. As the the person who rated before said so elegantly. AMERICAN PISSWATER !!
Beers like this are often called "American pisswater". Tasteless and boring. Refreshing indeed, but does barely have any flavor.
Tap. Clear, golden, frothy, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, fizzy, & bitter finish.
Yellow, clear with small white head. Fizzy with a citrus lime, cereal malt and bitter finish. Quite watery and metalic with no bitterness

Cant at the Cell. Pours a clear pale gold with a bubbly white head that dissipates quickly to the edges. Aroma has lots of sweet grains and corn with a bit of stale bread. Flavor has lots of sweet grain and sweet bread with some corn underlying.
Lager and lemonade perhaps, old composting grass combined with homebrewed lager. Truly watery mouthfeel. The bottle was small for a reason. Poor example of mass produced urine.
Keywords: Skunk, easy drinking, loads of cardboard, cheap corn flavor, boring, artificial sweetness. Overall: A excellent beer, if you dont like beer.

Smell is in distinguishable. Tastes like light hop water. No aftertaste. Not offensive.

Typical mass produced American lager, watery with a bitter taste. Beers like this drove me to the craft beer scene.

33cl bottle bought at beercascais. Color is clear gold. Body is thin. Taste is light bitter. Aroma is corn, citrus, wood, pinneaple, sprouts.

Pours a pale yellow, with barely any head. Aromas are skunky (yay for clear glass bottles!), some light malt, corn, grass. Taste is semi-sweet, with no bitterness. Aftertaste is non-existing. On tap at United business lounge Newark. Pours a pale light urine colour, minimal dissipating head that wafts aromas of Apple juice and corn. Taste of corn on the cob and a rice bowl with nothing but white rice in it. Leaves a wet, water like, wetness in your mouth as you regretfully swallow...
had to rate it...appearance perfect....no aroma..no flavor except grail and rice cake...drink at at lake mead super cold

Bottle. Yellow with a medium, quickly disappearing white head. Aroma has some grain and little citrus. 

Taste has grain, cardboard and little citrus. Bit bitter on the aftertaste. Ok brew, enough body for a bulk lager.

Bright Golden-Yellow beer with a white head that dissappears before you knwo it. Faint hop aroma. Taste is Bland at best. But right after the first I would choose a real beer.

33 cl, flaske, 4,7 % ABV, købt i Føtex på Østerbro, 18. februar 2014.
Klar og gylden amerikansk pilsner-type med flygtig hvid skumkrone på knap 1 cm. 
Frisk, let og syrlig duft af humle. Svage noter af eksotisk frugt såsom papaya. 
Sødlig, frisk og crispy smag med "nedskruet" bitterhed. Meget let drikkelig og dejlig mundfølelse, hvor det fornemmes, at der er arbejdet med kulsyreindholdet.

If I could rate a beer as a total 0 this would be it. No redeeming qualities whatsoever. Nothing appetizing, not well made with any thought or craftsmanship about it. Made for those that have given up trying to find anything that might taste better, if you drink this or know someone who does, you or they are a lost cause.
Couleur peu courante, pas de goût très prononcé, légère. Pas désagréable, pas exceptionnelle non plus.

330 ml. bottle @ home. Procured from T he American Food Store comes this highly American beer in a clear bottle & twist-cap. It even has 5! eagles on the bottle, how much more American can something be? BBF 07/02/2014 aka today. Bottled & brewed in the EU actually but I assume that this one tastes 100 % identical to an USA one. Bright sparkling golden, very quickly gone chemical white head. Sweet oily, chemical corn nose, sweetish, faintest inkling of skunk. Tastes like bitter mineral water, oily corn, artificial sweetness in the back, quite a lot of minerals here, odd, starch, potato, sparkling. Very high carb. & mineral feel, lightly oily, oily corn starch. Made with the finest selected cereal according to the bottle. Not as good as Coors Light, I have had worse beers but calling this remotely good would be a huge exaggeration. I could drink large quantities of this which certainly isn’t true for a lot of pale lagers so it has that going on.

24oz clear bottle into pint glass, clear light pale-golden color with soapy white head. Aroma of pale malt sweetness and metallic. Taste adds some breadiness and a slight fruity/veggy note. Light body, heavy carbonation, thin, watery with clean finish. Not much to it, I’m sure it’s SO different from high life.

12 fl.oz. bottle - 0.355l  
 Sehr hellgelb im Glas, kaum Schaum. Das Bier ist mild, wässrig. Leichte Getreidenoten, leichte Süße - aber sonst nichts. --> langweiliges Massenbier.
Piss yellow with white head. Aroma of metal pole, taste the same. Not a very good beer.

Pours two fingers of head on a clear light golden colored body.
The aroma is an unpleasantly sharp metallic lemon and rice smell.
The taste is sweet with some mild bitterness towards the end. Just really sweet.
The texture is crisp with some stickiness. Moderate carbonation, but it feels really fizzy.
Well, it looked good.

DATE TASTED: January 10, 2014... GLASSWARE: Ommegang pokal...OCCASION: Shan’s winterm is over; new Shark tank... APPEARANCE: two-finger swiftly declining soupy white head; slightly sallow, golden body with sparse bubbles; lacing is cloudy and sporadic... AROMA: sharp, pingy hops; malts are corny with wafts of honey and syrup... PALATE: gas-inducing, rather thin body; lingering aftertaste; oily and resilient...TASTE: sweet, almost lip-puckering sweet corn malt akin to thee malt liquor swigged in college... OVERALL: a top-shelf beer-fridge filler and a third-beer-of-the-night kind of quality; does not distinguish itself from the rest of the miller production line...

Clear Pale Gold Color, Huge Frothy Head, Surprisingly Lasted and Left Light Strings Of Lacing. Light Skunk and Metallic Aroma. Taste Of Light Skunk, Slightly Metallic, Sweet with Mild Bitter Finish. No Aftertaste. Watery Thin and light cream since I swirl the pint to get all the lace from the glass. Easy Drinker but Bland. Although You could do worse, like a generic version of it, I do not see the attraction that people get drinking it all the time. Every Beer has its place and time. This one works best as a thirst quencher when you are desperate and / or it is free. Also It might work as a reminder to any snobs to count blessings, that if not for the Crafts, this would be one of the few choices that we would have. Pass It...
On tap at Melbourne ballpark bread aroma light yellow small white head taste is bland but good on a hot day

Served very cold. Pale golden and very clear. Aroma and taste as you would expect from any commercial pale lager. Not as bad as its reputation, but a long way to go to be a refreshing and tasteful lager. Aftertaste does not encourage procurement of another bottle.

Holds a special place in my heart. First beer I ever had. Didn’t like it at first, but I can appreciate a few in a nice cold mug with my dad. Always a go to beer.

Bottle 0.33l from local market. Originally rated xxxx2011. Colour is clear yellow with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, grain and malts. Just horrible.

33 cl bottle abv 4.7 from supermarket.
Minimal head. Yellow golden beer, visible carbonation.
Scents of grassy malts, faint hint of grassy "urine", that’s hops I think.

Normal in the mouth. Malt and bread dominate the ending.

Visual: Big beer company, now joined with Molson and Coors. Seems like a chugging/hot pot beer to me. Pours clear golden yellow with a small dissipating head, thin layer of retention, several slow spread out streams.

Nose: a bit of apple but mainly light barley grain. (3)-aromatic strength.

Attack: sharp crispness mixed with light barley (4)-sweetness.

Mid-palate: (MAIN) barley, cereal grain

Finish: thin malty sweet finish, palate off-dry roughness.

Summary: Absolutely zero depth and not much flavour other than the cereal barely malt. It goes okay with Chinese salty meal since it’s light flavour basically acts like water in cleaning the palate, quenching thirst, and partially accentuating lingering residual flavours. Terrible on its own though. (Note: all numbers above are on a 10-point scale, with 1 being weak and 10 being the strongest)
Shared bottle. Not so tasty, pours yellowish with no head. Probably not the best us beer.
Wow this one is clear filtered like a mother fucker! Corn syrup, dme... just what the doctor ordered.

Bottle at home. Pours clear pale gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is Pils malt and corn, spicy hops and rice notes. Flavor is malt dominant with light hops and bitterness, corn and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

BOTTLE 33CL.

Head: white, medium, frothy, avg. retention. Colour: pale yellow, clear.

Aroma: well toasted corn flakes.

Taste: mild, slightly acid, malt, corn?

Appearance with golden color, clear liquid, without head of foam.
Faint aroma (malt).
Flavor too weak (more malt than hops). The intention here is to be fresh!

Aug2613 on the bottom of the can... WOW! This beer is "good" for another 600 years!

Appearance: Actually looks... very good. A creamy looking head. A nice pale golden color. Nice lacing ... and this is just what I saw when looking down into my can. This may have actually been worth pouring. MEH.

Smell: Sweet corn... what a shock. Not overly corny, though. Nothing metallic.

Taste/feel: Taste is pretty subtle... almost drinks like a light beer. Almost nothing there. Creamed corn would describe this best. Maybe some grain, but yeah. Not much. Not bad though. The feel is actually REALLY creamy to me, which is a bit weird for this beer... or any lager. It gets kind of foamy in my mouth. Eh.

Another AAL that I like more than the majority. Not a good beer by any means, but it doesn’t taste bad. The mouth feel was a surprise, though with the name "Genuine DRAFT" I should have actually expected it.

One of the better examples of the style.
There are beers for beer snobs and there are beers that aren’t. This is one of those. Unedifying and would be unmemorable but for the disappointment of having drunk it.

Beer for hot summer day or if you really thirsty . Pale golden color ,small white head. Aroma of corn. Light malty taste with minimal bitterness. Aftertaste is absent.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Clear, very pale yellow with a thin film off-white head and fair lacing. 

Aroma of rice and sweet corn. Not what you want to smell in a beer, but the aroma is so mild that it is not especially objectionable. 

Taste of water with a little creamed corn added. Fairly sweet and not at all bitter. 

Very light body and low carbonization.

OK, it's a macro, but I'm still surprised at how little this resembles beer. If you had told me it was corn soda, I would have believed you and might even have finished the bottle. But, I don't think I would have ever ordered it again. Sprite is much better and even has a citrus flavor.

Bottle - Fallen Angel, Cusco. Poured a pale straw yellow with some effervescence and a small but lasting rocky white head. Nondescript sweetness alongside grain, cereal, corn etc. On both aroma and palate. Light body, medium carbonation, short ’finish’.

Bottle in lounge at Geneva airport. No head but looks quite gassy. Tastes like cold tea gone off.

33 cl. clear bottle, brewed in "the EU" - where the h.ll is that? Clear, golden colour with a small, white head. Weak, grainy aroma with brewing cereals, adding unpleasant acidic notes, light pale malts. Artificial marzipan. Taste is...wait, there is a taste.. light sweet. Light body, thin texture and a lively carbonation. Short, sweet finish with syrup-like malts. Not enjoyable - Carlsberg Lager is far superior.

Pale golden, lots of bubbles, foamy white head. Cardboard. I don’t use this denomination often, but this is spot on. Light sweet grains, bit off putting. Watery body, light sweet, foaming texture. Very tasteless beyond that. Unpleasant malts too. Even worse than the other huge American macros. (33cl bottle from AH supermarket, brewed ’in the EU’, probably Ireland)

Clear Pale Yellow Color with a pretty foamy head and high carbonation; Leaves behind some pretty good lacing Nose consists of pale malts, cereal grains, corn and a slight yeast scent. Flavor has a strong malt/adjunct sweetness followed by cooked vegies, Body is light and the carbonation while, strong, isn’t as strong as Miller Lite’s. Nowhere near as offensive in terms of flavor or smell as Miller Lite but I still wouldn’t go out of my way for it unless it were free.
Its bland its boring, made to chug down your throat with no flavor. One of the most popular stale like beers in the USA beer market. Shame!
The less hideous of mainstream american lagers. Thats about it. Oh, 20 characters to go...

355 ml. bottle. Pours a clear yellow, head is rather thin. Aroma is of malt grain and light hints of fruit. Taste is of corn and malt bitterness. Pretty watered down. Aftertaste is of strong corn. Not terrible, certainly not great.

A clear 0.33l bottle. This is a crystal clear pale golden one with a small bubbly quickly sidesticking white top. Smells kinda sweet and I don’t the good old boiled vegetables. Not as horrible as I was expecting to be honest. Must be a fresh bottle. It’s almost lively, well at least above average on the carbonation and the mouthfeel is really thin and watery. Not surprisingly there is not even a trace of hoppy bitterness in this. It tastes a bit more like I was expecting. Corn and malt sweet with lots of grains. Why do people drink this, and why do they drink this more than once? It’s just not any good! 13.04.2013
Rigtig lyst øl med skum som forsvinner raskt. Litt søt og sitrusaktig smak. Supermarked.

The Aroma of the beer is that sweet undercover morning sex you get on your first day back from a long trip away from home, while the appearance sits as a beautiful Asian woman untouched by the foul hands of Hentai squid tentacles. The taste is a simple reminder of a better time when your wife actually listened to  you before you started drinking so much and gave you the head you deserve after not showering for 3 days right after she made you pork chops and a baked potato. It sits on your palate like a nice warm spit from a horse in the summer or if you prefer cold beer a nice rim job that you gave to a snowman. Over all drinking this is the best decision you could make, just like banging your neighbours daughter, Don’t worry she won’t tell dad.

330ml bottle courtesy of my son - I get why this is so maligned, but this is a decent enough clean beer, ideal for the BBQ on days like this. Enough has been said by the experts, but as far as mass produced pale lagers go, this is okay.

As a starter beer, this is the best out there. Clean taste with a crisp finish. Surprising head for a light beer with a nice balance of carbonation and water.Lacks any hpoppy taste one may hope for, but is very drinkable when compared to most domestic lights. Reminds me of high school.

I’m only buying this one because it has a special Christmas can leftover from December. Smells vaguely of rot at first, like rotting wood perhaps. When that’s gone, there’s a vague smell of grass. Taste is really bad. Like really awful. Not tasteless like Bud Light, but tasteful, full of something bad. Palate has an astringency that resides in a dry, icky aftertaste. And the can wasn’t even that nice.

One of the absolute worst beers I’ve ever tasted. Pungent odor, and flavors of sweat, salt, rotten yeast, and sadness.

One of the new beers in my local Albert Heijn supermarket. Clear glass bottle, with a twist-to-open crown cap. 330 ml of golden yellow beer, alcohol by volume stands at 4,7%. Produced and bottled in Europe, God knows where, under licence from MillerBrewing Company. I like the label, with the eagle flying holding some barleys with its claws. Ingredients include "selected cereal grains" and "hop products".
As I said, golden yellow colour, with one finger of head, kind of soapy in texture, quickly losing half of its height but keeping the remaining half finger for quite long. Lots of bubbles finding their way to the top.
Smell is very faint, some malts mostly and I think I smell rice. Does it contain rice? I don’t know, maybe rice is one of the selected cereal grains the label mentioned. Well, at least it doesn’t have the annoying corn smell.
Wow, fantastic taste! At the supermarket stands a label next to the bottle, recommending drinking it straight from the bottle. Allow me to disagree with that, I had a couple of sips and although the great taste is still there, is not so strong as when drinking it from a glass. Hmm, the more I drink it, the more conviced I am it contains some rice. So be it, they managed to give this beer a great taste.
On the body is as thin as someone would expect from a beer coming into a clear glass bottle. Very light carbonation, but it’s so drinkable.
Overall, I found this one to be a great beer. Too bad it costs 1,50 a bottle here. When I can afford this price for a bottle of lager at home, this would be among my preferences.
A little too flavorless for me. Only drink it if I have no choice, but at least is drinkable.

12 ounce bottle from a Kroger. As of now this is the most rated beer I haven’t personally rated. Pours a clear golden color with a medium sized frothy white head. Decent head retention. That’s about all I’ve got for this fella . . .

I like it, here in the UK it’s a creamy almost slightly sweet fizzy concoction with a cheeky tickle on the throat buds as it makes its way down my gullet. 33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Albert Heijn. Drank straight from the bottle. Golden yellow with a big head. Faint sweet grainy aroma. Grainy watery taste. Not really bad but absolutely boring.
330 ml bottle. The looks and aroma kind of trick you - this one scores ok on taste. I had a positive experience with this one. In general average, but considering my expectations, that’s good.
0,33 l bottle. A simple, mediocre and sweetish lager. Not bad and very easy to drink. There must be a reason why Miller became such a big company.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Refreshing, drinkable beer with medium bitterness and carbonation. Nothing special, but there are worse beers in the world.
Flaska Systembolaget. Klar gul vätska. Doft och smak av vitt bröd, hö och majs.
only rated for numbers. this beer is crap. it’s watered down malt liquor. blech, avoid at all costs

A pint of this amidst so many great beers in Helena. Pale golden orange. Richer than most of the pale american lagers, I guess. Pale apple, dry sparkling lager. Some flavor, and not the worst thing I’ve had.

Bottled and boring. Looks a nice golden shade, not much foam. Tastes like...watery beer, sorta, but completely devoid of any other notes. For the price though, what would you expect? But then again, you still have other better beers competing in that price range.
Aprueba, es lo único que puedo decir. Al contrario que la Bud, MGD es una cerveza con poco recorrido, muy al estilo de las Pale de "un poquito" más al sur de Wisconsin.
I don’t know how to describe it but with the words "sweet" and "thick". For me it just doesn’t taste like beer at all. The bottle was pretty cool though.
Very dull beer with a aroma and taste close to complete boredom. Looks great but misguides.
Beer Beer Nothing special just Lager. Its good clean but clearly nothing special.

Poured a clear pale golden yellow colour with a thin white foamy head that diminished quickly giving limited lacing. Medium to high carbonation with good bubble trails. Aroma of grain and malt sweetness. Taste of malt sweetness and grain with a mildly bitter finish. Light body. Aroma, tastes and palate comparable with other large commercial brewery lagers.
0.33l bottle. A clear golden lager with white head, good carbonation, soft fruity aroma with notes of corn, and lightly sour taste. A drinkable light beer.

Bottle: Pours a pale straw color with a decent head that fades to no real lacing. Aroma of grain and malt sweetness. Has a musty presence. Taste of malt sweetness and grain. has a mild bitterness and a dry finish. pretty boring. Light body, almost watery and has a bit of a rough edge. Pretty bland beer. Could have been worse.
bottle- A very bland beer, no hop or malt aromas to speak of. Beer flavoured water.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Golden coloured brew with an dry bitter taste, some hints of well hidden lemon.
hay, cereal, grass, watery thin beer, pale, clear, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, average carbonation,
if i could give this beer minus rating i would. smells off and like chemicals, taste and palate arent any better. awful.
Light aroma has hay mostly..not much to enjoy. Clear straw yellow, medium frothy head. Taste has hay and corn.  Thin, almost watery. Standard carbonation. Dry, medium  long finish. Nothing to enjoy.
If you like sweet light no malt/hop beer and no character, just water and a pinch of malt with corn boiled and called beer you will like this
Alcohol, floral, roasty, cooked vegetables, cooked vegetables, cheese, citrus, leaves, cooked vegetables, basement aromas, herbs, chocolate

Clear bottle, picked up from local supermarket. Drank it straight from the bottle, smell is really skunky with wet grass. Flavour isn’t  there, just carbonized water with slight sweet malty taste in the finish. Great thirst quencher for sure, but a really bad beer as well..
Beer snobs slay the big boys on this website, so giving one of my hometown staples an average-range rating will be heresy. So be it.

Botella. Tenía muchas expectativas con esta cerveza pero debo decir que me defraudo bastante. Tiene un aroma ligeramente ácido y no muy agradable al olfato. Cosa que su buena apariencia oculta. El sabor no es nada especial, no me dan ganas de seguirla tomando. Lo único que me sorpendió fue el alto y agradable nivel de cremosidad que mantiene. Con media pinta tuve suficiente.

Bottle. Pours a yellow body, with a low white head that diminishes very quickly, leaving a fair lace. Malty and corny aroma, as usual, and light bitter taste. Very light body, watery texture. Although it wasn’t so bad, the carbonation level was excessive. After drinking half of it, I was full.
Not a bad tasting beer. Smooth easy to drink and goes down smooth. But nothing special.
Had a lot of these last night, including a beer bong of it. Never once did I think it was tasty...
Light straw color; Light to medium body; Aroma & flavor of grain, light malt, and cereal; Fairly bland and watery as expected; Overall, in the same category as Bud for me.

33cl bottle from Meny. Pours clear golden with a minimal white head. Aroma of sweet grain with fruit and vegetables notes. Sweet and watery with just a tiny hint of bitterness. Possible to drink when it’s ice cold...
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.

We used to get this as an import-[canned ]a few more years ago than I really wish to recall.It was really a distinctive taste,especially compared to the mainstream garbage we had to endure then Sadly this has reappeared down under as a brewed under licence ’knock-off’. I would dearly like to try it in original draft form.The stuff [bottled] to be fair,looks great in the glass and is inoffensive taste wise-well there is bugger all of that!In any event I would prefer a session on this to any Carlton United product-no hops is a better option than those execrable ’Pride of Ringwood’ hops Carlton hold so dear.

Served ice cold in a bottle after climbing a 4000-meter mountain in Colorado, and it was delicious! Flavor and aroma was very much like the end result of a brewing process using barley and hops. It had alcohol in it, which produced mild relaxation. I wanted another one, and it was just as good. It was the capper to a very good day.

It was a beer, sheesh, why does it have to be so complicated?
Bouteille 341ml. Couleur jaune pâle translucide. Bière sans arôme, sans saveur, de l’eau avec des bulles mais en moins bon.

Bottle.  Looks fine for a lager.  Smell is almost nonexistent with a tint of skunkiness to it.  Tastes okay, but the skunkiness is a little aversive to the palate.  A low-level macro; I much prefer Budweiser to this, given the similar cost and availability.
Pours golden with slight head, aroma of skunking and custard. Watery with unleasant aftertaste. Not nice, instant drain pour
330ml bottle. I’m not gonna say anything about this beer. Simply because this would be an insult to water.
Flavorless, dull beer. Slightly better than most American swill, but only slightly.
Poured a very pale gold with a green tint and minimal head. The Aroma was weak as well with some grainy notes. Flavor was non existent, seriously tasted a bit like carbonated water.
Originally my favorite macro brew, but got over it quickly. It’s way better than Lite, but what isn’t? Things seem better than they are when you’re 19.
Good thirst quencher with much more flavor than the other American light lager beer. A slight sweetness and nice malty flavor. Also fits well with spicy foods.
12oz can - pours typical pale lager. Flavor is light malt, corn and a little hoppy. Almost no taste. Drinkable.

Die Schaumkrone hält nicht so gut. Der erste Schluck schmeckt nach Wasser mit sehr viel CO², erst im Nachgeschmack kommt etwas Hopfen und Maltosesirup zum vorschein. nicht mein Geschmack
	
Test vom 24.4.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 5,2,2,1,5,1 - 1,90

This is Miller’s answer to Michelob and they have done a fine job of managing to hide most traces of beer.  Nothing offensive, just not enough there for me to really enjoy.  But if handed to me, I will drink this beer.
Quite a watery and grainy beer... the bad taste of this beer is perpetuated further by the clear bottle which ensures a ’skunkfest’... avoid at all costs unless your stuck between this and stella!

June 2008: Thank God there were only four different Miller beers for me to find in Tobago. I bought all four at the same time, what a mistake to make! This one was marginally the best in a pretty crap bunch.

12oz can poured into a half pint tumbler it looked as pale and insipid as the ’Miller Lite’ I’d just flushed down the toilet. The white head left before I had chance to look at it and if there was an aroma from the beer it didn’t hang around long either.

There was a mild beer taste and more body than the other Miller products, but it is not an American brewery that I’ll re-visit in a hurry.
Bottle from super market. Golden color, medium white head. Smooth, bland taste with a hint of malt. Very water like beer.
Basic grainy flavour with some bitterness in there. Rather bland, like one would expect.

Originally reviewed: 7/20/09. Grabbed a 24oz can of this at the grocery store the other night. For $1.29, why not? 

Poured into my pilsner glass a crystal clear light yellow with a massive frothy off-white head on top. Excellent retention, looked like a milkshake. Tons of spotty lacing all over the glass. This is a really pretty beer. I’m impressed. Smells of corn, slight breads, and a touch of honey. 

The mouth is pretty slick and wet. Flavor is really mellow and bland. Some husky grains in the mouth that finishes a tad sweet. Bitterness is low to absent. I could drink a few of these on a camping trip, or after a day in the yard. I thought this was much better than the "High Life" counterpart. Not bad.
Bottle and Can. Light color, minimal head. Light aroma. Light taste. I guess it met my low expectations.

12oz can poured into a shaker. Pours a clear pale yellow with some bright white head. Aroma of corn and maybe a little malt. Taste is about the same. Corn, malt and metal. Light bodied with a thin texture. Fizzy carbonation and not much of a finish. Overall, it’s better than Miller Lite.
The aroma is the biggest negative.  It helped to hold my nose.  Compared to better beers, it has a dirty, chemical flavor.  It has a bit of body, decent coloring, and retains its lacing nicely.
Not really distinguishable from other macros. Looks, smells, tastes and feels the same.
Bottle. I won’t be my favourite beer. Very light aroma, colour, head and taste... boooring pale lager
Tastes like plastic. Golden, clear, small white head. Slightly sweet. Malty and starchy aroma.
Barva: středně zlatá, pěna bílá, řídká, nedržící. Vůně: sladová, Chuť: zenitá sladová jen s jemným hořkým akcentem. Pivu chybí říz.

Bottle. Hot day, so picked up a lager. Yellow, generous white fizz. Mid corn on the nose. Not a great deal in the mouth, bar a little corn hop and a mouthful of suds. Quenched thirst, but sparked no interest.

Cracked one open by the pool (hot ass FL sun!). Nothing much in the scent, perhaps only wheat and metal. The high carbonation is the refreshing part as long as it’s cold, otherwise the moldy-hop and soggy-leaf twang ruins the palate in confusion. Not too bad... though terrible.
Not the worst of the beers out there. A bit more of a golden color than most, but little flavor.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Some sweet corn on the nose. Very light taste, but with a hint of malt. Not my kind of thing at all, but the closest thing to a beer amongst the cheap American lagers I’ve tried recently.

St. Patty’s Day crap beer at a party. This is crap. Don’t get me wrong. However, compared the other crap I’ve drunk today, MGD isn’t that bad. In a pinch with nothing else around, I’d drink it. The light beers, I’d probably just stay sober rather than drink. MGD had a little bit of a hop taste, and it didn’t have such a watery consistency as the light beers. 

Crap Beer Joke: What’s the difference between a pig and an American domestic beer? One sleeps in crap, the other is crap.
Expected worse. Actually some taste. Pours golden. Sweet taste. Vegetable and pineapple aroma.
It’s may be because I am Dutch, but these popular American beers don’t appeal to me much.
Pours a boring yellow but with a decent frothy white head. Aroma is cereal grain. Taste is about the same leading to a mild sourness. Not good stuff although I’d drink it over Budweiser.
12 oz bottle pours yellow with a white head.  Aroma is of grains.  Taste much of the same.  Basic beer.

330ml bottle.  The smell of this beer is of cooked vegetable and not much else.  The taste is probably the worst part, again more vegetable, sweetness and virtually no hop presence.  Avoid unless you want to get drunk cheap or are at a college party.
Bottle, made in EU. Pale yellow, tiny head. Weak aroma of corn. Heavily carbonated. Taste has some vegetables and corn. I find it difficult to analyse this any further.
Light yellow color with some head that wears off. Aroma is very corny and sweet. Taste is somewhat bland though.

From a 330ml bottle on 26/2/2012. Pours a very pale yellow with a medium head. Has a very slight stale grainy aroma. There’s very little flavour to speak  other than alittle sweetness. If hops were used for this, it’s been well hidden. An awful pale lager.

I’ve heard some harsh words used about this beer, it’s really not as bad as some people are making it out to be. It’s a very light and lightly malty beer both in colour, aroma and mouthfeel/taste, it’s very clear and keeps a light head. As far as mainstream lagers are, it may lack slightly in taste but is very refreshing when served cold and more enjoyable than most other standard mainstream lagers, carlsberg, carling etc...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and it’s not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!


Rated during Wrestlemania 2008!!!
Der Geruch ist schonmal recht annehmbar. Der erste Geschmack ist garnicht mal übel. Aber der Nachgeschmack geht garnicht!!! Schon fast ekelhaft und penetrant süß. Zum Glück hält er nicht lange an. Zum Mittelteil wird das Miller Genuine Draft etwas besser, aber trotzdem nicht sonderlich erwähnenswert. Wenn nix anderes da is trink ich auch Millers, aber wenns sich vermeiden lässt freif ich lieber zu ner Alternative...

355ml bottle pours a pale straw color with a small white head and no lacing.  Aroma is light grains and faint hops.  Taste is light malt sweetness and an undesirable hop bitterness.  One of the worst beers I have tried to date.
dough, floral, cooked vegetables, caramel, pale, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel,

Better than regular Miller High Life, which is not saying much.  Slightly sweet, floral aroma with average carbonation.  Syrupy flavor, very faint hop flavor.  Floral finish.  Would not buy with my own $.

Quite possibly the greatest concoction man has ever created. Even the name is wonderful. MGD. Just say it and see how it rolls off of the tongue. Every time I walk into a bar, the first thing I ask is whether or not they stock MGD. If the answer is no then I’m outta there faster than two shakes of a lamb’s tail. All in all I think this beer perfectly captures the essence of my bad-ass lifestyle.
Well not much more to say than crap. Idk who would ever be happy drinking it.. sucks!
A malty aroma with corn and alcohol scents. The appearance is that of a decent but unremarkable pale lager. The taste is sweet, but gross. Watery. I avoid it. It’s gross.
Beer that was available at a patry. Had it out of a can, but didnt think it would matter. Really nothing to describe except for an aftertaste of corn. Quite watery.

10 YEARS OF 2PAC "i dont mind this beer. its very easy drinking, and goes down well when your really thirsty." -2pac.   I have to agree with 2pac here, it does go down well when you are thirsty and it is very easy to drink.  Basically it’s like carbonated water with a hint of corn syrup and yellow #5.
Better characteristics than most of the other US popular national beers, but overall a weak brew.
We have in Ecuador only corn or rice commercial beer, and now they are beginning to sell this one, nonsense, one of the worst beers I have ever drink, it is in second place after " the Beast"

Let’s start with the positives of this ’genuine’ American draft beer (which, for UK customers, is brewed and bottled in Woking): this smells faintly of beer.  Not much else going for it.
