It pours a flat, rather unappetitising off-yellow colour which one doesn’t usually associate with beer - although it does mean you may recognise it on the way out.  The taste is a carbonated, watery mess - like you’d expect if you drank most of a decent pint, left the dregs overnight, then filled it up with sparkling water the next morning.  Truly atrocious.

355 ml bottle.
Clear bright yellow, fading white head. Sweet corny grainy malt aroma and taste. No hopped, high carbed. Crisp and refreshing. Designed for mass consumption by the masses. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
Light golden color with thin low head. Corny aroma. Taste is thin but with fine corn taste. good easy-drinking beer from the U.S. - amazing what you can use corn for.
Refrigerated bottle.  Little lacing medium/light carbonation, and light body.  Taste is light malt.  Boring.

Pure piss! Tis very much a xmas gargle. 10 quid for 30 bottles? Say no more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tastes like plastic. Golden, clear, small white head. Slightly sweet. Malty and starchy aroma.
Bottle sample. This beer is nice to look at but there’s not much taste or flavour.

330mL bottle.  Pours pale straw with a short lived small white head.  Faint aromas of malt and grassy hops.  Very subdued flavours.  Light body, average carbonation and a fairly short finish.  Very drinkable, at least.
It poured a clear golden color with a small white head. The aroma was notes of bread and grains. The taste was watery with a hint of malt and hops.
2011 - 12 - 23 330ml bottle clear light golden colour. almost no (white) head. malty, soapy aroma. light bitter taste.

A slight upgrade over Miller Lite so 0.1 increase over my rating of that is well deserved.  Wait a minute, I just got an idea for an April Fools beer tasting, a garbage pale lager party with the joke being people come over thinking it will be an imperial stout tasting.
What is there to say?  This is a hot day palate washer, nothing more.  Looks like corn, smells like corn.
33cl bottle. Pale golden colour with minimal white head. Aroma is corny and moderate malty. Flavour is mainly corny and sweet. Carbonation is medium. Boy is light.

Originally rated November 2005. Comes in a clear bottle with 4.7% ABV written on the label. They also have the 5% ABV (brewed by Molson) at the LCBO. Pours a clean straw yellow colour with a small creamy-fizz white head. Retention is decent (for such a small head), so is the lacing. Sweet malt nose and smooth watery mouthfeel. The taste starts off with cereal malt and end on a big corn finish. Slight sweetness and a clean aftertaste. Not a bad swill, quite refreshing and a good alternative when you want a Miller... and they are out of High Life.
Smooth - Crisp beer. No discernible flavors that jump out at you. A typical American lager - not a horrible beer, just nothing really memorable about it either

Even if i tasted it blindfolded i could definitely tell that this is an American beer...... just classic American.... very light beer, easy to drink. Good in a hot summer. Yeasty taste, and smooth beer... Not bad....
Bottle. Yellow colour with a bubbely head. Light light malt aroma, and hints of taste...

Poured from a tall boy can into a pilsner glass. Color was pale golden and clear. Lots of frothy head, maybe 1 ¼ inches. Lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom. Healthy amount of lacing on the top. Surprisingly a lot of film on the sides. 

Smelled of corn malts, somewhat skunky. Seemed to be a grainy grassy smell, too.

I would say corn malts led the way, but there was no aftertaste. 

Light body. Think texture. Fizzy carbonation (lots). Abrupt finish. Clean, crisp and refreshing. 

I’ve had this many times, but after starting to rate beers over the past four months, I thought this would be lower. Not too bad when compared other similar types (cheap beer).
Mannnnnn...this is pretty crap. Elliot prefers this over Pure Blonde and him and Jez are at ends about it. It’s a funny fight

Slightly better than the average pale lager but not by much.
Drinkable when cold.
olor suave y al paladar suave,tipica cerveza para tomar en cantidad sin degustarla

#1164
Kaum zu glauben, dass das Bier sein soll!? Gefärbtes Wasser triffts eher! Da ist überhaupt kein Genuß. Herr Ober, ein Wasser bitte!
By the way warum gibts hier eigentlich keine 0-Punkte-Skala?

2 Nov 2011, 24 oz can. pale yellow, clear, some bubbles, frothy white head. straw lager aroma. thin body and mildly fizzy. soft lemon citrus lager. nothing special. it hit the spot after 5 hours of moving boxes but i prefer lagers to be a bit crisper.

Bottle:
Medium, quick disappearing white head on top of a clear golden yellow colored beer.
Smell is sweet, malty and some hints of herbs.
Taste is malty, grainy, corny and light bitter.
Not the worst of its kind, but comes close…

Drank from bottles at a friend’s poker party. Clear yellow color with white foam. Obvious off-flavors from adjunct sugars. No sign of hops. As with so many macro light lagers, all you can say is that when freezing cold, it’s crisp, dry, and goes down (somewhat) easy.
Pale gold, almost no head. Nasty grainy aroma. The taste is vaguely grainy and very watery topped off by very weak hops. Ugh. This isn’t for drinking, this is for pounding down very fast.

Bottle at Junior’s.  Pale straw-colored with minimal head, aromas of stale wheat, sugar, and hay.  The flavor is sweet, with straw upfront and some mild hops in the finish.  Pretty high carbonation, so not even that drinkable, for me.  [830]

Bottle 33cl. A clear yellow colour with a small, off-white head. An aroma of malt, fruit and hops. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter. A light body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation and an abrupt finish.
Bottle at home. Clear golden pour, no head. Grainy aroma and similar slightly sour grainy taste. Yuck.
In a pinch this beer will do. While it is nothing special, it is better than soda. Pours a pale gold, I prefer it out of the bottle. week malty front, tiny hop bitterness in the finish.

Bottle at home

 Very pale (not bud pale), very thin white head that doesn’t last. Smells a bit of boiled veggies, also some alcohol and marzipan. Taste has a very clear malt taste but not too pleasent. At least there is some taste. Some unpleasent bitterness in finish. WTF, i’ve never ever experienced a bad bitter taste in a beer before, but here it doesn’t feel right.
Good for one thing and one thing only and that is for getting drunk. If you have a choice,find something different.

Can’t comment on the head as this is the type of beer I don’t consider worthy of pouring into a glass. Miller’s patented cold-filtering process seems excellent at removing anything that’s even remotely beer-like. This smells very lightly of bread or hay, tastes slightly sweet, has no finish, and is almost lighter in body than water. On the plus side, it’s not too carbonated. What I will say is that it’s not a bad tasting beer. It’s just very, very bland.

Bottle, 2nd March 2011, San Francisco. Free bottles at a games industry event. Terrifying to think that people go through their entire lives thinking this is decent beer. Watery yellow colour, tastes of nothing, smells of wet cardboard (but not very strongly). The epitome of macro lager.
Standard tasteless American swill.  At the end of the glass it begins to accumulate a bit of a sour aftertaste in your throat

355mL South African version. The pour is a clear straw with a large, suddy white head. Decent enough for macro pale lager. Nose is small detergent, lemon, yellow apples albeit barely there. Taste is bland, suddy, watery, nondescript. Suddy, watery palate. Nothing really there. Could be mistaken for lemon toilet water.

Another shameless American macro. That’s the best thing about America. We’re currently making the best beers in the world, and at the same time making the worst. I’d drink MGD to get drunk on and that’s about it, and that’s only if it’s my only option...including NA beers...
2/10 i mörkhet. Luktar lätt maltigt, bubbligt besk och lite söt i smaken med en besk eftersmak.
This beer is really pretty decent, but still nothing much to it.  I like some more complexity.
Bière cristalline, couleur de paille, sans trop de col.  Des arômes effacés de céréales, de riz, avec une impression de boisé.  Légèrement acide.  Légère, mince, à la fin instantanée.  Sans intérêt.

In bottle at a University of Edinburgh garden party. Pours a blonde colour with a fair white head. Aroma and flavours of caramel, yeast and barley. Quite refreshing with a short, crisp finish. Moderate carbonation and a light CO2 prickle. I actually went back for another, however, there was only this, Budweiser and Corona on offer.

Nach dem Einschenken stellt sich ein sehr brauseartiges Erscheinungsbild ein. Kein Schaum, viel grobes co2. 
Geruch muffig und herb. Geschmack unangenehm prickelnd auf der Zunge. Die leichte Bittere wird vollkommen von einem pilzartigen Aroma überdeckt. Mehliger Abgang. 
Dieses Bier ist eine absolute Entgleisung. Überhaupt nicht empfehlenswert.Test vom 18.8.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Aroma is mainly old urinal with some bowling alley thrown in. However looks pretty, faint gold. Taste is better than aroma although is mainly corn sugar. Mouthfeel is decent, although there is a vague acidicy to it. Finish is all corn.  Really not a terrible beer would do fine in a BBQ or Absolute Last Beer Of The Night situation. However is largely forgettable and would probably not ask for another.
I would prefer a good clean water rather than this. On top range of commercial beers but its chemical.....   buy a decent beer or vodka this one is for kids who want to get drunk and piss all corners

473 ml can in the orphan bin at LCBO, served cold in a tulip glass. 



App.:  Clear light golden with a surprisingly decent bright white head.
  
Aroma:  Light sulphur, canned corn, some grain/cereal notes, a touch of fruitiness, more sulphur, not pleasant.
  
Palate:  Medium body, moderate+ carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Much less sulphur, more canned corn/DMS, then nondescript grain/cereal, maybe a wee lemon hint?, minerals; dry with minimal bitterness and a not entirely unpleasant finish with wisps of biscuit malt.



Coulda been worse?

Maybe it was the sitting on a lake on a hot day...but I actually kinda enjoyed it.  I’m as surprised as anyone.  I could actually get a little lemony/citrus hop in it.  Not much flavour, not much aroma, no finish.  It’s uncomplicated but it did just what it was meant to do.
What can you say about this beer? Light and watery without any character or anything worth drinking about it.

Why is this stuff even called "Beer"? We drank it as kids because we were stupid and only wanted to get drunk. Too bad it took Americans so long to finally realize what real beer is. This piss-water is a rank above Budweiser, but that’s not sayin much.
Bottle, pours clear golden with small white head... aroma some hay and very little hops..flavor ...is pretty much non existing .... is it beer..... that is all..
Very standard pilsener or pale lager. Nice clear golden color, not the best smell and a very average taste. Nothing special indeed, but not a complete disaster.
not a bad beer for the price but nothing special. would rather spend a little extra tho and get somthing more enjoyable.
330ml bottle.  Pours light gold with a thin head.  Aroma is corn and vegetables.  Taste is thin and watery, corn and veg.
its drinkible                but would not waste my money on it coz thers mch better beers for pretty much the same price

Enjoyed during an afternoon 4th of July weekend backyard BBQ at my Mom’s house in Crystal Lake, IL.  Drank from can.  I know people have a first beer and I’d assume a lot of people had MGD as their first beer.  I think that’s an unfortunate thing.  Drinking this, I had the same inkling that I was drinking my first beer ever, it really does have that kind of taste where it’s stale bread water.  I wouldn’t recommend drinking this beer.
473ml plastic bottle. Corn taste on the center of my tongue, surounded by water. Sweet smell, same colour in as out.
pours a very pale yellow with a small white head. cereals, wheat, some honey sweetness, alcohol, very light herbal hopping, light body, aggressive carbonation.

This is a beer?
No aroma.  Tastes like golden garbage.  Looks like, well, yellow water.
Bottle. Drank lots at my fathers wake. Not much to this beer but it did the job on the day

It was my best beer some years ago when I was a beginner. It has a very soft aroma and taste. I thought that this is the so-called american beer. But now I know, that the USA has a lot of microbreweries with better beers. The only problem that I am in Europe and I can’t try that beers...

Eigentlich passabel. Auf jeden Fall, solange man die Flasche ungeöffnet lässt und sich das Bier nur anschaut, dort bekommt es die einzigen Pluspunkte. Es sieht gut aus, auch wenn die durchsichtige Flasche an Alkopops erinnert. Der Geruch ähnelt dem Geschmack: Kaum Aroma, etwas süßlich. Nachgeschmack Fehlanzeige. Bei diesem hohen Preis sollte das Bier verboten werden! 	 
Test vom 13.9.2004, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,2,3,1,7,3 - 3,45
Ugly cat pee water. Nothing : no head, no taste so no reason to drink this at all.

Where to start, where to start.  Corn-centric, yet both burny and watery, as if you’re eating Silver Queen while drinking Perrier and using a hair dryer.  The good thing about this beer is that it does look appealing when backlit, but only when the Black Keys are playing on the house p.a.  Still, better than Budweiser.  (1/08)

Bottle 33cl a clear yellow beer with high carbonation and medium head with very thin structure. Nose is low mostly hopy. Aroma is low too, very watery low malty notes, corn sugar presence, almost no hops, low bitterness too. A poor beer in any direction.
nice beer. nothing to much to write about. good amount of flavour and nice finish.
Pale yellow/straw color. Corn, cereal, sweet aroma. Taste corn, malt, watery with little flavor. MF thin carby. Blah.
Bottle (European version). Pale yellow colour. The head small and shortlived. Aroma of sweet corn and wet cardboard... Taste neutral to sweet with some bitterness, especially in the finish.
Bottle. Clear yellow with a small dissipating white head. Aroma is faint, but odd - notes of corn, cardboard and something... Taste is malt, water and carbonation. Don’t waste your time.
(Bottle 11/5-2011) Head fade very quickly, yellow, fairly high CO2. Very close to water.
Bottle@O’Hare Airport, Chicago. Pours pale golden with a great white head leaving nice lacing. Aroma is sweet, malty and somewhat artificial. Flavor follows the aroma, not much finish to talk about.

Before I can bottle feed my son with pumped breast milk from the fridge, I first need to warm the milk to body temperature. The easiest way to check if the temperature is right is to drip a couple of drops into my mouth. The downside is of course that then I also taste the cloyingly sweet stuff, and if the milk has been in the fridge for a couple of days it taste even worse. If the milk has been stored for too long it tastes really bad, and into the drain it goes. I suspect that Miller keeps pumped breast milk in a too warm refrigerator for a week or two, before it is mixed into their beer. That must be the reason why the smell of the MGD is strikingly similar to that of stale breast milk, and what is even more scary is that the flavours are of too old breast milk as well. Along with some sugary corn flakes. A good thing is that both the aroma and the flavour is very weak, so it is actually possible to empty a bottle without getting sick. Not that it matters, but it pours a pale golden, clear and sparkling body with a small, white frothy fully lasting head. The reason why the head was still present as I emptied my glass, is of course that I drank this ghastly liquid as fast as I could. It’s definitely not Miller time for me any time soon.

[33 cl bottle, Meny, Carl Berner, Oslo]
ugly pee water, the nose is light skunk and corn... doesn’t taste terrible but no real reason to drink this at all
Gimme a break. This ain’t beer. It’s colored seltzer water. Good city, Bad beer. One quarter burppppp.Yuck.
Draught. Aroma and taste of metal and corn. The only good thin about the crappy taps at the bar was that i get to add another rating to my list. yuck.

It looks like a golden lager - no head and carbonation. The nose is of unpleasant sweetcorn and vegetable oil. The chilled vegetable oil effect is repeated on the palate. There is a watery start and a rough finish. Very unpleasant indeed.

It’s certainly not tragic. I’ve had worse and it’s reasonably well priced. A mild indistinct aroma, refreshing taste, indifferent palate and the appearance of a golden ice cold lager which is refreshing. Probably a little generous with the ratings but it’s not a bad beer.
One of the first beers I ever had, not much flavor but rather drinkable. They were always a cheap choice while camping.
My favorite as a teenager. Aroma not to offensive despite the clear bottle. Looks like piss and is very easy to drink. But better then bud and coors. I have many memories with this one.
Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet and grainy. Flavor is medium sweet with a barely noticeable bitterness. sweet finish. Soft, watery and thin bodied. A really crappy lager. 250810

0.33, after two excellent israeli micros, my brother suddenly found this at the back of the fridge."We must finish it", he pleaded, well, i had no choice, though i was concerened about my health. Almost no head, clear piss yellow colour, grainy fruity aroma, sweetish grainy flavour with a hint of honey in the back, and a cereally sourness, almost no bitterness, unpleasant sour aftertaste. Well at least my teeth didn’t fall off.
Incredibly watery, no reall flavors at all except water.  Used to think was a decent beer, not now after having much, much better beers, but at least it wasn’t vile or anything.
Okay. It’s better than lite beer. But not by much. Why would anyone buy this? With so many great beers in the North East who do stores even stock it? Advertising revenue>
Bottle 330ml. Pours clear, pale golden with almost no white head. Aroma is skunk, rotten corn. Taste is fizzy, slightly bitter, light sweet. Light body, watery, soft to average carbonation.
Disgusting. No good flavors whatsoever. Smells like rotting corn. I’m not even sure how you can call it draft beer when it is in a bottle or a can.

33cl bottle. First is very corny (citric and sweet), and from the second gulp it is simple sweet and sweet. A thin of smoke, and no hop you can feel. Foam is OK, appearance is good, but price is high for this ’beer’.
Original beer that brings back college memories. Beer has a bitter taste and bad aroma. Drink ice cold on a summer day. Recommend a different beer

12 oz. bottle from in-laws fridge.

Ar:  Aroma is pretty stale.  Maybe a touch of honey, almost nothing going on.
Ap: Pours a translucent gold with a 1" white head that actually holds up reasonably well.  Decent lace too.  Well I’ll be damned.
T:  Pretty sweet up front, no surprise.  The finish has almost no bitterness, and leaves no aftertaste.  Not overly offensive.
P:  Very fizzy.  I’ve always found the carbonation levels in these beers a bit strange, as they fill you up pretty quickly.

O:  Standard and inoffensive.  Better than I thought it would be.
actually not that bad nice and refreshing went well with tacos cheap and good

Bottle (330ml): Pretty much no aroma here, just a clean chemical & grain like smell that you have to struggle to detect at all.        Straw coloured & crystal clear with almost no head & a couple bubbles rising to the surface.

Quite bland with grain, corn & cereal dominating the mix. Not much else to report really. It’s not unpleasant but does lack flavour.

Very light bodied & incredibly smooth & easy to drink. Also has a slight tang that isn’t too unpleasant.

Not up to much compared with most other beers reviewed here. In it’s favour is that it is cheap & not unpleasant. About on par with most other mass-market pale lagers.

(More at: 
)
Flaske 33 cl. Lys gul, svag aroma og smag, med noter af malt. Let drikkelig øl uden den store smag.

it had a funny wheat taste with that malted barley. back 30 years ago that provided a certain substance to the brew. it was perception from the taste kinda like a rotten egg but just noticeable as it went with the watery sweetness. that golden color helped to. a bit yeasty i guess and it went down good with the shots. a point on the aroma for that gimmick. i thought it was a decent summer beer before corona came around reinvented the summer brew.
Clear bottle. Barely any flavour at all. Not really worth the money. Better light beers out there.
Quite watery  and not a great tasting beer, but is easy to drink when its cold.
i cant figure out why people pay a premium for this, its not only that it didnt have flavour, it tastes skunky too. just bad
Light yellow, light bodied, bland, watery, tastes like piss. Why would anyone drink this.
Can. Pale, clear, pop-like head. Smells and tastes like buttered popcorn. Not good.
Looks and smells ok, but tastes weird, reminds me of what I imagine a pubs beer soaked carpet would taste like if it were rung out
Bottle pours gold with a white head.  I’m not quite sure why i’m doing this to my tastebuds while I have better beer around.
Great appearance Highly carbonated, bubbles like Mr. Bubbles. It has a grassy I would agree taste and very light like a light beer actually. Easy to drink when cold.
Bottle. Decent appearance with clear gold color and thin white head. Very simple light taste with some sweetness.

Pours pale golden. Aroma of corn and... burned porridge. I don’t understand this. The aroma is absolutely foul. Did not excpect that. Flavour of corn and more foulness. Watery. Possibly the worst beer I have ever had.

Tap @ Timbers, Denver, Co. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma is weak malt and grassy hops. Taste is caramel , malt and grassy hops, all very toned down. Thin watery body.  Drinkable, but bland and boring. 011210
In my humble opinion, I feel like the best of the big three are Miller products, and MGD is no exception.  Bubbly and refreshing, it’s a pretty good session beer.

A: Straw colored with a white head. Okay lacing.

S: Lots of cereals and adjuncts. Some nuttiness.

T: Slightly sweet and nutty, but not in a good way. The faint nuttiness is like really old peanut butter with barely any of the sugar.

M: Light-to-medium body with a moderate amount of carbonation. Strange aftertaste.

D: One of the worse macros. Would be one of my last choices even if being used back in college for a drinking game.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 05-02-2009
Slightly sour flavor of butterscotch. Watering flavor with hints of caramel and malt. Buttery aftertaste. Disgusting!
Bottle. Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma has notes of bread and grains. Taste is watery with a hint of malt and hops.

Aroma of malts, grass and corn.  Appeared a clear yellow with some lace in the bottle.  Taste was of malt and corn with mild hops - pretty similar to ’High Life.’   Thin mouthfeel.  Overall, an  expected mass-produced brew to satisfy the masses.  A decent lawnmower beer or for those ocassional sesssion.

A pale yellow color. Minimal head. A slightly sour taste. Minimal after taste. Not terribly good nor terribly bad. Miller High Life would be a step up from this. It’s OK to drink casually not much beyond that.
Not a bad macro brew.  Found it to be rather refreshing.  Not great but serves its purpose.

average frothy white head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. clear thin light yellow body. aroma: light bread, moderate hoppy, honey. if: moderate sweet and light bitter; ff: moderate sweet and bitter; average duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation and metallic finish. bom amargor de lúpulo sobrepujado por dulçor de mel, acima da média, toques BP, saborosa, bem trabalhada

Nota: 8 skol

Wow, is this bad.  Got one today for the train ride home so that I could remember what it’s like to review it.  YUCK!  It was undrinkable until I found some sunflower seeds to provide saltiness.  Then it went from undrinkable to just unpleasant.
341 ml clean bottle - Yellow color, medium head. Little taste with a chemical note. Very light beer easy to drink but average.
No, not really. This is not what I want usually.  It is adjuncty and not terribly pleasant. Serving: Bottle

Bottle @ home. Pale golden pour, small head. Aroma had some malt.
Flavour is a bit malty sweetness, not much going on.
Bottled, 0.33l. Yellow color with almost no white head. Aroma light malty, grain. Taste, watery, hints of hops. Very bad beer.

355 ml bottle. Rated @ 9.6.2009.

Pale yellow colour. Corn and malts on the taste. Flavour of pils malts. Light bodied. Truly this represents a true innovation in American brewing.
Bottle. Golden with small white head. Flavour is very malty, sweet and watery.

Pours a pure white, two-finger head that goes quickly to a ring and leaving some lace. Medium carbonation and light bodied. Crystal clear pale straw color. Nose is ?? - no skunkiness. Flavor is sweet corn and grass. Squeaky clean finish. Good lawn mower beer. Better than MGD 64 light but that isn’t saying much. $1.25 for a 12oz bottle from Colonial Spirits, Acton, MA.
12 ounce bottle.  Pours a light gold with a small white head.  Very faint sweet aroma.  Tastes like sweetened water.  Just not much there.
Bottle: Pale with a thin white head that disappears fast. Aroma of the cereal grain.  Finish is dry with a slight hop aftertaste
Pours golden with fizzy white head, aroma of grain, corn, and some touches of biscuit.  Taste is corn, hay, cereal, and some pils malt finishing a bit bitter from the booze and malt.  Passable.
Very easy drinking taste. Pours with a lot of head and goes away fast. Good for a drink once in a while

12 oz. can.
Pours a very clear, light golden color with some active carbonation. A somewhat dense, fluffy head is somewhat tall at first, and sticks around respectably before completely fading. Lacing is pretty solid. 
Medium bodied, not as watery as most American macros.
Pours clear yellow.  This beer reminds me of when I first started drinking.  A pale lager that is mass produced with no character.

Clear light yellow color, not much head with a little lacing. Scent is mostly barley, grains, and corn. Good taste, a little too much of a corny taste.
Light and fairly thin, not a lot of carbonation for this type of beer.
Pours a pale medium yellow, mild sweetness, mild grain flavor, hints of cereal.
This beer is good if you want to go buy a keg of it and have a party. I enjoy party beers only because they are good for two reasons 1) Its beer 2)Its cheap.
I’d say this is one of the best American macro-brews.  But that ain’t saying much.  Makes a good source for a beer brine though.

Clear bottle, 355 ml, drunk at Bywards Taps (Ottawa airport), savoured January 19 2010; eye: golden, clear, light effervescence, tiny ring of tan head; nose: corn, adjunct, caramel; mouth: assaulting, corn, adjunct, caramel, finale in corn, quite carbonated, light body, harsh texture, rather sweet; overall: once is enough

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille transparente, 355 ml, 4,7 %, bue chez Bywards Taps (aéroport d’Ottawa), savourée le 19 janvier 2010; œil : dorée, claire, légère effervescence, petit anneau de mousse fauve; nez : maïs, additif, caramel; bouche : agressant, maïs, additif, caramel, finale en maïs, très carbonatée, corps léger, texture rugueuse, plutôt sucrée; en résumé : une fois, c’est assez
Swill. Just like its closest competitors. At least its got some beer taste to it
bottle. nice yellow color, slim head, very light taste with no interesting tones.

Draught at the Delta club, Detriot airport. Very pale yellow color. Slight aroma o fruit, gumballs, and cardboard. Light malt flaovr, creamy, with cardboard and slight grassy hops. Clean, light, and watery.

Consumed at a wedding reception, on draft. Aroma of grass and metal. Appearance is golden carbonated body with foamy white head. Flavor matches the nose. Palate is something that other beers have. Well, what do you expect?
mgdmusic can, thanks to dean, clear light yellow with rocky white foam, fruit and vegetable aroma, sweet corn syrup flavor

Another beer mammoth up for rating. Pours a dishwash pale color with a head that vanishes so quickly I can’t recollect anything else about it. Smell is corn starch and hints of cooked veggies. Taste is cereals, corn syrup, sweet malts. And not much else. Pretty bland, but not unpleasant of faulty in its makeup, Millers Genuine Draft is not as bad as the rating suggests - I suppose it’s a case of craft beer antagonism finding proper outlets. On the other hand, it’s definitely not anything near a treat, either.

Ummm its MGD.  It ain’t no champagne of beers, nor is it the king of beers, and its certainly not the coldest of beers.  But its got that fresh from the tap taste ... you know what I mean?
I mean it’s MGD and I realized I hadn’t rated it yet so at the Nats game its what I ordered.
Right, this isn’t on the top of my list, but I could certainly drink it if I didn’t want to think about it.  Another beer that I can’t say is BAD because it just doesn’t taste like much.

A - Fruity and yeasty
A - Light yellow white thin white head
T - Light sweetness
P - Thin with soft carbonation
O - If I was thirsty....

Bottle 33 cl. Golden, clear with a small white head, almost no sparkling, dead. Aroma; malty with some sence of grain. Flavor; wow, well I don’t know, light sweet, bad old malt sence, not good taste at all....

For some reason my guitarist in the band Ladon started buying this instead of High Life. It tastes entirely different and costs a few coins extra. It’s uh, pretty decent I guess. Overpriced but other than that it’s a good clean drinking lager. I’m sure just about everyone has had this at one point or another so I’ll just say that I found this to be about as average as a butterface blonde on a drunken friday night.
Pretty boring but drinkable beer. The aftertaste is almost metal. Really no better than Coors Light and the rest of them.

12 oz. bottle. Small white head on a clear, golden yellow body. Initial aroma was mildly offensive but thankfully dissipated. Nose is lightly sweet. Taste is lightly sweet as well. Flavor is sweet grain, maybe a little toast, very watery. Thin body with lively carbonation. Finish is the same mild sweetness. Aside from an initial aroma, not bad but just bland and one-dimensional.
This is the first beer I could tolerate as a kid, but man what did I know then, eh?

Miller Genuine Draft has a medium, white head and a golden, very clear appearance.  Carbonation is medium to high.  Aroma is very slight; maybe some hops is detectable.  The taste is mild and only the smallest amount bitter.  It is also a little bit sweet.  Mouth-feel is light and watery.  MGD finished crisp and refreshing.  Try to sample this out of the can, as the clear bottle may allow the beer to spoil; happily, the bottle I tried was not skunked.  I like Miller Genuine Draft and think it would go well with a summer barbecue.

RJT

0,33 L-es üveg. Arany szín, középszerű habbal. Szőlős gabona illat. Dianás cukor íz egy kis komlóval. Nehéz megítélni egy nagyon sósra sikerült japán ebéd után, de jobb, mint amire számítottam. Kicsit savanyú.
If beer usually tasted like this, I wouldn’t have beer on a regular basis. It’s very drinkable, but pretty boring. Tastes like watery corn syrup.
Aroma weak adjunct corny, pale yellow, light body, clean with high carbonation.  Taste is rather generic, smooth drinkable but so is water.

Pours clear yellow with a huge foamy head. This beer is like foam incarnate. It smells like nothing and is very clean and crisp no flavour profile to speak of. and way way over carbonated. MGD sucks!!!!!!!!! Give me a Kokanee. Which also sucks. But far less so. This is like corona but with 2x the carbonation. But I guess the Douche bags need to drink beer as well.
So good it doesn’t need a brown bottle. Yellow with a small head. Corny aroma with typical American macro flavor. Meh.
This stuff is just bad! Yellow pour, musky scent, metal taste with abrupt nasty finish, yuck.

MGD--Miller Genuine Draft Cold Filtered Draft Beer--2005 12 oz. Bottle.  4.70% ABV--15 IBU’s.?  (3.0 / 5.0)  Clear thin bright straw golden color.  Mild hop front.  CO2 tangy fizzy thin crisp mild adjunct light butter sweet caramel Pils fruit body.  Clean watery mild hop citrus refreshing end.  Clear bottle.  Thin.  Sampled 7/8/2005.

Miller Genuine Draft Cold Filtered Lager Beer--2007 12 oz. Bottle.  4.70% ABV--12 IBU’s.?  (3.0 / 5.0)  Thin foamy mild lace head.  Clear bright thin yellow gold color.  Missing hop front.  Crisp thin watery mild caramel easy Pale Lager body.  Refreshing watery hint of hop tang end.  Crisp bland Macro.  Sampled 5/3/2007.

Awful. Just awful.  I literally went and bought another six pack because i thought mine had gone bad. It is NOT smooth or easy to drink, which was surprising to me, because Miller Lite is perhaps my favorite of the macro light beers (not saying much).  

This ties Steel Reserve for the worst beer i have ever tasted, and indeed, the sweet, cough syrup, corny taste reminded me of SR.

I never thought i would say this, but do yourself a favor and grab a Budweiser.

For an American beer it is damn good. It pours a pale golden colour with a light head. Nice refreshing taste, great for summer BBQ’s because they go down so smooth. Kind of expensive for what it is. The MGD we get here is brewed in Ontario, Canada & believe me it tastes a lot better!

0.33 l bottle.
It pours a clear golden with a small head on top, the carbonation is average.
The smell is mainly of malt and some yeast in the back.
It begins crisp, the taste is sweet, flavour’s fruity (grape) and tiny cardboard-liked.
The aroma has an artifical touch, beside this it’s of some cereal malt and grassy hops.
The finish is a bit spicy, sweet and dry at last.
It’s easy drinkable stuff and overall not a big deal for the beer-tasteing senses..

Basement and dirty sock aromas, somewhat nauseating, reminiscent of PBR. Head is surprisingly white and fluffy on top of a completely unremarkable transparent, yellow base. Average carbonation, taste is light, not as offensive as I expected, pretty easy to drink, but it’s no Budweiser.

This does have a malted taste to it. Maybe with some nutty overtones. Unfortunately its light body and heavy carbonation makes it hard to really taste what it may have to offer. Near average drinkability because you can have another and its not something that I will never drink again.

Serving type: can

Reviewed on: 04-14-2007 16:48:06
bought this at the Sahara Casino for 1 dollar. I think i paid too much. Good thing i was a bit drunk when i drank this. That way i could choke it down. Won’t drink again.
well i guess i should thank or slap my brother swalden28 for this one.  just plain horrible all around.  maybe it was so old, i dont know, but i didnt enjoy it.

24oz can, purchased at Bottle Barn. Pours a clear, medium golden color; creamy white head with good retention and resilient lacing; attractive pour. Bland aroma of light wet malts, hints of mineral bitterness, and slight DMS notes (preferable to green apple or diacetyl); like an inoffensive, under-developed pilsner; a very basic, clearly presented nose. Light to medium-light body; reasonably smooth, non-astringent, lively / fluffy carbonation; a core character of light cereal malts and sugars, hints of mineral notes, and just touches of DMS; otherwise, this is reasonably cleanly presented, crisp, approachable (if obviously light); no overt astringency, alcohol, diacetyl, graininess, or anything else terrible: just light-bodied and generally bland. Not bad at all. Hints of corn, but modestly present. Medium finish of lightly toasty cereal malts; hints of a mineral character and DMS, but predominantly soft toast.

Drank 2 freebies (bottles) on st. patty’s day because.... i don’t know.  The reviews i’ve read so far seem to be pretty accurate.  Don’t waste your life with this beer.  Clear bottles are so wrong and this stuff gave me a worse headache in the morning than 2 mags of red wine.  There are something like 120ish additives that brewers can put in their beer and i’m assuming this beer has all of them.
Tasted blind. Perfect clarity, light golden color. Grainy aroma with hints of grass. Super clean and real dry.

On tap.  Pours a clear pale straw yellow with medium-sized white head that actually yields some lacing.  Weak grains in the aroma.  Flavour is a little sweet and grainy.  Pretty thin body.  Generic pale lager but not offensive - I’ve definitely had worse.

A: The pour is crystal clear and light golden/yellow in color with plenty tiny CO2 bubbles. The head is short lived but fluffy and white.

S: A strong smell of over-ripened corn and a touch of other miscellaneous grains. Perhaps a faint metallic tinge, but nothing overwhelming.

T: A sweet and heavy corn flavor without much else to balance the beer out. It’s not as water-like as many of the other BMC beers, but I haven’t decided whether that’s for better or worse.

M: The body is surprising, actually. Somewhat toward the medium side with abundant carbonation.

D: I did not find this an altogether enjoyable experience, but I didn’t mind drinking it for "old times" sake. There have certainly been a few nights of MGD in the past, but now I remember why I don’t drink it anymore.
Bottle. Boring. Weak aroma, straw and slightly skunky. Sweet taste with light bitterness, short duration. Thin and watery palate. Yellow and bubbly, no head.

Very pale yellow with minimal white head.  Weak aromas of grass and hay.  Taste is watery with little character, no bitterness noted.  It’s remarkable blandness, makes for an overall unremarkable beer.
MGD..... Medium carbonated, lighty malt flavor with a watery dry finish.  Rather drink pureed cardboard.
Yellow pour from bottle.  Thin head, much thinner taste.  Skunky and bitter, not much to like here.  Hell, Miller High Life is a 10 compared to this beer.  Pass.

Bottle. This beer’s strongest characteristic is its bold hopp flavor - its bitter and crisp, but was a little too chemical in nature for me. Seemed a little unnatural. Miller beers tend to be heavier in hopps compared to other macros in the category. I wouldn’t call it a weak flavored beer for a pale lager, but it was not very pleasing to the palate. Not a beer I would choose again.

Pale yellow color, quickly diminishing small white head; wet, slighty grainy malt aroma; watery texture, carbonated mouthfeel; and then the taste, which isn´t only lacking, but what what it has to offer is just bad, really, in the purest grainy, metal, watery and overall bland sense you would fear and expect. And yeah, no bitterness, of course.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle.
As you can see from the clear bottle, it has a pale gold color.  When you pour it, a small, foamy, white head forms.  Like many of it’s kind, the head doesn’t stick around long.  The aroma has a bit of corn, wet cardboard, and some skunk.  Thanks clear bottle!  The flavor is a hair maltier than the average macro with notes of corn and grain.  Light in mouthfeel, this beer was made to be consumed in quantity.  Overall I really don’t find it as offensive as some of the other macros out there, but I am certainly not going to choose this if there is much else around.
Light straw coloured with fizzy white head. Light aroma with hints of..... I don’t know. Very watery tasting,  No discernable qualities to speak of.
possibly the best of the super lagers.  nothing to offend.  very muted metal and all off flavors.  still would serve it as cold as possible to mute the flavor.  not worth rating but i will anyway

Pours a light gold. Small airy head that fades quickly. Faint aroma of sweet wet grass corn. Light grain and sweet flavor with a hint of malt. This beer works well in Hungarian Goulash, but that is about it.

(can)



lct-yw, no-head, thin-body med-high-co2.



aroma: §wet-cardboard.



flavor: §wet-cardboard §corn(corn-oil) co2.



not much in there, and what is isn’t good.
On tap at St Louis Bar & Grill.  Not good.  No aroma.  Really off tasting.  Couldn’t finish it.

Pours pale yellow with a quickly fading head.
Aroma shows faint malt, cooked vegetables, cardboard and something like decomposing leaves.
Sweet corn and rice flavours dominate, with almost no bitterness whatsoever.
Carbonation is huge, and of course, the body is extremely watery.

Yellow with a fizzy white head.  Sweet malty aroma and taste without anything else going on.  It’s probably on the better end of bad macro lagers, but it doesn’t even begin to compare to the average micro brew.

I am rating MGD for what it is: a macro American lager. Don’t try to impose unrealisitic standards on beer of this kind. It is brewed for easy drinkability and consistency. MGD is a winner in those areas. Very mild aroma, slight malt and corn. Faint hop presence. Taste is smooth and very easy to drink. Less corny than Miller High Life. Interesting because MHL and MGD are made from the same recipe. MGD is cold filtered, where HIgh Life is heat pasteurized. Perhaps that can account for the difference. 

Great macro brew, not piss as some would say. Just appreciate MGD for what it is and enjoy. I know I did!

12oz can served ice cold in a pint glass.  Pours crystal clear, pale yellow, topped with a small white head that is starting to dissipate quickly (became a partial ring).  Surprisingly nice lacing at first, but then it stopped.  Clean aroma of lager yeast and hops, hint of caramel//apple something, and some almost metallic skunky smell that isn’t on the good list.  The body is really light and heavily carbonated, foamy, almost hard to swallow because it foams up so bad.  Flavor is almost nonexistent.  There’s a touch of noble hops, a touch of corn, some grainy sweetness.  In it’s defense, while it doesn’t taste like much of anything, at least what flavor is there isn’t bad.  It’s pale clarity is unnerving.  Over carbonated; otherwise a good session beer, less the fact that you can drink a 6-pack an hour without trying.
Light corn malt aroma. Medium yellow color with minimal head. Sweet barley malt flavor. Why is this soo much. Good for when hitting the greens. Maybe not....

Surprised that I have yet to rate this. Can at my Dad’s, poured into a pilsner glass. Aggressive pour yields some foamy head, clear very pale yellow beneath. Corn, grassy, thin aroma. Papery and astringent. Sweet, watery, bready and papery taste. No bitterness, no flavor. Watery.

355ml bottle. Pale and thin looking but lively enough with good carbonationand a light honey colour with a soft white ehad that collapses quickly. Basic and bland aroma and tastes as thin as it looks. Mass produced pale lager that is ordinary at best.

Enjoyed at the Old Towne Tavern in Clarksville, Tennesee. Best Before: December 21, 2009.

Appearance: Pours out a crystal clear, light gold body with an inch high stand of simple white foam.

Smell: Tremendously light pale maltiness with the merest hint of hop essence. Some notable corn-inspired hints floating around in there as well.

Taste: More of that all-too light pale maltiness and corn-esque tastes with a moderate amount of sweetness. Just a bit of Tetrahop, with only an incredibly minute amount of bitterness (almost none) and no real hop flavor. Finishes with a final sweet taste that lingers a few moments beyond the swallow.

Mouthfeel: Thin-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Ahh, cold-filter me away to beer heaven, Miller!
The reason you see so many Miller commercials on TV, is because the beer is so bad, no one would buy it otherwise. Reminds me of Summer Fest.
This actually wasn’t a terrible pale lager. Better than most light american lagers, but that’s not saying much. A lawnmower beer and nothing more.
What’s the point of rating this beer? - Warning for water - do not bye!
One of the worst excuses for beer out there. Like carbonated piss in a bottle.
Bottle. 12 oz. Did not bother pouring this into a glass. Tastes like a run of the mill(er) pale lager. Not much to this.
An ok beer and pretty easy to drink. Pours a golden color with a very light white head. Not much aroma and the taste is ok but nothing to write home about."

Bottle.  What a skunky, nasty beer.  
looks like pee.  Hey Miller, get your act together.
Look of cat pea, taste of a yellow lager. Light with corn and rice. Not much flavor and has an odd sweetness that finishes.

Would rather take to the side of High Life in a battle to the death of these two similar beers.  White head quickly vanishing lacing.  Thin body, quick fading taste of cream corn and skunk, not sure if this is attributed to clear bottle as I’ve never had this from tap.
Not bad, better than alot of other miller products, full taste..a bit gritty if not served ice cold in my opinion, nice smell. light/medium color.
Pours gold with a big white head.  Aroma is faint pale malts and rice.  Flavor is light bready, corny, ricey funk.  Pretty bad.

12 oz can.  Initial taste is of corn and a bit fruity.  Weird...wasn’t expecting that.  There’s a flavor in here that I can’t quite place.  Different than the majority of macros.  That doesn’t mean it’s good, though.  It’s still very much a bland mass-produced lager.  Started with a thick head which quickly dissipated into a thin head which lasted to the end.

Clear bottle, in Turkey. I’m still reeling from this experience and I might need PTSD therapy. It started out ok. Pours the palest of yellows. Has a bit of cap retention but is generally ugly. The aroma is rancid. There are lots of rotten foodstuffs and skunk and sulfur. And just when I thought that was bad enough, I made the mistake of drinking it. Now I did not want to put the glass to my lips after the stench but I felt it was my duty to finally try this swill. It was a mistake. This is purely putrid stuff that unfortunately persists on the palate. This beer proves there is no god because no god would allow this nightmare to perpetrate itself nor to permit the human taste buds to find this remotely tolerable. I would rather die than have to drink this again. This beer offends me deeply.
This is true innovation in American brewing?  I sincerely don’t understand what the hell.
I would suggest not even think to taste it, unless u ve been drunken at first a lot ... in the summertime! Of course i’m joking ... but u ’d better listen to my advice...Cheers!

This is my go-to beer for mass produced american lager.  This beer actually has some flavor and character to it, albeit not much, but I find it drinkable.  The beer was fresh and crisp and went down smooth.  This is a good picnic beer or lawnmower beer or just if you don’t want to have to think about what you are drinking.
Bottle. Golden colour. Aroma of corn and malt. The flavour is sweet, corn, malt and grain. Quite smooth mouthfeel and watery.

bottle- FIRST DRINK- I thought for sure i would hate this beer, but actually it’s not bad for a mass produced lager, although i drank  it immediately after i tried the horrible miller lite, which i’m sure affected my rating. LAST DRINK- not good, but not bad as it sits.

bottle poured a golden with little head and good carbonation. aroma has corn grain and sweetness. light mouth feel with a flavor that matches the nose. corn grains and sweetness. never thought i would say this but the high life was a better brew.

A beer that looks smells and even tastes a little like piss, but if you drink it cold enough it becomes a clean refreshing beer. a good innitial taste but all round bland and borring. but still its nice to have a non offensive &#40when cold&#41 cheap beer which on a hot day is actually enjoyable.
Oh boy - I think I can taste the difference because of the ceramic cold filtering!  Oh wait, it’s still bad.
Looks digusting yellow without much head. Tastes bad. Just about drinkable when very cold.
actually, not that bad...better than bud. it is what it is, a good beer on a hot summer day.

Pours piss yellow with foamy head that dies in the arse in seconds. Aroma of chemicals and corn, emphasis on the former. Taste and finish is the same, but the chemicals beef up a bit in the finish. Solitary point given due to it’s skullability, I was able to hold my nose and polish this shit off rather then pour it down the sink. Insultingly weak, would rather drink water shandy then this pathetic swill.
Very light pale yellow color with a white head. Thin aroma with a hint of citrus. Light flavor, like sodawater with a weak splash of malt and fruit.
Bottle, 33cl. Pours clear, none-to-little head, no lacing. Faint aroma of nothing much. Nothing much on the palate either. Typical nondescript macro.

473 mL PET Bottle. Pale straw body with a fizzy short-lived white head. Sharp astringent aroma with notes of moldy citrus fruits assaults the olfactory. Cereals and corn dominate in the flavor, aftertaste like corn flakes cereal, musty-astringent hops come through as a whisper in the finish. Brownie points for the smooth carbonation. Only in extremely hot weather and only in genuine desperation will I repeat this one.
Can. poured pale yellow with a small white head. Metallic corn aroma... smelled nasty; tasted even nastier. I will have to be dying of thirst before I ever crack one of these open again.
Very bland, from bottle or tap. Very little carbonation, with little flavour. Although it is refreshing on a hot day.
Tastes like the rest of the Miller family, not worth an in-depth review. Something you drink when you are around the type.
Generic American beer. A good thirst quencher when cold on a hot day, but not overly satisfying.
this stuff is a classic! malty, hoppy and sweet. golden/yellow pale color. goes down nice and smooth

"This tastes like 1/4 beer and 3/4 water" - Tyler. Pale Yellow, with no head. No smell.... maybe a little bit of metal? Taste is soda water with a hint of...... ah forget it, this beer sucks. Doesn’t even deserve my time to rate it. At least it gets you drunk while tasting like nothing right?

Bottle. 5%. Plain as plain can be. Pale yellow colour with a weak, white foam.
Nothing special, but drinkable on a hot day.

I cannot tell the difference between this and Miller High Life, but for the packaging.  Really, nothing to differentiate from the other macro swills, just the same old dependable swill, neither good nor bad, just maybe with a nicer label.  P.S.  MGD is regulary served at functions by my wife’s employer; something about them having the same last name as the beer (no relation, of course).

Can. Simple grainy and cooked vegetable aromas. Average sized head, which is creamy, pure white, with excellent lacing and is fully lasting. Flavor starts lightly acidic and finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is light, watery and has a lively carbonation. Drinkable...barely.

12 oz. can.  Light gold pour, large fizzy white head.  Heavily carbonated.  Nothing enjoyable about drinking this.  I thought mine was skunked but that’s the usual flavor.  I’d rather have a Bud if I had to choose, or even a Miller Lite.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour with a white head. Not much to offer in aroma or taste. Maybe a very light sweetness and som light citrus notes. Watery and pointless, but not totally undrinkable.
Gold straw color. Actually fairly smooth for a pale lager. Just lacks that even corn/grassy taste that most pale lagers have. Very smooth and even light, for a non-light beer. Overall, not horrible.

Overall Impression: 
Slightly not terrible for it’s price.  It doesn’t offer much in the way of flavor, but it does server its purpose I guess.

Not bad for a pale American lager. Better than Bud in my opinion. Certainly, a step up from Miller Light. This beer is definitely better in a bottle than from the can. The can leaves a poor metallic, tinny taste to the beer. Out of glass, this a simple, clean, refreshing beer like beverage. Perfect for the heat of summer.

Drank piles of this one summer. No head, no aroma, slight flavour of hops and corn. Not bad as a kickin’ back on the porch beer, or something to go with a steak while you’re talking smack with your buddies. It is what it is. You build memories around this stuff, but you sure as hell don’t drink it for the connoisseurial qualities.

Surprisingly, this was a lot better than what I was expecting from a Miller product... It was similar to most macro brews (obviously) but it actually had a faint taste of actual beer and was not overly offensive... Nothing more than a cheap, watery brew, but it’s better than most beers fitting that description.

I had this at a baseball game ($5.00 a bottle)
Clear bottle very slight skunk aroma and taste after that every thing was faint, flavor lasting on the palate faint. Overall impression was this is just a thirst quincher beer then go to the good stuff.

Late April, 2009

12oz can(s) at my brother-in-laws carne asada.  Light, thin color, fizzy.  For some reason the flavor/body/carbonation reminded me of 7up.  Cheap, and good for getting drunk on, that’s about it.
20.06.2009, 0,33l Bottle. Pale yellow colour. Very light taste, almost no aroma! The beer is bitter and refreshing.

This was the beer I drank when I was tailgating beer every Penn state football game.  So with this beer comes memories from 6 am till when the game started.  With that said this beer is nothing special gold color with medium carbonation over all sweet and easy drinking.
clear golden amber, short headn carbonated, strong notes of cardboard, and nothing else, flavour is sweet...it is what it is...

Appearance: Clear yellow, hint of golden. Some white head.
Aroma: Grains, some hops and malt.
Taste: Grains, some bitterness. Watery. Not interesting, but not bad.
Info: 330ml bottle, 5/6-2009
(bottle). Pours a clear yellow color. Medium white head. Very light grain/alcohol aroma and taste. Avg duration. Thin/watery texture. Spare lacing. Moderate carbonation.

It’s Miller time!! This looks to be a pale straw color and I can’t judge the cap since I drank directly from the bottle. The smell was fairly skunky with sulfur thrown in but some how wasn’t repulsive. Very sweet flavor, and some what bready, the mouth feel wasn’t bad not thin and had good carbonation. Its not a bad tasting beer its easy drinking and it dosn’t taste like your sucking on a skunk, it’s realy just a every day swill for the uninformed masses to chug back. This by far is the best out of all the big American brewers whats kingd of sad when you think about it.

Good lets get drunk beer or working in the yard beer or beer to give to others when your fridge is stocked with lots of beer that you are not willing to share with the common folk. Dumped into glass....I usually just take it right out of the bottle....and a pretty good white cap appeared and stayed for a very long time. Average deep straw colour with the big bubbs. Lots of spotty lacing. Aroma is crap - stinky, wheaty and a bunch of other unsavoury stuff. Taste is dry, slighly sweet with a decent amount of low quality malts and yeast and weak. A little oily in the mouth along with a weak bitterness. Wow. Bottom of the glass and I’ve had enough. I’ll never NOT drink this ice cold out of a bottle again. For a mass-produced, drink-it-under-the-freeway-when-you-sell-a-lot-of-rock beer it’s better than most.

500 ml can. Finland. Brewed by Anadolu Efes (probably in İstanbul, Turkey). Pale golden colour with small white head. Aroma of corn and metal. Sweetish flavour with some corn and malt, also a hint of alcohol. Well, can’t say it’s good.

With a subtle aroma of hops and malt, this brew pours a clear, golden hue of yellow, with a decent sized head that evaporates quickly. Body is light and thin, with slight sweetness and subtle notes of bitterness; average carbonation and an abrupt finish make this brew an easy drink. Overall, not a great beer but decent enough and the price is right.

Bottle - I give it a 2 for flavor because there was no flavor, like water.  Palate OK.  Like some of the other paie aIes i rated, i’m not sure if this has any malt; rice and corn sugar??  Not impressed!  Just glad it was free.
You can tell from the beginning  by looking at this beer’s colour that there’s nothing here. Pale yellow colour with white foam. Really poor taste. Disappointing.
Smooth drinking and inoffensive. Not much here but if you let it warm up and roll it around on the tongue, you might tast some hops.
Pours yellow with a fizzy white head.  Smells watery with some sweet malty hints.  Tastes swet and lightly dry with a touch of apple on the finish.

Bottle. A light golden color with loads of carbonation and a shoet fizzy head. Aroma of  grain,canned corn,and hay. Flavor is light and mild as expected,malty for a macro Pale Lager but very little going on as far as aroma or flavor,slightly metallic aftertaste...meh ! Drinkable but noting special.
Pale yellow with at white head. Aroma is light hop (grass and some spice), and light malt. Taste is like the aroma.
This is my favorite beer at a local bar with .50 cent drafts all day everyday.  It is clear yellow with not much flavor, but better than other American style lagers.  Not much head.

Can at home.
Clear yellow coloured with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of sulphur and hops with notes of grain.
Malty flavour with notes of hops.
Watery.

On tap. Is there an aroma? Yellow with a small white head. Flavor is a lightly sweet with a tiny bitterness. Light bodied, highly carbonated. This was free so I didn’t feel bad drinking this watered down beer. I would have to say this is better then most other mass market American lagers.

2009 Bottle - Pours yellow with a small white head...aroma is ambrosia compared to what I just drank, lt malt, old grain...flavour is similar, lingering grain...if only it had been triple-hopped, what could have been...

This beer is a heavier Miller lite.  There is absolutely nothing special about it other than how boring it is.  Mild hops some wheat in the aftertaste, same as any pale lager.   I’m glad this was on sale.
Pours light golden, with no head at all.No aroma, and taste like sweet water.
Average joe beer. Cant argue with it. Not expensive, but not too cheap. Sounds good drunk at the local Dennys,"I’ll have an MGD please, and a Slamburger."

Ok flame me if you want, but every brew has it’s purpose and this one is decent when your working on the car in the garage or just getting in from cutting the grass.  Granted its not great but don’t knock it, cheap refreshing not the worst thing out there
Classic Miller taste... aka lightly flavored water.  You’re not drinking this if you are looking for quality, only quantity...

Bottle 33cl.
Clear medium yellow color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, fruity, light hoppy, lime. Flavor is moderate sweet and light light bitter with a average duration. Body is medium to light, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. It is just borring. [20081125]

This beer is my favorite of all the macros (which is not saying that much, I know).  It has a nice crisp bite and smooth finish that other beers in it’s class simply lack.  I just can’t drink the heavy micros and imports all the time (my stomach and wallet simply don’t allow it)...and when I don’t, I turn to this beer.  Absolutely DELICIOUS on a hot summer day.

Aromia is of sweet malts.  Color is golden yellow.  Taste is really sweet and malty.  Mouthfeel is smooth throughout, but little to balance the sweetness.  Not the worst lager, it goes down easlity but lacks real flavor.
boring beer, but i can’t really say anything bad about it, though of the "quality american beers" it’s on the bottom of the list, sorry MGD!!!!

Almost no head. Bland color. Almost no flavor. Mostly water. 
Easy to drink tho. Buy a case and get drunk would be pretty easy on a hot summer day.

Head looks alright for a few seconds, but then it vanishes into a little soapy film. No color or aroma worth mentioning. Doesn’t really taste like much of anything, but at least it avoids the pitfalls of other cheapass beers

European version, like yellow white small diminshing head, aroma of grass vanilla malt and some urine notes ;-) (seriously), flavors is like a biscuit malt, generally flavor is almost missing and the wateriness is competing with the Israely Nesher beer, hops is missing as well.
Its Miller Time.Swilled a 4 pack  in 15 mins. Sometimes I dig  dull ass Lagers and it keeps you humble . Boring lager even if its ’miller time’Corona shits on this in ’context’
On tap every where. Watery brew with little flavor,  no complexity and vitually no aroma. Close your eyes and you can taste the corn.

Drank a bottle of this last night when I ran out of my six pack of Widmer Drifter. It’s honestly not as bad as I remember. Still a macro with not a whole hell of a lot going on, but the flavor isn’t complete shit.
Bottle, local supermarket. Dark yellow colour, no head. Aroma has faint malts, metallic. Flavour has malts, cardboard.
not the best.. but classic.. easy to drink.. wheat and water mainly.. miller is a classic company
Totally under performs in all aspects. Period. Too much of a light weight. So pale that it borders on invisibility. Easy to drink though.
Poor beer from a poor company.  Forgive me, but it just seems like SABMiller makes a lot of poor choices.
not a good beer but in some situations it’s drinkable especially for his freshness.doesn’t have particular taste or aroma

While this is certainly not a good beer, it is one of the few that will pass in a pinch. Clear, light yellow, not a whole lot of aroma. A tad of hops and malt flavor and not too citric or carbonated. If you happen to be in a bar that doesn’t have and “good” beers order thin one. You’ll at least be able to make it to the bathroom before you vomit.
If its a hot summer day, I like an MGD. It takes care of the thirst, especially if you’ve working outside. That said...I really wouldn’t drink this any other time, unless it was for $3 pitchers.
Beskedlig, tillbakadragen. Alla smaker gömmer sig. Beskan är obefintlig. Till en bit mat är den säkert tjänlig, men som en solitär upplevelse gör den ingen glad.
Not gonna lie. This is not good beer. Giving it a notch above Miller Lite and Bud but it’s all pretty much swill.
Yellow with a small white head. Weak aroma mostly of DMS vegetables. Weak and clean, slightly sweet flavour with a touch of cardboard
Bottle.  Some malt in the aroma.  Pale golden body, almost no head.  Flavor has some bready malt, but also a bunch of adjuncty off-notes.
Very bland with no great aroma or flavour..rarely get hangovers this is abeer that gives me one.
More like Miller Genuine Crap.  Yellow color, white head.  Not an awful appearance actually.  Aroma and flavor is all corn and adjunk, some malt.  Really not much to it at all.  Watery palate.
This clear bottle pours into a golden mess in a pint glass.  THe high life gets a bit malty and doesn’t improve on the palete nor appearance.
Decent looking beer with a head good head and brussels lace.  However corn is apparent in the aroma and the taste.  Weak aroma and taste.

355ml bottle.

Not impressed at all. This is what you get for drinking American Beer. Corn taste, with a harsh bitter finish. Definitely   one to avoid.
A pretty rank beer. Have no idea why so many people drink it? Then again,I also have no idea how anybody drinks Bud,Coors & Corona either?
Pours golden with a white head.  Corn and grainy malt aroma. Flavor is corn sweetness with a metallic bite.
TAP, BOTTLE, CAN: yellow body, fizzy, thin, slighly more flavor than Miller Lite

Pours clear yellow with a fizzy white head. Aroma of corn, musty malt, tin, and cardboard. Taste is delicious cardboard, with corn, and musty malt. Lingering metallic taste. Watery mouthfeel. Like drinking water with accidental flavors.
Draft, at the brewery in Milwaukee, blind taste test after a tour.  A notch above Miller High Life, but that is not saying much.  Thankfully America has branched out.
Bottle at Shaherzad, L.A. Not a very good beer. Very watery. Worked fine with Persian food but nothing special at all. Avoidable
Yellow body with a huge white head. No aroma, minimal flavor. Just another mass-production. Boring.
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow body with a white head.  A note of grass, corn, and metallic lingering.  Thin body and no alcohol.
Soft yellow lots of visible carbonation, finger of white head and nice retention.  Heavy corn aroma, soft metal and basic macro corn taste.
Corny, vegetable aroma, minimal flavour, watery body, metallic finish...just another mass-produced megaswill lager.
Why me? This has got to be one of the worst beers in the world. Still dont know why I am trying these corn and rice beers.
bottle.  pours a yeller beer with a thin gone head.  Aroma is grassy and cereal.  Very thin body and watered down.   Nice beer if you are homeless behind a gas station or something.

bottle.  Poured light yellow with little head.  Light off corn grain aroma.  Crisp fizzy mouthfeel. Light and crisp but bland grainy flavour. No aftertaste.   Generic mass produced American tasting beer. Not horrible.
Bottle.  I’ll drink this if all of the micros in the world blow up.  Otherwise, NO.

My least favorite of the Miller family the sweet taste just ruins it its similar to Brahma from Brazil with the clear bottle/ sweet taste and skunky smell ... it has everything else good carbonation just enough head ah well skip this one and life the high life instead

Bottle.  Pours gold with fizzy head.  Smells of malted grains and corn.  Tastes bitter, earthy, like kinda dirty, but has hints of hops.  Kinda refreshing, drinkable, but not anywhere near the top of my list of american lagers.

12oz at the TFDA Winter League draft - thanks, Joe! Champagne of beers? Well, how about the sparkling wine of shitty cheap beers? That’s a distinction, even if one MGD can’t be particularly proud of. Still, it’s really far better than Bud and Coors somehow - at least there’s a decent body and the hint of a taste. Not much more, but I ain’t turning it down for free.

Pours an apple juice like colour with a small white head. Aroma is of grass and corn. Taste is bland and  innofensive. Corn and grass on the palate. Mouthfeel is sharply fizzy and not that good. Innofensive beer aimed for mass consumpion. Boring!

12oz bottle at TJ Baxters
I asked the waitress to surprise me and bring me the best beer that they had. And thsi is what she brought me. Oh the humanity
Not good REALLY not good
another good beer for the people not living in their parents basement bumming money to support their premium beer habit, taste of drunk hint of good party.

My father-in-law likes this one. I buy it for him. To me, its a pale, weak beer-like drink that make my father-in-law more interesting. I’ve never had skunky bottle, but I can see how the clear bottle makes it susceptible.
Bottle. Pours yellow gold with a white head. The aroma is almost sweet with a touch of way. The flavor is bland but mostly inoffensive, a bit of straw. Drinkable.
I had this at a jets game.  Well the Jets happend to win the game. So....yeah.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pale, pale yellow with a surprisingly nice looking white head. Aroma is very light, with notes of hay and sweet corn. Crisp, fizzy body. Not much flavour, but what’s there is fairly inoffensive - a hint of sweet malt, a bit of corn, a light grassiness. Yeah, it’s not very good - but I’ve had a helluvalot worse.
Bottle. This beer wasn’t any good, smelled awful and didn’t taste much.

One of the very first beers I had as a young violence loving little twat causing trouble in my local park. Thankfully I’ve grown up since then. Still a twat but drink better beer. I actually think this is one of the more reasonable pale lagers but perhaps thats just nostalgia. Pale in name, colour and taste. Metal is the defining flavour. Wow, didn’t notice it was cold filtered though. Woo fkin hoo.
Fizzy, fizzy, some cardboard taste, fizzy, light yellow and watered down.  A bit fizzy, and somewhat drier than the regular Miller.  Did I mention fizzy?
bottle - light brown beer. I don’t remember the aroma but the flavour was watery.
Smells and tastes skunky with grassy flavors and little bitterness.  I wouldn’t even drink this mowing the lawn.

[1640-20080830] Can. Some corn grains and wet hay aroma. Clear, light yellow body with a quick white foam. Corn grains continues in the flavour with a little alcohol and something that fell on the floor. Light body. Feels like a clubbing beer.

(@ Diamond Princess cruise ship; near AK)

Can in from jeff as a joke, I hope. Of all the stuff said about these beers from BMC, the reality is that there is a place for them in this world. Millions of beer drinkers are just that: beer drinkers, and this suits them just fine. Those of us that have ventured out pass the front gate have realized that this just won’t do it anymore. Our tastes have been lifted to a different level and we are more likely to enjoy even a so-so IPA vs an offering from these chaps. So no, this wasn’t a bad beer at all, it just isn’t something that I want to drink as I know that something much better awaits me.

2008-08-30. Pale yellow body, small white head. Muted flavour, dilute pale malt, tiny bitterness. Aroma is muted pale malt, light grass notes. Average to thin palate. Went down surprisingly easy in an ice cold glass watching the cruise ship wake, but  expect warming up did not improve things. Can, Wakeview Lounge, Diamond Princess

Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a large foamy head. The aroma is mostly a skunky malt with some corn. The taste is crisp and full of corn, dirty water, some sweet and cheap malts, and a bunch of other additives. Not horrible, I mean I could drink it, but not really enjoyable.
Another horrible ricey American watered down standard American lager, crisp almost refreshing, better than Bud but that’s not saying much.

Bottle.  Pour is a hideous yellow with a big head and aromas of fermented adjunct... smells more like rice than corn to me.  Active and obnoxious carbonation/fizz.  Flavor is incredibly watery... with some corn (even though nose reminded me of rice, flavor is corn... dry hopped with rice, wet hopped with corn???)  Well, at least that thought made me smile.  Wonder if they have figured out a way to use adjunct for hops yet... could be the next big thing...  Well, apart from my rambling stream of consciousness, I’ve said about all there is... watery adjunct beer.  Not foul or anything, but not very good.
Our of a can. Smells like beer. Kind of a corny taste. Gross finish. Most would argue that high life is better than this, and I would agree with them.
Bottle: Slightly better than MGD64 at least this looks like beer and somewhat taste like it. A good easy drinking beer. Nothing special though
No head, no lace, watery mouth.  Almost tasted like it was about to have flavor, then decided to change its mind.
Good Stand by when you just need a fix for a long trip when you cant get any good beer
One of the better mass produced beers as far as I am concerned.  Nothing special, but I’d prefer it over a Bud.
Not very good. Slightly gooder than the Lite. Yuck. Why am I even wasting my time reviewing it?

Can, bought @ Fakta, Christiansfeld.

Pours very pale golden with a medium, frothy white head that quickly disappears. Aroma is a bit soapy, some wet dog and sweet maize. High, spritzy carbonation, thin and very watery. Flavour is extremely limited    - is this carbonated water? No real sweetness and no real bitterness. Just carbonated water.
A 0.5L can from local shop. Pale hay coloured. White fast disappearing nose. A really mild hoppiness. Sour taste. A watery and almost tastless beer.

Tasted somewhere along my trip through the States.

Boooooring and bad.

This was sitting in a fridge in the apartment at folks vacation house, they thankfully didn’t buy it and neither did I.  yellow with a bright white head.  Nose like urine, but with a fancy shirt on.  Taste is not urine but basically water, but worse.
Aroma has more character to it than most macros.  Appearance is pale golden.  Flavor has notes of corn and some sweetness to it.  Leaves the mouth cleanly and crisp.
[Sampled on svogertour with Thomas and Troels at Mols.] Bottle from Nete. Hot on Helgenæs. VRINSK

11-Feb-08 (12-oz bottle, expiration date of 14-Apr-08: BevMo in La Jolla, CA)  I used to think this was one of the better mass-produced American lagers, but it’s sweet, papery and adjuncty, with some corn graininess and absolutely no hop character whatsoever.  The nose is sweet-smelling and papery.  If the beer were at least crisp, clean and refreshing on the palate, it might be drinkable in a pinch, but the mouthfeel is sugary and stale.  Body is light and carbonation is medium.  The only thing this beer has going for it is perfect clarity and a steady supply of spaced out carbonation bubbles rising through the pale golden beer.  The white head pours to about half an inch and leaves fairly dense lacing on the glass as the head recedes to a thin layer.  But otherwise, this is Genuinely awful beer.
piss in a bottle.  High Life is tons better than this.  No flavor, and a weird amount of carbonation....just avoid this....please.
Surprised I forgot to rate this..  Good clean beer, not much flavor besides corn.  Its smooth but I prefer High Life.

My very first beer.  I loved it from the first sip.  Surprisingly, it reminded of liquid bread.  Now that I’m a little more experienced in tasting beer, it’s not quite so good.  Clear bottle and twist off cap is never good for beer.  The smell is lacking, very little to no head, and the taste is a little bland.  Having said that, it still has some decent ok qualities.

Bottle, golden blond coloured beer with some light carbonation and a small white head. Rather strange grainy sweet with some light herby cereal touched aroma. Meidum palate. Finish is sweet, griany with again a cereal ending. Very medium one.
It tastes good for being a pale lager, one of many favorites hailing from the big country in the west...
gold blond coloured sparkling body with a white head a sweet hoppy aroma a sweet fruity taste with a bitter finish
Gold/ yellow, with a white head. Sweet aroma. Flavor has bits of corn and malt., on the sweet side. Not good, but not terrible.
Clear golden blond coloured beer with small diminishing white head. Medium carbonation. Sweet hoppy aroma. Bit sweet wattery palate. Finish is bit sweet and slightly bitter. Few taste.
MGD is a beer that isn’t much else.  It pours with a nice color, but the taste leaves you wondering where all of the flavor is.

Pale beer with small yellow head.  Aroma is primarily cereal.  Flavor is slightly sweet, no appreciable hop notes, again a cereal flavor.  Finish is nearly non-existent--only a slight sweetness.  Honestly, I’m not sure why folks drink it.
Tastes like dried, old rubber.  Looks like piss. In general, does anyone make worse beer that the Miller Brewing Company?

Clear glass bottle. A clear yellow beer with a medium sized disappearing white head. The aroma is weak and almost not existent and what is there is not good. Very light malt nose and quite skunky. The flavour is grainy and very light. Some sweetness. Light body, watery texture, lively carbonation, short finish with light bitterness. Very unpleasant

Color is a typical clear straw yellow with a white head, nothing special. Aroma is crisp but weak, rather typical of an American macro lager. Flavor is malty and crisp but has no complexity or depth. Finish is no different from any other major brew I have tried.
This tastes almost identical to Miller Lite.  Mainly just a refreshing brew on a hot summers day.  Nothing bad about it just basically no flavor.

can.  Smooth and watery.  Smelled a bit funky out of the can (maybe it was the aluminum?) but smelled almost like a light sour ale.  A bit of fizzy carbonation, but I like this (basically just Miller in general) more than most other macro swill because there is actually an intelligible hop presence.
All that was left by the time I got to the office party. Corn syrup taste, texture and aftertaste - very much like a cola. Gotta get there earlier next time to get me one of them Heineken ales...

Golden straw colour with a medium to small sized head. A malty and grainy aroma is permeated by hints of skunyness. You know from the aroma that this beer probably will not taste good. A taste of bad grains and yeast. A good beer to have a dozen of if that is your plan. Else, you have been warned.
Clear golden with medium white short lasting head. Sweet malty and grainy aroma. Sweet  flavor. Ends sweet. malty and fruity notes.
The aroma is of faint rotting grain and old grass clippings.  Good foam and the bubbles keep on comin’.  The flavor is very grainy with a faint yeasty finish.  Beer for those who don’t know better.

12oz can.   Light gold color with a wispy head that has poor retention.   Cooked corn aroma.   Clean flavor, with some light sweetness, almost no bitterness or aftertaste.   A little more body that miller lite, but still hopelessly watery.   Not really offensive, but I’d take most anything else over it.

(Sampled 7-4-08 at cousin’s party- From quarter barrel keg served in Red Solo 20 oz. plastic cup... the way it should be!!!)- poured with a minimal white head that went away a little too quickly, weak golden yellow in appearance.  Aroma of metal and staleness.  Hits the mouth with a paper thin body, I got what I thought was a little malt with the first swallow but it was fleeting, a microscope size amount of hops on the finish.  One of those beers that makes your mouth go dry the more you drink it- and one that I throught was really good when I was growing up.  Hey, at least it helped with the entertainment as the enambler of trying to shoot down the neighbor’s RC planes with bottle rockets!!!  Now that was fun!
Horrible generic beer.  No flacor just some bitterness.  Very poor quality.

Poured with a clear golden yellow hue accompanied by a small carbonated cola head. Aroma is lacking of any real presence, though has a hint of the grasses you’d expect to find in a US macro. Taste is clean and unremarkable. Grass water.
clear golden amber, short headn carbonated, strong notes of cardboard, and nothing else, flavour is sweet.
Too bad there is no such thing as a zero on this. I can’t find anything beer-like about this. Bitterness in all the wrong places, sour and flat.
Definately one of the better of the lawnmower beers and incredibly easy to find. It’s a very good cheap beer.
Bottle 33cl. Yellow clear body with small fast white head. Sour notes in the nose. Very light, boring and a lotte sour body. Really boring beer.
Bottle, 4.7% at ÅBF08. Grainy flavour, citric. Pale yellow colour. Sour and bad.
the best miller product. well maybe high life is. way better than lite. i would actually drink again with no qualms. i just wouldnt buy it.
More body and hop flavor than most macros.  It serves its purpose and a better alternative to other cheap, light beers.
On a day in the triple digits, I would probably drink this one if there was nothing else available.  Would pick this one over Budweiser, but I would drink the sweat from my gym shorts over a Bud.
