A good beer for summer.  Somewhat of a light taste, but it goes down easy without any aftertaste.  From the bottle.

Bottle at the VFW in Minneapolis, MN.

Super-light but at least easy drinking beer that somehow fit quite nicely with the patriotic karaoke, Naugahyde lounge chairs, and recessed bar. No flavor here, but the feel of the bottle in my hand does remind me of all of the bottles I used to drink back in the day, at the now long-gone St. James Infirmary by Moffett Field in Santa Clara.
0,5l can. Pours very pale light gold with ugly and nonexistent head. Aroma has some malts and lemon. Aroma has much of the same with very poor balance. I drank one and I won’t drink another.
I am a fan of Miller, but this is proublay the worst of the bunch.  it will leave a nasty aftertaste and can create the nastiest of hangovers.

Appearance: pale golden color. Head with little to medium size, white and some lasting.
Aroma: to pale malts and adjuncts. Light fruity note similar to lemon-peel.
Flavor:  like the aroma, dominated for the pale malts and the adjuncts. Sweet progress like sugar added. Very ephemeral light dryness from extract of hops.
Palate: light body and watery texture. Medium carbonation.
Remark: nothing notable and some unbalanced. A very poor beer.

Can, 50cl. Pours a pale yellow, very clear, beer with a white foamy head. Almost no aroma, slight notes os malts and rice. The flavor is uninteresting, a boring taste. Thin palate. Overall a boring beer, below average.
chiara poca schiuma non molto persistente sentori dolciastri cerali luppolooassente in bocca sciroposa malto poco tatnti succedanei luppolo boh
Golden colour, small head. Sweet floral smell. Soft, watery mouthfeel with low carbonation. Mild malty taste, sweetish, lame. Has no character. Boring.
Terible. Yellow and almost flat, skunky taste, barn yard grains, metalic undertone, corn, water water water. Why do people want a flavour less beer

12 ounce bottle. Unpleasant pale yellow appearance. Nary aroma to speak of. Weak corn and grainy notes on the palate. Like drinking carbonated water, rather unpleasant and unsavory. Thin-bodied, slight bitter finish. Makes Miller Light look good by comparison, though not by much.
More flavor then miller light that doesn’t say much it’s drinkable....still not much flavor

When I smell a beer, aroma becomes the invitation of the liquid in the glass to drink its. This beer has sucha inviting aroma, I can tell that this perfume is close to artificial and when I drank taste confirms my theory. I couldn’t feel any relationship with aroma and flavor, it is too bitter but poor body and a soap sensations remains in my mouth after. 
5 dlls each can on my flight from Washington to Amsterdam. Hopefully better experiences are on the way.
Really nice beer in hot sunny day. Easy to drink. Aroma is crisp. Tosi hyvä bisse. It is best of the american lager beers. Thou those aren’t so good as other beers.

Can poured into a pint glass. Sickly pale yellow with a watery white head that dissipates like cola fizz. Doesn’t really smell like anything, maybe a little sour corn. Tastes like corn flavored Perrier with a barley finish. Watery and unpleasant. Lots of carbonation, paper-thin body. Drinkable when ice cold.

A sad sad excuse for a beer. rather tasteless and boring, very watery and particularly grainy. Pours a golden colour, aroma is grainy with possible pear notes. Decently carbonated, tastes watery on the palate.
Canned 50cl., from Fakta. Light yellow, clear body with white head. Hints of corn. Rich carbonation. Drinkable if served ice cold but I am not a fan.
Can.  Pours a clear light yellow with white head.  Corn is only perceptible flavor. medium light mouthfeel.  As far as a piss beer macro goes, this isn’t as bad as it gets.

This is my least favorite beer to date.  Hoppy corn aroma and taste.  Very little white head.  Taste is pretty flat.  If you are going to drink this category drink Michelobe golden draft light.  You will be much better served.

12oz can-pours a retaining white head that laces and yellow color.  Aroma is crisp grain/light malt.  Taste is crisp grain/light malt with some sweetness, secondary spicy hops.  Good carbonation.  Didn’t care for as much the next time, so averages to 2.8

5/3/08 from the bottle.  Aroma is very pils corny, with signifigant acetalyde green apple upon initial pouring that fades slightly.  Noble hop flora is somewhat noticeable. Appearance is clear yellow with a chunky moderate maintained white head.  Flavor is very sweet, but there’s not much caramel character here.  Bittering is low and kind of carbonic/metallic.  Mouthfeel is light bodied with a moderate carb bite.  Overall, this was a bit too sweet to have more than one.
Very drinkable... more filling than light still great with a game of beerpong

Bottle: Poured a golden yellow color lager with a small bubbly white head with limited retention. Aroma of sweet adjunct is dominating. Taste is also dominated by sweet corn with a watery aftertaste. No hops could be detected and body is quite thin. Nothing bad but just really plain and boring

Pours a clear piss yellow color with a pretty nice, big creamy head that’s medium lasting. 
Aroma is malty of adjuncts and vegetables. Corn, cooked carrots, brocoli, some grains and cardboard notes. Rather typical for a skunky comercial pale lager, maybe a little stronger.
Flavor is sweet-ish, but it tastes mostly like nothing. The faint, weak flavor is percievable only at the beginning. It desappears completely after 1 or 2 seconds. No nuances, no subtletlies. Nothing at all. Just sweetened water with a minimal trace of herbs.
Body is light as expected, but it has a surprising smoothness in the mouthfeel. High carbonation to disguise some bad flavors. Finish and aftertaste of water. 
Run of the mill pale lager.

Can. Brewed in Switzerland. Pours pale yellow with a diminishing white head. Small lacing. Sourish, skunky cereal aroma. Sweet, cereal flavour. Milky notes in the finish. Not much else to say. Crappy. 22-05-08.

Bouteille claire de 355 ml dégustée chez mes parents. Arôme: Légère odeur de maïs. Apparence: La couleur est blonde pâle avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence d’un mince col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de maïs avec une pointe métallique. Courte durée de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de maïs en arrière goût. (Rating #1680)
12oz bottle from BevMo!  Mission Valley.  One of the less disgusting Pale Lagers, nose yielded some yeast and hops.
Hurray water beer! That’s a little more yeasty tasting than other derivatives of Miller.

Bottle. Pours clearly golden with fast dissapearing white head. Grainy aroma with a little malt. Some corn to. A thin body covers a weak flavour of...well nothing at all besides some bitterness. Cant be much worse than this I guess.
This si a desent beer. i really never liekd it but my firends liek it but i think its aight

33cl bottle from Meny, Grønland. It poured a transparent yellow color with no head. The aroma is typical lager-style, it doesn’t really exists. The flavor is sweet and a bit malty.
A nice summer-beer, but nothing out of the ordinary.

Bottle 0.33 l. Bought Foetex Frederikssund. Golden yellow color with white head. Slightly malty aroma. Taste slightly bitter. Rich carbonation. The bottle in itself is nice, but why import such a beer to Denmark, with so many great other American beers to choose from?
Swill.  Piss. Gross.  Genuine Draft?  Yeah ok..sure.  Not even in the desert on my deathbed of thirst.
Bière très douce, comparable au produit sans goût de molson et labatt. Très décevant pour le prix de vente.....

Rated:june 2007

Bottle whirt,330 ml

Appearance: Head is foamy to frothy, rather frothy, quickly disappearing, no lacing, disappear quicker than in Heineken. Body is lite, carbonation is quite high, much better than in Heineken, corn- like colour, yellowish, like pee.

Aroma: Metalic, poultry feaces noticable, smells with old rice and corn, carbonation in nose, artificial aroma of plastic, aroma of beer puke, old, very bad corn, horrible, nothing from beer, no hops, no malts in aroma.

Flavour: Some artificial aroma pretending to be hops, the water from boiled rice, corn and cereal, it tastes like carbonated water from fermented cornflakes, very dry, violates your palate, skunkness of poor quality beer, almost can’t feel alcohol

Palate: On the front of the palate you can feel the taste of very cheap, strongly carbonated water from supermarket, very long, dry, nasty finish that spines and vioaltes your tongue, very poor quality beer, for a high price.

It was the first beer a friend bought me on my 21st, way back when and I’ve been drinkin’ it to be polite ever since. Somehow, it’s gotten piss-ier over the years. Now I just have to say no. Tastes like piss corn liquer with artificial beer flavor...

Aroma, sickening piss and vomit. 
Appearance. Piss, swilly head like I’m badly dehydrated.
Flavor. Now this is special. It’s actually gotten so much worse over the last 10 years or so. A slight faux-hop flavoring just to give it a little unpleasant soap-like bitterness without adding any niceness to the aroma. A disgusting sweetness follows, like throwing up a little in your mouth.

Overall impression. To be polite I now say "no thanks, uh, watching my weight--carbs, you know."
If there were nothing else to drink, I’d go for it.  Otherwise I’m like Alice in Chains on this one.  I stay away.
very light and pale, white head small. golden colour. same piss as bud. why do I have to try everything..

Pretty run-of-the-mill... Pours a clear golden color with a small white head.  Aroma and flavor are nothing to special.

On tap.
Hands down, the worst beer on the planet. So bad, that it is the only beer I would turn down for free, and would rather abstain from beer than drink. Liquid nausea.
MGD - This is a simple beer.  Yellow as seen in the picture - pours a small white head.  Slight aroma, slight flavor.  Not the worst beer but certainly not the best.

Bottled at the Spur in Waterloo. The only thing that sets this apart from other macro swill is the slightly sweet lemony finish. Other than that, a beer I drink to get drunk from, not to enjoy the taste of. But hey, I didn’t even have to pay for it! Sweet!

Having just tried this for the first time and compared it to its cousin Miller High Life, I can say that this is a decent US lager, not as good as High Life or Pabst Blue Ribbon, but a lot better than Coors and others.

It is very similar to Higgh Life all round, but is a little thinner, less flavourful, and has a slightly weaker head.  It’s gold with a meadium white head that shrinks slowly and leaves a hint of lace, basically identical to High Life except that the head and lace are slightly weaker.  The aroma is similar with a strong, perfumy corn and grain element and slightly more meaty.  The taste is also similar but thins fast and lacks the lasting perfumy grain taste, apple, and fuller feel of High Life,  That said, it is very clean and crisp yet still retains some flavour and light sweetness and bitterness.  It gets a little minerally, but this only slightly detracts, unlike Coors or Busch, which beers promptly take on only a rough, mineral-watrer character.
Miller Genuine Draft is a classic American style lager that lets you know that summer is in session, so break out the grill
I just plain do not like this beer. It’s watery, and thats it. i guess it’s just good for getting drunk.
Thin, watery, overly carbonated.  I’m not sure why people drink this aside from the fact that it is cheap.
very sugary taste,comes cheap on bottles and is ideal for summer bbq season

Nothing genuine about this.  American Pale Lager....a small amount of; corn, sweet malt, hay, straw, skunk, urine, sour hops, rice all thrown in a bottle.  If Miller went out of buisness I wouldn’t notice
Pale clear yellow with quickly diminishing head.  Aroma of corn & sweet malts.  Thin, watery, too carbonated, tastes of stale corn and water.  Astringent finish.  Yuck.
(USA) This Brew has a nice Golden color with a sm-white head. There is a mild grain / corn aroma with a smooth watery  taste!!!  Not much to say here, but i think this is better the Budweiser.
Bottle. It’s smoother than the champagne of beers and amazingly boring. Drink it cold at a ball game.

A very boring beer. Not offensive in any  way (except the fact that it doesn’t have a flavour) but very bland and boring. The palate is the most watery i’ve tasted. It’s actually as if the old joke about american beers similarity to love-making in canoes is the closeness to water is true in this case... A sorry beer!

This offering from Miller is a notch better and far less objectionable than "High Life" and "Lite".  There’s some evidence of an actual brewed beer in the taste, as opposed to wheat-and-barly flavored water.  Pale yellow color, no head, corny, grainy smell and taste.  Still has that "brewed with clorinated city water" taste that everything from Miller seems to be afflicted with.
Can.  Similar to all other mass produced swill type brews.  small fizzy head into golden body.  corn aroma. sweet flavor.  easy to drink due to high waterlike characteristics.

Not much going on with this beer. Very similar to all the other major brewers beers. bright golden colour with a bland taste on the palate..slightly sweet and thin..seems to lose any remaining taste the colder it is served

Bottle.  Pours a light yellow with a decent sized head.  Aroma is slightly sweet and of grain/corn.  Taste is similiar.  Fairly smooth and clean tasting, but on the watery side.  Goes down easy.  Overall, this is not a bad brew, but Miller High Life is better and costs less.
...MGD is crap, and always will be.  Shit american beer, that has a nasty horrible aftertaste of rice and some weird grass or something.  Idiots drink this.

Could be worse.  Reminds me of high school.  My boss always talks about how this is his favorite beer.  I laugh a lot inside when he tells me that with a straight face.  I don’t like it as much as Miller Lite because of the almost salty taste that accompanies this.
Could be a lot worse. Drinkable if nothing else is around. Seems to be a white trash favourite.
This is the beer that I look for in the coolers at the big get togethers. Fizzy on the palate with a slight metallic finish. A little more taste than Miller Lite and just as easy to imbibe.
This is my beer of choice when I get together with friends and family.  Has a lot more taste to it than the other big brewers.  Its also easy to get and throw a lot of these down in a day

OK, so I get this beer on flights, b/c it’s a little more flavorful than Miller Lite, and it’s not as horrible as beer snobs make it out to be.  Aroma is uninspiring but still slightly sweet and grainy.  Appearance is brilliantly clear with a full head (though doesn’t persist) that reminds me of soap suds...doesn’t look natural and probably isn’t.  Mouthfeel is slightly fuller than Miller Lite and pretty spritzy, but still thin.  Slight carbonic bite.  Flavor is slighly sweet and refreshing, though not much there.  Easy to pound when the steward is coming down the isle to collect your garbage.  Not bad, but not good either.

12 ounce bottle. I have had this beer multiple times but just got around to rating it now. This beer is your typical pale lager... golden pour with a decent amount of carbonation and almost no head. Smells very skunky. The taste is exactly what you would expect from a pale lager... full of yeast and bread. This beer is refreshing at best and is a decent beer to drink a lot of.
id rather drink pond scum than have another sip of this wretched swill. this stuff is worse than stomach acid

16 oz glass on tap at the SD Wild Animal Park. I’ve probably had this a hundred times but never before sat down to critically evaluate it.  A yellow-gold pour with a small white head that soon dissipated to a thin film. The aroma was weak and indistinct with a bit of sweet corn. The flavor was saccharine sweet with chemical biters and some light biscuit. Mouthfeel was thin and overtly fizzy.  The finish was short with a lingering metallic saccharine aftertaste. Overall: A bit better than I remembered, but still a drainer.
Nice looking beer with a head good head and brussels lace.  However corn is apparent in the aroma and the taste.  Weak aroma and taste.

Yeah, just like I remember if from high school, pretty much crap. Smells like sweet, trash malt with a ton, I mean a ton of corn syrup sugar. Pours medium golden in color with a parade of foam. Tastes like honey combe cerial (corn) cereal with a ton of foam. A lot and bite, like artificially sweetened filtered, malt beer.

Pours a piss-yellow. Light foamy head. Aroma is light and slightly yeasty. Theres really not much to say in the name of flavor. A bit of wheat, a bit of corn, a bit of rice, and bit of yeast. Carbonation is a bit too apparent. 

Basically, I won’t be having this ever again.
Aroma not present.  It’s appearance is plain.  It’s flavor is nah!!!  Palate is very ordinary.  Nothing great here.
I drank quite a few of these back in the day.  I also remember liking it better than some of the other beast beers
Terrible fashionbeer, like Amstel Pulse. Sweety watery stuff. Shit one, expensive one, no more please. True innovation in American brewing...
Boahh, dieses Zeug ist grottenschlecht! Es sieht aus wie ein echtes Bier und schmeckt fast nur nach Wasser. Müßte verboten werden, so was Bier zu nennen. This stuff sucks!

There’s something wierd about the taste of this beer.  Just doesn’t taste like beer- sort of sweet and malty?  Really lacking something- maybe decent  hops? Pretty boring  stuff overall. Definetly not one to savor. Keep around for mowing, and shootin the shit with the neighbor on saturday.
my choice of beers when you go to a party and this is the best of whats there my favorite of american macs
I’m sorry. But this is just not a a good beer. Nice color, good aroma for a commercial beer. But very much lacking in character. This isn’t what made Miilwaukee famous.

Golden colour with large white fluffy head.Aroma of hops and malt,feels mild and grainy.No aftertaste and a short finish.Some of the best beers of the world comes from USA but this is not one of them.
A yellow beer with a suprisingly nice head.  Very watery and a bit metallis. This is not worth drinking.

12 oz bottle. Bought this beer only because Ive never had it. It is one of the only beers at the bar that is $2.25. Not offensive in any way, Id prefer this to miller lite any day. Although the body is disgusting, the clear bottle doesnt help... people kept asking if someone had peed in my beer???

This is one of the beers I started drinking on. Thankfully I cam to my senses. It’s not an ugly  beer, but it’s average color is about all it has going for it. If you’re interested in headaches, this may be the beer for you. MGD has a horrible aftertaste that almost rivals the initial taste.

Picked up a can for 25 cents. Thought I should try it and at least learn how bad it really is for a quarter. 

Fizzy yellow beer...yuck. This is worse than the last crappy macro...fizzy tart flavor. Smells like rice. 


I wish I could get my quarter back.
341 mL bottle:  Golden in color, no head.  Decent aroma and flavor but nothing new to the table.  Served cold, goes well with food.
Not a very drinkable or satisfying beer.  I would recommend something else if it is available.
12 oz. bottle. Aroma was nothing special. Has a bland, but present flavour that would be excellent for a "lawnmower" beer. It’s drinkable, but no miracle.
12 oz bottle: pours macro lager gold (they have made their own color now) thin white head thats gone in a second. flavor is like carbonated water with a hint of grain, not barley just grain.

12 oz. Bottle poured into lager glass.  Nice Golden yellow body, but points off for a quickly vanishing head.  Aroma offers nothing enticing.  The flavor is bland.  The palate offers a more full bodied feel than most beers of its kind.  Very clean finish.  Carbonation is too high.  Avoid.
Miller Genuine Draft is good for these watery commercial beers like this. Yellow in color and way better than coors.

12oz bottle poured in a lager glass.  MGD pours pours light yellow but darker that an Budweiser.  The head is medium but dissipates quickly.  There’s something very wrong with the aroma.  The faintly nauseous smell reminds me of sweet creamed corn and sweat socks.  The body is highly carbonated and slightly coats the mouth.  The taste is very typical of large American macro breweries but has more flavor than Budweiser.  Why do I keep comparing this beer to Budweiser?  Because I’m from St. Louis and Bud is king here despite my evangelizing.  All in all this is a pretty terrible beer but if you’re going to drink a pale lager you could do worse.  Just be sure not to sniff the vile stuff.
a good keg beer but not some much from a can/bottle.  Not worth describing in detail

#1300 12 oz. bottle  Had this the other night at the local watering hole.  It’s your typical yellow flavorless BMC.  I needed a rating for #1300 and thought this one would work.  Not going to bore anyone with details.  Avoid when possible.
Turkish version. 0, 33 l bottle. Enjoyable only  on a hot summer day. Very thin and watery, tastes more like a juice to me. At least the bottle looks kinda nice.
well not that bad, if your going to waste the money, get miller high life. this beer tastes like skunk, but its a good party beer. good with food
Cold-filtering aside, this beer is pretty bad.  The clear bottle and connection to NASCAR make this one to avoid.

From a 12 fl. oz (US) bottle. Lot Code: 02118 B50341.  The design of the bottle is kind of nice.  Pours pale yellow with carbonation.  Smells grassy.  Tastes grassy.  I don’t see or taste any difference between this one and Miller High Life.  It’s an okay cheap beer but the other day I saw a 30 pack of Miller High Life on sale for $7.99. It’s easy to skip the draft when its sister brew is that much cheaper.  Nothing extraordinary.

a very average beer, drinkable, thirst quenching and decent... BETTER than budweiser!!! very clean, not very much personality to speak of, but a very honest beer for an honest days work, I could see bruce springsteen drinking MGD.

Taste wise and this is personal as good as a beer can be.  Drinks like water, very light and very chuggable, a good beer if you don’t want to get drunk.  And very over priced in Ontario at nearly $42 a 24
12 oz. bottle and can. Pours a light golden with white head. Really no aroma to speak of. Corn, water, carbonation. Macro brew.
33 cl bottle. Clear golden color. Fast disappering white head. No aroma, no taste. Not much to say - it´s a waste, it´s sad, it´s bad, I´m glad I shall never drink this again.

bottle and tap, I saw my friend the_captain rated this and I thought I would chime in on this one. this used to be a beer of choice back in the day for me. I still drink this from time to time. It doesn’t smell good at all(skunked) and it is a bit watery(esp out of a bottle) but I think the taste is ok and not bad for the money you will spend on it. it’s got an odd pale gold color that I could never realy figure out. I’d say this is a 2nd next to Pabst for me as far as cheap mass produced beer goes.

Another yellow fizzy pour.  Metallic taste, better on tap but why bother.  
Watery beer not to my likeing.
My staple beer, along with bud for a long time. Refreshing. Good price. Doesn’t taste bad and will eventually get you drunk.
This a good beer for an all day party of something.  it’s still not a very good beer though

One of my favorite "staple" beers.  This is a very good all-day-drinkability beer.  It’s color is a light gold, with an aroma of beer.  Good on a summer’s day without much heaviness on the body.  Clean on the finish.
In the three man race of Budweiser, Coors and MGD id have take MGD as the winner.  unfortunately its still horrible.

Nothing at all special.  Its beer.  Its better than milk in most situations like if you are in the car or at work.  At least Bud has a unique taste - this could be in that generic aisle with a white lable that says beer.
Pale color, decent flavor, slightly skunky smell. Probably one of the better miller offerings. Better than HIgh Life.
Moderate malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Small, frothy white head. Virtually none lacing. Fully diminishing longevity. Clear yellow body. Moderate bitter initial flavor. Light to medium palate.

Bottle. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head. Pale yellow colour. Light malty aroma, grain notes. Light sweet and bitter flavor. Short finish. Not as bad as feared, actually a refreshing lawnmower beer. Watery palate.

Probably the most tolerable mass produced American lager.  Smells of grains, corn is most prominent, and perhaps some slight hops.  Tastes of corn and some sort of sweetness (malt?), slight bitter metallic hop flavor, but much less discernible than is found in other American lagers.  Definitely smooth and more drinkable than other cheap beers, but still tastes pretty bland.  This is my cheap fall back beer when I can’t afford to spend more money.
One of the better American macros. Little flavor compared to craft beers but refreshing on a hot day when served ice cold. Prefer on tap or longneck bottle. Not so good in a can.

Well it’s quite bad but the best of what you can expect from a low end pale lager really. Lucky me, I’ve had so many of these recently, at various work related functions, I’m becoming somewhat of an awful pale lager connoisseur. Clear gold with a white head, nice lace actually. Nose of malt, grains and some metallic hops showing through. Taste is much the same, grainy malt and metallic hops, some butterscotch...nuff said...blah...
24 oz. can.  Although it doesn’t taste bad, the smell is somewhat skunky.  A nice beer for a hot summer day....unfortunately, it’s not summer yet.
tastes a little skunky even when it isnt. pours puper clear gold and the smell that is available doesnt leave me ready for a taste

Not a very good beer, aroma is not pleasant somewhat skunky even. Pours very clear gold color with white head. Flavor is less offensive than smell largely because there isn’t much flavor at all.  Its best feature is that it is very easy to drink, tastes almost like a light beer, could be worse.
Ok, I will admit to drinking this in large quantities when I was younger but I didn’t know better.

Bottled 33cl. It pours a pale yellow beer with a quick diminishing white head. The aroma is strongly metallic with hints of vegetables and grain. Some lime as well. The taste is of grain, vegetables, cheese and lime. Sweet with a very low bitterness. The finish is sweet and unpleasant. Poor lacing.

When I began to drink this beer it reminded me of a good draught flavoured beer from North Queensland nice and hoppy but the end flavour was almost nil,it gave way to nothing very watery.It smell was good, typical of draught beer and nice gold lager colour good head,shame on the finish.
Smooth and clear lager.  It’s attractiveness is in it’s ease to drink for me.  Almost tastes like a Lite beer.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of my girlfriend’s mother’s refrigerator. Why do they persist with the clear glass bottles? A pale yellowish urinesque color. Surprised? Minimal aromas, vaguely sweet and grainy taste that isn’t horrible, but isn’t notable. Minimal to no hop content. Still a decent beer, a bit more full bodied than a Lite. However, where I see a point in a Lite, I do not get much of a point in this beer? Why not opt for something else? Something outside the Macro Realm? Will probably drink again, but most likely, not by choice.

pale, very pale yellow, not much head
smells a little bit malty, a little bit like bear,where are the hops?
tasts the same as it smells
almoust no palate
wake me up if  i fall asleep when drinking it, it’s so deadly booring
A little bit more of a bite than miller lite.  Has a little more taste too.  Not terrible but still bland.
my golf beer.  since most courses only have domestics, this is what I’ll drink, if they don’t have this I drink water.  Not bad for golf beer, because you can stay upright by hole 18.
This was my drink back before I was 21, and I’m pretty ashamed to say that I drank gallons of this horse-water.  It’s a little blander than Miller High Life.

bouteille transparente de 341ml.

bière blonde blé, comme toute les autres. nez de maïs, de malt, nez industrielle, bouche légère, pas vraiment d’arrière goût pas de goût non plus. produit de consommation masse pour ceux et celles qui n’aime pas la bière.
Of the standard everywhere beers, this is definitely the best, not that thats saying much.  It at least has something that resembles beer-like qualities and a not so horrible taste.

Not the worst beer on the face of the earth, though it does its best to win that title. Poured a clear golden piss hue with a small then wispy white head.  Nose of spent malts and mildly spice (barely noticeable hops).  Riddled with chemicals but with a slight hops presence. Not total shite, but close.

It’s a not so bad cheap beer. Kinda rough though, I I would drink it over others I have tried. High carbonation, yellow, thin head. Nothing else to really say. Not much hops used, so don’t worry about it skunking in clear bottle.

My brother in law shows up at the house with a six of this because the dive he stopped at to buy beer was out of the regular Miller.  I don’t know why he was looking for Miller, he usually drinks Heineken.  This stuff was hard to choke down, rough and nasty tasting.  Its better than no beer, but not by much.  Pretty much what I expected from Miller, cheap and nasty swill.  ..  ..  7-27-2008 .. ..  purchased a 24 can case at the Navy Exchange at a net price of $5.49.  For that price I can drink it, at least on the ugly hot, humid, lawn mowing days.  Got it as a part of a rebate deal with another case of Miller Lite.  The MGD was better than the Lite, but thats no compliment.
This is defintily a beer to only enjoy when you are drunk, becuase that is about the only time its enjoyable.

those who say this beer has no flavor should try it warm.  Makes you angry and hateful after only 2!
I’ll re-rate this beer when I get some money to throw down the toilet.  I’m going off of memories for now, and my memory is the worst beer I’ve ever tasted, get bud instead.

RERATE:  I am not angry anymore, and two years later, i still drink bud.  However, at this point in my life all my taste buds are gone and it’s not worth the extra 2 bucks to buy the budweiser.  I actually am finding this beer pleasant.  the problem is the corn, but if you drink this cold and fast, you can’t even notice it.  you can almost get a touch of hop on the back end and not as funky sock as budweiser right now... will i switch?  maybe.
better than high life but still not very good, can’t tell if cold filter is meaningful or just a gimic, what to you think?
Pale and thin.  Too sweet and carbonated.  Not my cup of tea.  Many pale lagers that I like better than this.  Even some light beers.
Not much to say about this beer. i guess for the price it wasn’t awful but I would never buy it. Plain, predictable Miller beer.
This beer is nasty.  I can’t stand it, but it is another mass marketed American beer.  If I’m going to be forced to drink one of these it’l be a Bud.
Pretty bad beer. Decent beer to wasted on but good for nothing else. I drank a bottle of it tonight just so I could add the bottle to my collection.
Draft. Light gold. Corn-ish aroma, easy-going but thin and watery palate, and sweet-yet-refreshing flavour. Very basic but worked in a pinch.

24 oz can.  After an aggressive pour the beer had a small white head that rapidly dissapated and a clear light golden color.  Aroma was sweet corn--decent for what it is.  Taste is flat, a little dry, and has only the slightest hint of malt and grains.  It tastes as though I have a severe cold and severe congestion and cannot taste anything--very, very bland.  Finish is dry and slightly bitter.  Not as funky as other macros--a good choice if you want to drink 12 beers in a night.

Bottiglia da 33cl in un locale vicino a Piazza della Vittoria di cui non ricordo bene il nome, so solo che fanno anche delle (dispendiosissime) pizze, e hanno un buon assortimento di birre commerciali di scarsa qualità. Mi ci sono trovato per caso e ho voluto provare quella che trovo meno spesso in giro: versa senza un filo di schiuma colore giallino chiaro trasparente, puzza come un barbone di via venti, sa di minestrina con le uova. Se c’è un limite al peggio, spero che non sia molto distante da qui.
not to bad is a refreshing beer has a sweet taste not too expensive tried it in ever size avalible
When put to the tast test with it’s competitor Budweiser, and that’s not saying much, MGD wins hands down.  It has a fuller flavor, a sweeter taste, and a cleaner finish.

I think this is probably the best of the macro brews out there but I’m not sure that means a whole lot.  The beer looks great in the glass, but that’s about the extent of it.  No depth, no character, nothing remarkable about it.  I guess its just " get you drunk" beer.  Wouldn’t drink if it I had any other decent option.

Appearance-wise, this one is pretty good, but that’s probably its greatest characteristic. Golden body, with a thin, yet somewhat lacing head. The aroma seemed off to me, just like the flavor. In both cases, I can taste some malts, but there’s also this wierd metallic quality. I don’t remember Miller products being like this before, but maybe it’s just that my tastebuds have matured over time.

Sampled reluctantly in Mijas. Looks ok through the clear glass bottle. Smells sugary. Faint malt, ricewater, cornflake afters. Relative to certain other cervezas on offer in the local supermercado, inoffensive. 
(Accidental re-rate) Super-chilled from local offie. Dishcloth/stale sock smell. Industrial cider residual sugar fizz. No discernible beer-like characteristics. Genuinely vile.
I liked MGD growing up, so it grew on me over time.  Still a good beer in quantity, but not one to go and buy at full price.
As far as a macro brew goe this is about the best you can hope for. No head, Light hops and lightly sweet.

355ml bottle. 

Your average lager yellow with a disappearing head. Very little aroma, but i can pick out corn and apples. Taste of skunk, paper, and apple juice. It’s pretty unpleasant. No bitterness and almost no finish or aftertaste. Very thin and simple beer and not very good. This one ended up down the drain.

Don’t know how the "genuine innovation" fits in. Skunky carboard aroma, sweetness with a huge dose of sweet corn, not much of a finish, but that is not the aim of the beer really. Since aroma is the real low point on this and that most people would drink this straight from the bottle, it probably isn’t much of an issue.
Typical macro I guess.
My grandpa’s favorite beer. Had it with him. Suffered through it but definately wouldn’t try it unless under intense peer pressure.

Bottle: Poured a golden yellow color lager with a small bubbly white head with limited retention. Aroma of sweet adjunct is dominating. Taste is also dominated by sweet corn with a watery aftertaste. No hops could be detected and body is quite thin. Nothing bad but just really plain and boring.

I would choose this over Bud or Coors, but that really isn’t saying a lot.  It actually tastes alright, but the wierd aroma and aftertaste are a killer for me, not to metion the hangover I get from corn based brews.

Frothy urine.  That is all.  Quite possibly my least favorite beer.  Worst of all I actually had to pay $7.50 for this piece of junk at a hockey game.  It was the only beer left at the concession stand I was waiting.
12 ounce bottle. Classic  macro brew for less tha $1.00 not worth a comment.
Debuted during the "Dry" phase of the macrobrew marketing evolution.  Frankly suprised it’s still offered.  Port in a storm, nothing more.

Poured out of the can with a fair amount of head.  It has that kinda awkward, corny, "look at me, I’m a generic macro" smell.  It’s got a clear water-golden you can see through without any distortion appearance.  Tastes like miller light, only with a little bit more flavor.  Would I drink this to drink beer?  God no.  Would I drink this to not waste beer while getting drunk?  Well... I guess
MGD! it’s alright but i have not had it in a very long time. i remember it being pretty good.
Of the BIg-Three, I like this one the best for taste.  It’s always good on a sunny day or for a buzz.  It’s pretty smooth for not having much taste.
Tastes like a full flavored miller lite but the bad aftertaste isnt apparent as quickly. Somewhat harder to find in bars.
Tried it in a can earlier, and it was god awful. I put a lot of blame on it being in a can... Well a bottle was a little, better but still shitty. Awful aroma and aftertaste, very smooth.
Not a bad mass produced American Beer.  A little stronger and more bitter than Miller Lite, but still not bad at all.
not a bad beer but if i have a choice i would not buy it again.  i can see myself chosing this beer over other options.
i reserve my truly low scores for the battery acids and piss beers that baound   id take lite over this offering from MBC but that said theres a lot worse.  drew why do you drink this piss???
Bottle.  Just another mass produced lager from MBC.  It’s possibly a little better than some others but nothing special.
One of my favorite miller products.  pretty good when you compare it to whats around a lot of times.
Many people may knock on this beer, being a cheap miller product, but it has a nice smooth flavor that is very refreshing and thirst quenching.
no aroma, lame head, tastes better than some other BMC things, i can drink this without making a face, its bad but not the worst.
Not a great beer.  bottom of the barrell just above Bud.  Not an option in the Michigan area if a canadian beer is around.
No bueno. Yellow fizzy beer that taste like wa-wa, will drink if its the only thing left and its past 2am.
12 oz bottle-Sovereign Bank Arena at the PBR bull riding competition. Poured a yellow-clear coloring, with slight head, grainy flavoring, heavy carbonation, poor finishing.

33 cL clear bottle. Pours yellow, clear, with a white diminishing head. Dry cardboard grainy aroma. Thin grainy/cereal flavoured, too heavily carbonated. Leaving some bitterness in the finish. Not bad but not great either.
Absolutely the rock-bottom of all beers.  I mean, the flavor is metallic and sour, and it doesn’t have anything to do with the age...although I was doubtful of that as well.

It’s better than Budweiser. It’s not bad if you want to drink a beer, and don’t want to enjoy a full flavored beer. It is an ok beer, best generic beer that I’ve tried yet. It’s not one for a celebration though. It goes down smooth and has just enough bitterness, but it’s a bit watered down for a full apreciable flavor. But what it has is ok for what it is, a generic beer.
overall awesome beer, especially since other american beers aren’t that great
Bottle. Brewed in Miller EU. Pale yellow color with no head. Bad aroma of corn. Sweet, light flavor, of mostly cooked corn and only a hint of malt. Thin, watery mouthfeel. Yuck.
Even the higher ABV doesn’t save this dreck which looks like cold urine and smells like soured soy sauce (if that’s even possible).  Ugh.
Bad even by big brand lager standards. Yellow with little head. Grain aroma. Thin watery body. Corn flavour and very bland. Drops of the face of the earth at the finish. No more please.

Bottle 0.3 l (Kesko). Not as bad as you might think. Goes well with hot dogs and that’s propably what it’s made for. No traces of bitterness, but overall smooth and easy. Finely crafted, and surprisingly tasty for it’s kind.
Okay, but not much upside other than chuggability.  Not sure why they bothered to put out this replica of high life.

THOUGHTS: Pretty bad. I used to think this was the cream of the crop about 10 years ago. Well when the crop was Budwieser and Coors Light, maybe it was, but this is pretty awful.
TECHNICAL: Can. Poured a sparkling, light to medium yellow with an foamy, average-sized, white head that mostly diminshed. The aroma was light malt and moderate grassy hops. It reminded me most of the smell of a stale beer that was never moped up that is almost always present in a corner bar. The initial flavor was lightly sweet and sour, while the finish was moderately sweet and bitter, lightly acidic and sour with an average duration. There was some malt in the flavor but it was mostly sour with just a little hop finish. The light to medium body was syrupy with fizzy carbonation and a metallic and lightly astringent finish.

MGD is wimpy and mildly fizzy,  The weak flavor suggests rice, light hops, corn, and yeast.  This is bland, boring, cheap bar swill.  This used to be considered a good beer, a real draft beer as opposed to a canned brew.  Hmm... Rerated in 2009 & 2011, and it seems like it got a little sweeter and cornier, and the aroma declined.  "Fresh from the tap taste" says the trademarked slogan, along with Frederick Miller’s signature.   Maybe it is a little fresher than other macros, but why bother?  It is not the worst, but it is pretty close.  To be consumed only when nothing else is available..
When you need something else with your beer (like chicken, hot weather, a beerbong) to talk yourself into rating it higher, you should realize quickly that MGD is terrible.

Like the Miller High Life with Soy Sauce added.

Not one of Milwaukee’s finer beers.

12 oz can.  Pours a clear golden orange yellow with a medium frosty white head.  Faint aroma of wheat and barley.  Taste is of wheat, barley and water with a slightly sweet aftertaste.  Not bad for a macro lager and not bad with chicken either.
Another one of those beers that too many people drink because they think it is cool.  The flavor is managable if you drink a couple of good brews first.
Bottle at home. Clear urinyellow - white head. This is ugly. Sweetness, meat, "flæskesvær", syrup, light butter, corn. Gross !!
Boring taste, similar to all other millers. but i’d rather drink this than LITE. Water is what it tastes like!

Miller was always just a pubi hair better than Bud when I was growing up... but I remember when they first introduced this swill and I thought, ’well, they finally made a beer as crappy as Bud’... WHY?!
Another Miller product that tastes very similar to all of their other beers. BORING and tastes like grass.

looks like my piss when im really hydrated, they dont even try to make this "golden"...barely noticeable aroma of chemical skunk... taste of skunk and a long finish is butthole.... pretty awful, even COLT 45 is better
Typical macro, ok to drink while watching the game with friends.  But, flavorful or even good for that matter, not so much.
Costs less than bottled water. Tastes about the same. Pours fizzy yellow. Watery taste with very little hop and the taste of straw. Crisp, light finish.
It’s fine for when you just want a simple beer while watching the ball game.  Is smoother and more thirst quenching than many other mega-brew lagers.   The colder the better.

Some years ago I made a one off business trip to Milwaukee and on a free afternoon me and my colleague went to visit the Miller brewery. I was a bit disappointed to learn that despite the German roots of the founders the Reinheitsgebot (Purity Law of 1516 stating that beer be made only from malt, hops and water) is not adhered to. Such is rarely a sign of quality and in the case of the big American brewers (AB, Miller, Coors) the reasons seem to be rather economic. No surprise then the brew is totally bland, watery and insignificant. As it is commercially highly successful it may seem that some drinkers are scared of taste ...

Mildly sweet, but not enough to cover the dominant nastiness.  So many comments say "nice on a hot day".  Well, when you’re dying of thirst, I guess just about anything is "nice".  I’d rather drink water.
My favorite out of the big three american macrobrews, which really isn’t saying much. Still, its nice when you’re thirsty.

12oz bottle, poured into a shaker.  This beer poured a gold color with a foamy white head that totally disappeared within a couple minutes after being poured.  No lace.  The aroma was made up of sweet malt notes and some grain.  The flavor was dominated by the sweet malt.  Not much else present in the taste to comment on.  The mouthfeel was light-bodied with heavy carbonation, leaving a bit of a lasting, sweet metallic aftertaste.  This one is a beer for Miller drinkers that prefer to have a little more flavor in their water.

Awful aftertaste, no good reason I can think of for wasting my money on another bottle.  Do they filter it 5 times because it would be even worse if they did so less?  In that case maybe they should filter it 5 times 5 times.  If you want to give your money to the Miller Brewing Company, go instead with the Miller Lite, or better yet, High Life and save a couple of $$.
This is my most favorite of all the cheap american beers. doesn’t taste at all, perfect for parties and getting drunk. good with pizza. not a classy beer, white trash stylie.
For an American beer, not bad! Typical draft beer. Has metallic taste, possibly linked to chemical addition during fermentation and bottling period. Overall not a bad beer icy cold on a hot day.
There’s nothing to this beer.  I’m not sure what needs to be said.  There is a little maltiness to the flavor, which does make it taste slightly different than all the other macros.
Nothing special about this one....on tap at the Sibley County Fair...good beer for the fair...and a bbq....
Golden colour, Sweet Flavour, refreshing taste, very nice in hot tempreature area
Watery yellow gold in colour with a thin and rapidly disappearing white head. Highly carbonated and has a fizzy mouth feel. Thin bodied, weak and watery. A bland beer with a slightly metallic finish.

355 ml clear glass bottle - Very pale yellow/gold with very thin white head.  Medium carbonation. Watery, bland, sweet. There’s nothing actually bad about the taste but this is because it doesn’t actually have any taste.
12 oz bottle at a party.  just your average mass produced beer.  just like miller lite with a little heaver taste.
Bottle. Clear light golden colour with small fully diminishing head. Fizzy carbonation. Grainy aroma. Sweet flavor.

I’ve had this many times and never rated it.  This is not something you seek out, but in a pinch if its cold, it works.  Aroma is slightly sweet with grass and corn.  Flavor is slightly malty with a touch of bitterness.  Thin bodied.
A pretty good drinkable smooth draft , it certianly doesnt knock me out or anything but it has an enjoyable taste and a mild aftertaste , I think it would be a great beer to order with food at a pub
Crisp, and not completely awful.  However, it’s mostly watery and forgettable.  Another example of swill.

Sampled from a large bottle, did not pour out.  The color is clear, light gold with a very small white head.  A very bland aroma, lightly hopped, mostly adjuncts.  The flavor was not too bad, a mild bitterness with some subtle sweet and sour aspects; not very strong.  The palate was a bit thin and oily, not too wet, slightly on the dry side.  It’s not a great beer, many of the smaller companies make better, mass-produced pale lagers.

This is my favourite American beer (so far out of the limited swill I have tried).  I tried it a few times here in Canada (brewed by Molson under license) and was pleasantly surprised.  After moving to Memphis Tennessee, I tried it there, and was even more pleasantly surprised, an American brewed beverage that was better than it’s Canadian brewed counterpart (unlike Budwesier, Coors, Coors Light, and Miller High Life).  This is the one American beer I come back to from time to time.  The aroma is pleasant with some slight malty tones.  The colour is a light golden colour similar to straw.  The taste is slightly malty with some grassy undertones.  It is very crisp on the tongue with some mild carbonation.  A nice refreshing beer for an American macrobrew.
Where is the roasted hops flavor back label speaks of ????????..............

Flight home from RBSG 2007 - Why the hell not...it was free.  Poured a beautiful sparkling dark gold, thick fluffy white head.  So who we kidding?  Aroma of sweet corn, grains, and light grassy caramel.  Non-offensive flavors of all the above.  Light bodied, fizzy carbonation, smooth, wet grainy finish.  Not horrific by any means. If handed to me (as in this case) I would never turn it down, but would certianly not buy one either...

A good basic party beer, very much preffered over Bud.  Again, this isnt marketed as a unique or painstakingly complicated brew - IT"S BEER!  It’s not trying to be the next best thing - it’s meant to get you through the work week so you can drink the really good stuff on the weekend!

Can. Golden coloration with a nice white head, althoug not so persistent. It´s a light beer, without bitterness. Nice aroma for a pale lager. Besides, it´s not a watery beer. Very drinkable. One of the best pale lager I know.

On draft at Naperville Ribfest.  I’ve had this one plenty of times before and just never rated it.  Nothing particularly wrong with this one.  There’s nothing offensive about it and it’s better than something like Busch.
xxx yeaa..... no, dont drink this please, dont drink this for me, ill be ever so greatful.

I agree with JLAudio in that it is a smooth beer....smooth as water. This is the beer I keep at my house for when a friend, who is not a beer drinker, feels left out. Has an OK hoppy flavor, but where is the barley? I think they forgot to add some ingredients here....
I lke this beer it has a great smooth taste when it is really cold. As soon as it starts to get woarm it is not as enjoyable

mgd.......ok yes it is smooth and yes i could sit down and drink a case but it has nothing that i look for in a beer. dont pay the inflated price for this beer. there are plenty of pale lagers priced way better so buy them. mgd’s slogan shhould be "cold filtered 4 times so it tastes and goes down like water"
this beer sucks.  anything miller makes sucks.  I don’t understand how people drink beers with no flavor.  Maybe its cheap, I don’t know.  not really any distinct flavor or aroma.  Color is yellow.
A decent beer. I can think of many others i would rather drink, but this one is okay when it’s on sale. A non-distinct nose with a sharp, tart to chemical tasting taste, with lots of carbonation.
Pretty weak pour of straw yellow that shows a weak and dull n ose.  The flavors are pretty much a corn based taste with a similar finish.
One of the better Miller Products in my opinion.  Not a bad choice for a cheap beer.  Taste is at least smooth....as water

Prefer the miller from the cans. That shows how much I rate it!
Not tooooo bad when really chillled and swallowing rapidly with meal etc. Not for me now. Don’t get me wrong, I am not a beer snob. I used to love it years ago, but just not the same. Have they changed recipe etc? (in same way as I used to love Rolling Rock, but since it was moved and brewed in uk under license, it has become putrid)

Aroma of corn and aluminum. Is a yellow gold color. Flavor is sweet corn. Is watery. Is not very good. I do not like Miller products except Olde English 800. If I am going to drink something that tastes like corn syrup I am going to drink a coke or pound a 40 of Old Gold.
an old favorite of mine. good smell but has a hint of metal for some reason. a little sweet and watery. with a little bite.

I’m not sure why when i ranked this it ended up being lower then most other macrobrews... in reality I like this one just as much as say Canadian or the like. Must have been my mood at the time of ranking!

This was the official beer of my unit in the Army, no joke. My commander loved this stuff. I on the other hand do not. Better then Bud, not better then Coors. It smells like aluminum to me, and that’s in the BOTTLE! Bitter piss.
Bottle. Yellow colour with a white head. Mostly grainy aroma. Watery flavour with a light sweetness.

Bouteille 355ml claire. De couleur dorée jaune et transparente. Nez de maïs assez sucré et de sucre chimique, léger de grains de malt pâle avec de faibles notes herbeuses de gazon mouillé. Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et légèrement croustillant ainsi qu’une texture aqueuse avec de petites notes sirupeuses sucrées (maïs). Léger goût de grains de malt pâle aux notes croustillantes lors de l’entrée en bouche avec un léger goût chimique sucré suivi d’un goût de maïs sucré avec de faibles notes amères de houblon herbeux en finale. Post-goût court et aux petites notes sèches, composé de petites notes chimiques et de traces amères de houblon herbeux.
A real beer, not one of these micro brews that are trying to pass themselves off as such. Good taste, and like most beers, it pours nicely into a glass (thanks largely to gravity).
genuine tird.  I would actually go the high life route.  At least it is funny to drink the "champange of beers"
Not as bad as I expected.  Pours from the can a light yellow color with faint white head.   Corn nose and a corn tasting body.  Chemical finish.
Bottle.Clear yellow.Smells of corn and is not pleasant.Faint malt sweetness and no real sign of hops.A mediocre pale lager.More drinkable than some other macro’s,but that’s not really saying much.

As far as an over produced beer goes, this one isn’t too bad. Mostly unoffensive taste of malt that is refreshing when cold. Good with food and can be drunk in mass quantites
Not amazing at all but respectable for a mass produced offering i guess
clear bottle makes me very nervous though!

Was offered a lime in this one, but thanked no. Suspecius "cereal grain" added, along with barley malt. Was overall very weak, some malts and corn in the flavor and aroma, but not alot. Harmless and boring
god do i not like miller.  but if its there at a burger joint and they dont have bud (very doubtful) i might have one.  as long as its happy hour.

Black Can 2nd beer of the night of a pub crawl sponsored by the local Miller rep.  Had a Lite, figured I might as well get the rate.  Why would they put this in a black can?  Corn and water.  Barely drinkable when cold, just awful warm.  Again, why a black can?

Bottle. Nice refreshing beer to hot days... Clear yellow color with weak aroma and thin white head. no more to say.

Cerveja clara e refrescante, boa para dias quentes. Aroma fraco e fina camada de espuma!

Rated 8/19/06:  Free swill at a golf outing today so I thought I can finally rate this. Had it in all forms many times throughout my life. For swill, Miller is decent and MGD is alright in my book. Light aroma nothing to note, medium golden color, mouthfeel is adequate for what you get, and the flavor is a little more bold than Bud. Overall drinkable but nothing to get excited about.

This .bier is probably the only macro  that i really like,tough it doesnt have too much aroma, after all is a pale lager.Of all the non-craft beers that i know this is the only one that i really like.Fucking great!!

I never really understood draft beer in a bottle. Aren’t you able to get the  same beer from a tap cheaper, plus I don’t think it’s comparable to tap beer. Pours a hazy yellow with small head no aroma corn taste no aftertaste
Bottle. Gold with middling white head. The cold-filtering process seems to remove all aroma and aftertaste. Watery rather than smooth with a hint of bitterness.
Several bottles.  No aroma.  Slight white bubbly head seen inside the bottle. Sweet corny flavor that goes down smooth ice cold. Little to no aftertaste.  Good for guzzling when hot and thirsty.

not a fan. i don’t like the sweet fruit taste i can pick up as soon as the beer gets a little warm. bud doesnt have it so i prefer bud for a cheap macro. i guess it works as a pizza beer, just not for me. body typical, no aroma, water texture.
This was a favorite after our soccer club meetings because it was so cheap, about $10 for a 30 pack. We were poor in those days with children to take care of.
Thin fizzy body with some strange apple/fruity sweet notes.  Aroma, what aroma?  No finish to speak of.
if fresh can be wheaty and somewhat drinkable. Decent pissy, watery, tasteless, carbonated beer.

Pretty old 12 oz can.  Had it at a relatives party.  Aroma seemed to be a bit whiskey like. The taste that followed was also a little coarse. I’m not sure why this is so much more popular that the original Miller Highlife.  Miller highlife is a much more enjoyable beer. Surprising bitterness on the palate but this was not malt or hop bitterness by any stretch of the imagination, it was more industrial or metallic. Schmidt’s, Old German and Pabst are so much better than this and they are cheaper. I guess it tasted bad because of the age, should try again.  Almost as bad as the City lagers or King lager!

My friends work for SABMiller so I am slowly reviewing their products. Pours a golden pale yellow brew with a white fast dissolving head. Good lacing. Aroma is pretty much corn, soft fungi (mushrooms), and a touch of citrus. Taste is watery with a touch of bitterness. Finish is crisp, clean cut and virtually nothing. Beer - If you want a good "blue collar," bowling alley social, Milwaukee Brewers baseball swill, this is the product specially made for those activities.
This beer has very little aroma. Very heavy carbonation. I can drink this with food, but that is about it. It’s sad this is "genuine", but hey, its a macro brew. I’d much rather drink High Life.

Bottle, 33 cl. Pale clear golden, small adn short-lasting head. Stale and skunky corn aroma, no hops of course. Watery with a spritzy CO2-mouthfeel. Low bitterness, low sweetness, everything is low with this beer except for that nasty corn aroma.
12oz bottle.  Aroma isn’t there(probably due to the sub zero temp and frosted mug it was  served in).  Flavor of corn shows through.  Another yucky macro brew.  At least it’s not a light beer.

On tap in St. Paul Minnesota. No aroma really. Pale golden with a thin head. Taste was mainly corn and grain. It’s about what I expected. It’s not horrible with food, but there are a lot better out there. Even Budweiser beats this.

500ml can at home. When the can is opened a smell of cowshed comes through. The smell continues with the pour turning more into grass or hay. Clear, pale golden body. Soapy, white head rapidly reduced to nothing at all. Good lacing, though. Very sweet in flavour - to my taste it is little more than artificial carbonated sugar water. One of my lowest score, I’m afraid (27.04.2007).
This is the only beer that Miller makes that I can drink. It’s nothing to write home about but it works when there’s nothing else.
it’s just so damned pissy.  Why the hell do people drink this?  And the saddest thing?... it’s the best of the big brewery shite that all my friends and I grew up on.
Grain and corn aroma.  Golden with high carbonation and thin head.  Mild sweet malts with a mild hop finish.  Smooth and refreshing on a hot day.

This is carwash material (only for the bottom parts and the wheels thought). very light no taste, except some bad mouthfeel afterwards. 

What is this liquid made of????

Paaaleeeese....awful stuff.  Seriously, why are Americans continuing to support these awful lagers when microbrews from Surly and Dogfish continue to make quality products.  Wouldn’t offer this stuff to my worst enemy.
This is a typical macro beer that doesn’t need much thinking to drink...I enjoy it and like it almost as much as High Life.
Golden MGD is common here in America more for adults it seems.  Golden color, I personally don’t like the aftertaste.  Good enough for a cheaper American beer.  Better than Budweiser.

This is an old standby from college.  Has a bad aftertaste, but other than that is a lot better than the other mass produced beers like Budweiser.  This is also my go to beer when I am playing blackjack for some reason.

Ah Miller, you’ve done it again.  Pours the color of real beer, lulls you into high expectations.  Lift the glass to your lips and taste the delightful tinge of rubbing (Isopropyl) alcohol mixed with hop-tinged mop water.  Kind of like a beautiful girl with no brains whatsoever.

this was the drink before i discovered fine ales...and when i cannot talk the folks in to it (or do not have enough notice to brew a nice batch at BREW IT UP, this is what i will take to a bbq (if some other cheap micro is not on sale...). been so long....

If I  have to drink beer out of a can, this is what I buy.  It is the only canned domestic beer that I will drink because it is the less tin tasting of all of them.  It has a heavy corn flavor, but a pretty clean finish.  Not a gourmet beer, but practacle, cheep, and a necessary evil to enjoy on rare occasion.

Bottled.  Pale yellow, airy head. Ligt vegetable aroma. Sweet and grainy, light bodied with flavours of corn, water and boiled vegetables. No bitterness. Cloying syrupy sweetness reduces drinkability.

Slightly better than Bud.  i think the corn adjuncts (filler) gives a little more flavor than Bud’s rice adjuncts.  I admit I haven’t tried MGD since I first tasted Sam Adams in college.  Not that Boston Lager is the best in the world-- but boy it opened my eyes to what a beer is supposed to taste like.  But I’d definitely drink this stuff before I’d ever touch a Bud or Coors-- for what it’s worth.
Perfect on a hot summer day! Heavier than some. Good taste for the price. Generally, not too much head. Good solid color.
33cl bottle. Looks like any other pale lager. Not much aroma. Tastes faintly of malt with a highly unpleasant indrustialness to it. Very little hop bitterness. Poor.
A champion amoung the big dogs, this beer is good for refined fishing and hot days on a porch.
Bottle.  Grainy aroma.  Mouthfeel typical of a pale lager.  Flavor is also grainy, but not good overall.

This use to be the beer I reached for most frequently as a juvenile. Now that I am just barely leagal I am starting to appreciate the finer things in life. I will probably never have a chance to drink this again so I am grabing the rating on memory.

bottle. MGD vs. HighLife. so 2 friends were each drinking 1 and asked me which one i thought was better so i took a sip of each. the MGD was very watery, stale, bready, and the flavor was just bad. Who would have thought, right? The HighLife has a bit nicer flavor.1.1

24oz can, sweet wet grain and corn aroma. Flavor is same with mild bitterness, it’s clean and refreshing, adjuncty but better than the 1.1 snobby rating I gave it before.
Not bad my favorite miller product but still not very great drinkable strange bite to it but still better then any other miller

Not too bad... I dont mind the cold fitered ones - a bit crisp and fresh like a super/extra dry. Americans cant brew beer so you cant expect too much, but compared to most of their other rubbish, this is alright.

Bottle: Clear light yellow colour, with a thin head. Aroma is bread,grainy,smouth hopy nose,almost anonymius,sparkling.
Flavor is almost the same,werry watery mouth feeling,thin body ,short finish.

(Bottle) Pours pale golden. Very corny and rubber like aroma with some stewed cauliflower. Tiny traces of hops that brings sweet rotten grass. Terrible aroma. Sweet corny flavour with a small touch of sugar. Minimum traces of hops in the flavour as well but no bitterness. Very light body.
Bottle.Yellow colour with short lasting fizzy foam. Aroma of corn, some malt. Flavour the same. Simple thirst quincener. Drinkable when cold.

From a 12 oz. can. Pours with a frothy head that settles to nothingness.  Smells of nail polish remover.  Very light color.  Not a lot of flavor or mouth flavor.  This is best served near freezing as possible.  Really, I’d rather drink an Old Style or PBR at the ballpark.  But I’d have to say I’d take it over a Bud.  But again, that’s not saying a whole lot, is it?
Nice golden pour with lots of head.  No real flavor, with a lingering sour taste.  Not my beer of choice.

Tap. Pale golden body (without soul). Nice fizzy head. A light sour and nutty aroma. Thin pilsener flavour which disappears at once. A bit sour too. This is not a beer to remember. (Czech Inn Dublin, 17.03.07)
Been my beer since I was 16...however I have stumbled on a microbrew for my first time and now I know this is not all that great...but still drinkable. Not too bitter and clean quenchable.
O.K. I guess. No taste, no nothing, just aftertastes I dunno--I guess I’m more a dark lager type

Bottle 0,33l. Brewed under licence "in the EU". Pale golden yellowish coloured.  A white creamy head that almost disappeared. Faint grainy aroma. Flavor of wet cardboard with sweet hints. I’d rather drink water.

I didn’t even like this beer in college, which is saying a lot cause I drank Natural Ice like it was my job.  Clear golden color with large fizzy white head.  Aroma was pretty much nothing.  With many beers th warmer it gets the better the aroma becomes, with this beer it gets sweeter, but also worse.  The best thing about this brewer is their commercials.

Can poured into glass.  I have heard that it is very hard to make an inoffensive pale beer.  That’s great...but it still doesn’t make the beer good.  Inoffensive in every way.  No aroma.  Very clear with the look of straw.  Very little taste.  It is certainly liquid.

When it comes to cheap domestics, this beer isn’t all that bad. Aroma is barely there, but isn’t terrible. It’s color is pale, not very pleasing to the eye. The head is thin. As for flavor, once the brew is exposed to oxygen, it gains a slightly sweet undertone, which gives the brew a much better overall taste. This brew is much better than any other cheap domestic, just make sure you take it in a glass.

holy hell this is awful. adjunct city! tastes of cheap rice and corn. aroma is non existant. i guess its decent if you want something that is the equivalent of water with a bit of macro cheap beer flavour to it. it was so bad near the end it was starting to taste like apple cider. brutal!

Smells terrible.  No head.  Almost no color.  A good amount of fizzy hides some of the flavor, and then it’s gone before you can taste too much of it.  So, no harm, no foul I guess.  Just hold your nose when you drink.

Aroma is nice and has a hoppy scent, however the appearance is so pale that it makes it hard to drink. Served cool its a smooth drink but has limited to no flavor. Only recommended at a party in a 30 pack.
this is good getting drunk while your out fishing beer...... its much better than budwieser
A better version of your typical crappy macro. Has a decent amount of taste that makes it easy for drinking and the color is a decent lager.

not bad, not bad at all, me and my buddies drink a lot of these and they go down really really smooth....like freakishly smooth, i can drink this stuff like water, but i am not implying that is tastes watery, becuase it tastes quite good
Nothing special, nothing amusing. Too dilute, and it must be a joke that SABMiller still continues to produce MGD Light, even though the MGD itself is light enough.

What can i say about MGD.  A really boring and typical american beer.  Pours a golden yellow with a small fizzy white head.  Pretty blah, and only worth it if you are just gonna get really drunk.  Good for beruit and flippy cup......i guess.
what aroma? Oh you mean like you open the bottle and it smells like a fraternity floor? What taste? Water. crap haha not undrinkable, but not more of a beerbong or lets get wasted beer

A 24 oz bottle with no born on or freshness date. The beer poured a yellow body with a white head. The smell is of grains and faint hops. The taste is a cereal and not much else. The Carbonation is good and the beer has a nice crisp finish.  Not bad for the style.

12 oz bottle. 
Pale golden, soapy white head.




Corn and skunk aroma.



Bitter metallic flavor, I had to look again to make sure it was from a bottle.  



Not very good.
Whoah pilgrim....This beer will beatcha over the head with a musket and take the indian arrows straight to tha bizzank

Medium offwhite shiny head over light copper body. Sweetish sugary corn aroma with marzipan notes. Taste is strangely empty caramel with a buttery mouthfeel. Watery, unpleasantly artificial roasty aftertaste. Buttery taste lingers in the mouth. It didn’t smell too bad, but the taste is unpleasant. It’s a slick commercial product, with the unpleasant off taste that seems to go with that. (0.33l bottle.)
I like skunk, but not in my beer. You guys all have it summed up, it’s crap.

Another classic party beer - everything about it is just about all right if you get it from someone else. Virtually no taste, it does a quick and nasty job on your senses which can be useful when needed.
the guy below me pretty much has it all summed up.  very skunky and no flavor

Genuine what? Skunk? crap? anyway, one sip of this and all I could taste was the corn and rice adjuncts.  My father is from Burton-on-Trent, England and this is what he has in his fridge.  Pale, thin, tasteless, useless

This beer left me with no other impressions than: Remember never to buy this one again! it has a refreshing, slightly citrussy bite in the otherwise very watery flavour and the bitterness is very low in the finish. Too thin for my liking.

aroma crap
appearance:crap
flavor : crap
palate:crap
overall:crap

I would only drink it if it were free
Bottle. Yellow/golden color. Tiny white head. It’s difficult to describe the almost non-existing aroma; some corn maybe... Weak grainy flavors. No hops. Superlight body. Highly forgettable.

Bottle. Head was spare to small with a white slightly frothy sparkle. Spare lacing. Clear slightly sparkling body. Color was pale yellow. Aroma was light grain, straw, grass with some notes of sweetness. Light bodied with a thin texture and an average carbonation. Light sweet flavor with light notes of bitterness. Short finish.

I see this beer has a low rating, but due to it’s availability and affordability, I have developed a taste for this cold-filtered brew. The aroma is average, but the flavor is smooth with a little bite without giving you a nasty-taste face. When served ice cold, MGD looks like golden goodness. For a domestic beer, it’s one of my top three.

Pale golden colour with a tiny white head that dissapeares quickly. Smells of grass and corn. Very low carbonation. Flavor of malts and corn with a sticky corn aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel and quite easy to drink (although to me, the corny aftertaste doesn’t make it pleasant enough to have another one). Overall, tipical macro pale lager but this one with noticeable hops on the nose and corn everywhere else.
Pale in color. Thin, quickly dissolving head. Nothing special, but fairly smooth. Not bad if you are really thirsty.

1/23/07: Bottle. 
 Why not?  Light corn or wheat nose.  Body is light lemon in color with a slight filthy lace.  Flavor is slightly lemony.  Clean and actually refreshing when cold.  Not bad – rating by style.
piss in a bottle abvoid at all costs bllaaaaaaaaak this stuffs terrible should be banned

Bottle, from non-dimpled mug, at 55F. The white head is as bubbly and quickly disappearing as store-brand cola, and vastly inferior to that of a good root beer. Lacing? Hah! Color is among the palest of the pale, in league with Rolling Rock Extra Pale. Same cheap cereal grain smell as so many other American macro pale lagers. Mouthfeel is...nonexistent...perhaps a bit syrupy. Carbonation shows an initial lively bite, but quickly reveals itself to be a ruse. Flavor of corn syrup. Finish is sweet and sticky. If there’s a single hop pellet in each industrial sized batch, I’ll eat my hat. This is essentially light beer. On the upside, the new bottles look pretty cool (different from the picture here), although they’re still clear glass. Maybe Miller is hoping this beer will go skunky, so it won’t smell like tap water.

Poured a very pale yellow, with a thin fizzy white head that did nothing to enhace the appearance or character of the beer. Some slight off-aroma that I can only describe as a macrobrew scent. 
The first sip conveyed whatever that macrobrew scent was - a little sulpher, a little cabbage/corn/vegetable. Subsequent sips (thankfully) had no taste or aroma at all. Very thin mouthfeel (if you can call it that) and absolutely no reason to inspire you to drink another one.

Clear golden colour. Non aroma  Mouthfeel is a rough and harsh terrain, with a grainy sweetness to be traversed in every sip. A horrid brashness exists in every attempt to gulp and it leaves a non-existent finish.
Not bad, reminds me of high life...wasnt it rumored to be the same? i dont know, but its not bad.

This beer is the prototypical American Lager.  Beer afficianados will dislike it’s lack of bitterness, whereas refreshment seekers will appreciate its smooth, clean flavor, and minimal aftertaste.  Not as much of a chick beer as corona, but pretty close.  A little weak for my tastes.

This beer has no aroma worth mentioning.  It’s not a bad aroma, just a lack of aroma.  Typical watery mouthfeel.

You either like american style lager, or you don’t.  Those who like it will claim it to be better than it really is, those that don’t will call it piss.  Often just because everyone else calls it piss.  Make up your own mind and drink what you like.
How do people drink this sewer piss?  This is disgracefu.  A beer that can give you a hangover very easily.  One of the worst things I have ever tasted.
Tasted foul. Almost tasted like it was an unfinished brew - could definitely taste the alcohol through the weak taste of corn and other ingredients.  Actually gave me a headache.

Very pungent aroma, it stings the nostrils.  Not recomended to anyone who enjoys drinking beer.  I guess if you just wanted to get drunk it would do the trick. This is the only beer I absolutely would never drink again, I couldn’t even finish one.
Bottle.  Mild light color.  Corn and light malt.  Weak flavor and mouthfeel.  Below average in all areas.  Slightly unpleasant bitter duration, if it can be said to have one.
A cheap but dependable beer.  Of all the crap beers, this one is the smoothest.

I used to prefer MGD until I tasted better beers.  The aroma that I detect now is akin the aroma of a ’day-old’ can of beer.  This is the beer to open when you want to get intoxicated.  For a beer to enjoy, look elsewhere.
Very strong aroma of corn and malt.  Taste not surprisingly corny and bitter.  Poured with a thin white carbonated head.  An alright beer for a night of drinking, but not my first choice.

Beer poured well light straw colour with a good head. Head settled to a thin lace quickly. Very faint malt aroma only noticeable after beer had warmed. Very mild flavour no noticeable flaws but also no noticeable qualities.
Mouthfeel was in keeping with style.
Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of corn and malt.
Drank from bottle: Golden in color with white bubbles. Aroma was sweet and skunky. Sweet corny grain flavor, with a watery malt. Drinking beer only!
Refreshing every now and then. Not a great beer but not a bad beer. I enjoy a 24oz bomber every now and then.
Quite possibly the worst beverage I have ever endured. I was struggling to get the taste out of my mouth. Just NASTY.
Can. One of the top from Miller right behind high life. Flavor is somewhat tolerable and decently smooth.
Another very boring american macro. Not the worst though. Not bad on a summer day.

Not a great beer. Bland wth not much appeal. The one thing this beer has going for it is it’s competitors (Bud, Coors,etc.) are not as good. That is not saying much. The carbonation overpowers any taste it tries to have. Yuck.

Pours out in a rather piss color of yellow, form white foamy head.  Smell of the usual crap such as dirty dish water, salt, some hops and a very destinctful aroma of bar carpet.  Flavor of salty, dirty water with a tad hint of hops/malt.  Ends with an aweful bitterness that says "enough!".
Miller Genuine Draft is one of the better golden beers in my opinion.  I would much rather have this than Budweiser or Miller.
I actually think this is better than Miller’s regular line of crap as indicated in my rating. Still, don’t believe the propaganda and avoid this like the plague.

This is the greatest beer I’ve drank in a long time. Lately I’ve been chugging 211’s and Hurricane High Gravity’s just to get as wasted as humanly possible, but drinking MGD is just so refreshing. 

Excellent taste, goes down smooth, and an overall great beer. Recommended for anyone.

Oh, and...

the bottle’s cute too. 

:)
For a mass produced miller product , this sucker was pretty good, It packs a seriously good solid taste that comes with a good head and aroma, its price is a tad high but still not a bad buy.

Canned. Pours pale gold. Exitable creamy looking head with good lacing but artificial looking. Grasy hop aroma with a little malt. taste is thin and slightly sweet . very eggy/sulphourous in flavor. a smidgen of bitterness to finish with some chemical harshness. not good.
Nice looking bottle, light on flavour a bit on the watery side but a better choice than Budweiser, one of my favourite beers from the USA.

Hey at least it is beer. I will take Miller over Bud or Coors anyday. Beer is easily drinkable even though it looks like piss. Doesn’t smell too bad. Doesn’t taste as horrible as the worse beers. All in all, if I see a tap of MGD in a basement party, I am relatively happy that I do not have to drink piss like Natty.

"Representing a true innovation in American brewing, MGD’s patented cold-filtered process fashions the smooth drinkability of draft beer available in bottles and cans. "

Whoopdy ding.  Tastes like a mass produced, easily drinkable beer.  Nothing to get excited about.
Bottle at Shaherzad, L.A. Not a very good beer. Very watery. Worked fine with Persian food but nothing special at all. Avoidable.
gross, crap, disgusting, watery, naval piss.  The only people who drink this stuff that I know personally are Navy sailors, and those clowns would drink a cockroaches piss if it got them drunk.

All I can say about this is it is light enough and cheap enough that you can (and I have in younger days) drink a load of these at once. Beyond that, the aroma is almost skunky, the taste is typical BMC grain flavor, and the palate dry and non-impressive. It’s amazing how things change, as I used to really enjoy this beer before I started drinking and rating real beers.
i drink this at partys when there is nothing else to drink-nasty. only thing inviting here is looks and a little sweet aroma and taste. give me a budweiser any day!
Yuck, boring, yuck.  It’s water with hops in it.  It pains me to see people drink this stuff.  Bleeehhehehehhhh!
I’ve had worse, but this beer does nothing for me. I’ll drink it if it’s free, but even then I think spending money on something better is worth it.
Corn aroma.  Watery flavor.  Not much else to add other than to say it’s not as good as High Life.  Worse than regular Michelob, but slightly better than Mich Golden Draft.
Uriney color with same uriney head. This is terrible like everything else they make.  Avoid.
