Clear fizzy urine color with a medium rocky white head. Funky grain aroma. Mild grainy flavor, some sweet light honey hints.

Clear pale greeny-yellow body, large rocky white head.  Vomit aroma.  Now, I didn’t expect this to be good, but I didn’t expect it to stink this badly.  Flavour isn’t so bad, very grassy and corny.  This stuff is the reason I hated beer for so long.  Ew.
Not bad, but not good either.  Very light and carbonated, but not a whole lot of flavor.  No aroma, no pour, no palate.  Good for really hot days at the beach.
It really tastes bland. Corn aroma pours golden/yellow with a little head that fisses away quickly. Horrible
Just gross.  Tastes like Coors with grass clippings mixed in.  Thank goodness for alcohol, because otherwise this beer would be an atrocity against humankind.

Virtually no aroma. Not even corn. Medium P--- color with a substantial white head. I swear it started with a hint of citrus, went on to something maltish, disappeared into bog water, and maybe a bit of hop at the end. Maybe not. Compared to craft brew this stuff should sell for two-bits a bottle or can. If that.

SHMEDLEY BEER TASTING 09-16-2006  Pale yellow with a flimsy loose head that disappears more quickly than beer nuts at a football game. This brew had a cabbage-like stench with not a hint of hop aroma to be found.

this has to be the fizziest beer i’ve ever tried.  Ugly yellow color, bubblier than dammit, literally smells like piss. This has the sudsiest head I’ve ever seen on a beer.  it looks exactly like dish soap got inside of your beer.   Foster’s or Coor’s light at least don’t taste like much, so if I had a choice I’d take them over this.  The fizziness is out of control with this crap.  Nasty stuff.
good beer for a macro.  Toss up between this and Bud. A bit more of a hop profile, and a taste of corn.
Pale golden color. Pours a white foamy head. Some lacing. Smells faintly like beer. Taste is better than High Life, but still not great.

Pale gold with a decent white head that mostly lasts and even coats the glass.  Aroma of corn malt and some hops.  Smooth clean taste of sweet boiled corn, slight hop bitterness, and fresh bread.  Pretty good for a macro, but nothing special overall.
Slightly better than the watered down version (Miller Lite). Only because it has just a bit more alcohol content and body.

12 oz can-Sometimes when you go to an event like a concert you gotta suffer w/a macro. This isn’t the worst one out there, does seem to have some sense of flavor. Sweet corn flavor up front w/a touch of hops & some trace of a bitter finish. You could do worse, & it was a good concert

Bottle; Picked up two cheap beers I could rate and get to rating 500 tonight! Only drank a couple of ounces; My brother in laws favorite beer; sponsored his drag boat for years; nose was grainy; gold with a decent white head; flavor of grain and sweet malt; even a tiny bit of hops.

this was what we drank in high school when wanted to drink a "good beer."  thank god i have grown up.  this is typical domestic swill wtih a little more body.  now that i see that it is a 4.7 abv beer, i now know that is why i threw up just about every time i drank it.
I must say that this is, if i had to pick one, my favorite macro.  Simply because it isn’t as revolting as all the rest.

I remember this as better, but this does better than its commerical contemporaries none-the-less.  Very light and more malt than hops.  Drinkable, but indistinguishable from others.  Yellow, pale and moderately refreshing.

Aroma: Watery, very thin malt and hops.
Appearance: Clear yellow.  When poured from a tap has a very frothy head that lingers incredibly well.  Not so much when poured from a bottle.
Flavor: Thin and bitter.
Palate: Moslty bitter and a little dry.  Just a hint of hops.
Overall:  Your average mass market beer.  Not much to speak of and yet I have had much worse.  Given its obvious availability it is consumed in great quanitities but it is not as thin as most light beers and slightly more bitter than the middle-of-the-road.
Blech.  Who added sugar water to this corny nightmare?  Love the commercials claiming this is grown-up beer.  Maybe for those who grew up drinking Meister Brau.  Wait a minute...

This bear gets less praise than it should, for its price and availability it isn’t a bad bear. Being an ex-beer hater I was swayed to think twice by this very beer. Its considered "cheap beer" and in so doesn’t compare to most middle to top end beers, but as for cheap beers I must say it reigns supreme. Granted you must only buy MGD in long neck glass bottles (or at times from tap)  and have it served cold to get the best out of it. All in all this beer for your money is a pretty decent choice and is the perfect summertime outing beer.

Plastic bottle at the Taste of Blue Ash in Cincinnati.  A step above Budweiser, maybe a bit darker.  A little bit fuller body.  You need this one REAL cold to make it good.  Cheap food - cheap beer - good times.

Its very light gold color and a very watery smell.  Very watery taste and a strange hop after taste that seemed like they crammed hops in the water they used.  Good beer when low on money and will be outside in the sun.
This was the beer of choice when I worked at UPS, why is this the most consumed style of beer?  and not only is this a poor style, they continue to do a poor job in this style

Not as bad as others that I have tasted, looked just like them (as you can see in the photo above).  It was very watered down with some weird hop taste and it didn’t leave much on the palate.  I think it’s funny that in the description they say they use the "finest hops and malt". HAHAHHA!
This is your standard "get drunk" beer.  It’s cheap and not that bad by comparison to competition.
Its light, nearly tasteless and wet.  I drank this extensively in college but now realize that was a mistake.  Not much of an aftertaste at least
Tastes a bit like mildly malted toilet water. If this is, indeed, "Genuine" draft, then I would hate to taste the artificial variety.
clear yellow with white head. little malty aroma. pleasant and easy drinkable but no excitement here.

Look, I’m no pro beer drinker, just a guy who loves a nice brew. MGD goes down smooth, but not too watery. It doesn’t have a ton of taste, but it does spare you of any nasty after-taste. MGD is a great beer for anybody not roaming the German countryside seeking out the greatest micro-brewed beers in the world. Pick up a case of MGD’s and you won’t be dissapointed.

This beer is better than your average macro, but it’s nothing to rant and rave about.  It does have a slight distinct taste to it, that separates it from the other big names, and a slight bite to it as well.  Better than average, but not something I’m hunting down at the store.

From a 24 oz. can poured into a large plastic cup at a Quincy Gems game, with a coded lot/freshness date on the side of can.

Poured a clear pale yellowish golden with a foamy white head that settled into a sudsy lacing.

Aromas of husky grain with a touch of corn and cereal, nothing I would call hops.

Good carbonation and a softly crisp, smooth very light bodied mouthfeel.

Thin and bland tasting, cereal and a light graininess, husky with cooked corn, a very buried, barely tastable lemon flavor, hops, what hops, and a dry sweet grainy finish with an unpleasant cooked corn taste lingering in the palate. The drinkability of this is pretty low.

O.k., it was humid and over one hundred degrees with the heat index, so pretty much any beer would do, but I would take a High Life or better yet, a Budweiser or even a Bud Lite over this. The Gems won, by the way, and moved into sole possession of third place.
Probably the best of the U.S. macrobrews. While I’d never go out of my way to buy this one at a pub, bar, or club, I certainly wouldn’t say no to one on a hot day.
Honestly not that bad, but not good either.  Drinkable and not completely disgusting, but still tastes like any other macro.
An average carona style kind of beer, not very exciting. I had to shove a lime in it.
(0.33L Bottle) Pours yellow with very little head. Cheap beer taste. Not much more to say.
12 oz bottle.Pours the usual clear light yellow with a whitish head.Not much smell and the taste is a little sweet with a tad of hops.Ice cold it is a good brew to cool of with.

Free can after the Orioles Advocates 5K run in Baltimore...  Clear yellow lager with a mid-sized, frothy, white head. Peppery, earthy nose with hints of green apple. Well-balanced flavor leans a hair on the sweet side, but is mostly nondescript. Light-bodied and creamy with fizzy carbonation. Crisp, clean finish. Hit the spot after the run! It was free and appropriate for the situation.
while slightly drinkable, still not worth the money. maybe the best beer from a macro i’ve tasted, but that doesn’t say a lot.

Draught. Clear golden color with nice bubbly white head that rivals most micros and left a decent lace on the glass. Flavor and aroma were similar; cheap beer. Not sure how else to describe it. Very weak hop and malt flavors typical of big brewers all over the world.

Hey, when I was in high school 35 years ago, this would have been premium stuff!  Smells like beer, looks like beer,  tastes like a decent budget brew.   It certainly doesn’t compete with a great majority of beers, but compared to Corona, Sol, and honest to God, even Heineken, this is pretty decent stuff.

Editorial:  If I want to treat myself to what I consider the best around, I will take a Two Hearted Ale from Kalamazoo in a heartbeat.  If I am looking for something a little different but high quality- give me a Gumball Head from Flloyds.  And if I am going for volume at a good price, I will take a Leinie’s Red.

I think this is a bit better than a skunked up Corona in a clear bottle that has been sitting out in the sun all day but not much.  I had to drink this at a party I had recently for some family that thinks this is the only beer in the world.  Pours with a slight head that quickly dissapears. Aroma is a light roasted corn (hops?  what is a hop?), taste is somewhat watery with a roasted corn accent.  No color short of a yellow-brown tinge.  Overall I think it would be better without the corn but then it wouldn’t be a domestic swill would it?

And what is the deal with this BS about these beers being like ’the smooth drinkability of draft beer available in bottles or cans’?  Pure marketing drivel (but it works on my father-in-law I guess)

Bardzo fajne piwo. Buteleczka mała ale poręczna. Butelkowane w Polsce ale mimo wszystko ok. Bardzo smakuje, bardzo ładny kolor i idealnie biała pianka - spróbujcie z innymi piwami. Generelnie bardzo mi smakuje. Ale i tak Tyskie jest the best.
If I was offered Miller or Bud, I would pick MGD, but there isn’t a good beer taste in this. No hops, very smooth. Mouthful taste like nothing.
Cheap grain scent and flavor. Has a metallic flavor as well. Generic microbrew with bad characteristics.
i rate this low, after loving this beer, i now cant stand it. its just got that taste that you hate. cant stand it anymore.
color is urine.  Taste has a little smoke in it.  This again is a beer that goes down good after you do some yard work.
I have a hard time drinking it, not that good, and for nearly $20 a case, Id rather go buy 2 cases of Lionshead pilsner instead of this.

I would rather get my dick up in Jacque’s gut than drink this swill ....................................................................
lol
Smells of urine and well accessed tap water. I’d rather drink the Beast than this dirt!

Had this in Scotland near the end of a two week trip and was feeling a little homesick so I decided to try ths crap the Inbev version was better than the american version but still macro swill after drinking this I was no longer homesick because I rememberd how crappy American macro swill is

I picked some of this up because it was cheap. I planned to use it for making beer battered fish and beer bread. I had one left over, and tasted it. I ended up pouring about half of the can down the sink.  The taste was downright awful, but the food I made from it turned out ok.
Yellow color- nice white head- bubble gum, bread, sweet nose- light taste that is somewhat rounded with sweet bread- minimal aftertaste
Pale, pale yellow.  Minimal head.  Beer in the nose.  Beerbread, thin, thin, character warming to yuck.
Tanggggyyyy bubbly light water ending in a super grainy fade to water again. I have a hard time even drinkin it drunk
MGD is a decent macrobeer.  It is better than bud that’s for sure, a nice golden color, a real smoothe taste, but there is a little more to be desired.
bottle. not bad if your allready drunk and can’t taste anyway. Tastes better when really cold. drinking beer.

bottle. brewed and botteled in the EU on license. Was rather cold when i had it.

This one is just an ordinary beer. It is a bit sweeter than what i usually get served, resembling some of the mexican beers out there. Head was very white, which sort of looked cool.

If you can handle the rather sweet tones to the taste, this one is okay. Probably best when hanging out somewhere in the sun - you would probably dring more than one in a session. I could buy this one again if i was plain beer-thirsty. for an ordinary chep beer it is quite okay.
Is to beer what Coldplay is to music. Better than some, yet not worth paying attention to. Avoid it.

Smooth golden garbage but can’t deny it does a body good on a hot summer day.Golden color grainy and slight corn side with enough hops to prove there there but not enough to really effect the taste in any way.Just a poor brew with little to offer other then to quench a dry pallate.

Not the worst macro I’ve ever had, but geez. No head, some color, and little flavor. Somewhat malty in flavor and ends with a slightly bitter after taste. Better than Miller Lite and High Life. That’s about it
12 oz. bottle.  Nothing special at all to say the least.  Genuinely typical, and nothign at all to call home about.
Gosh.  Pale yellow to golden in color.  No real head but a bunch of carbonation.  Lots of corn character.  Mineraly.  Best served ice cold.

16 oz plastic bottle-Aroma of corn and a small amount of hops. A nice white head that maintains its fullness.on a light golden yellow body.  Has a corn and mild hops palate with a little bitterness on the back end. One of the better macros but I am a Miller fan over the other 2.
Bottle. pours yellow with a white head. aroma of Corn, water, grain. Flavor is watered down, grain, corn, slight hoppy bitter flavor in finish. horrible brew.
bottle. very light yellow. no head. very mild and thin. not much point to drinking this stuff. if you just want to get drunk you can get much cheaper beer.

Nothing remarkable about this bland beer,mild flavor, mild hop presence, mild carb. Typical of beers people session drink just to get drunk. Leaves an odd aftertaste which cannot be blamed on any beer ingredient that I know of.
consistent, but i would rather drink soda then pull one of these out of a cooler.  At least you know what you are getting bottle after bottle.
this is a good summer beach party beer or cookout i will drink if nothing else is around but i will always have a cooler in my trunk with something special in it .

A less putrid version of the classic Miller High Life.  Looks the same smells the same, but doesn’t have quite the bite.  Still, do you want to pay yuengling prices for a special version of the High Life?
Another beer to avoid. This has a really bad aftertaste. Looks OK, Flavor is thin but bad. Just not very good. How many letters do you need to say bad?
Average American beer. It has a slightly sweet roasty flavor.   Ok on a hot summer day.  Aroma slight.  Appearance not inviting Flavor is acceptable for the price.
this beer tast bad whats wrong way can,t brewing companys in the usa make beer half as good tasting as they did in the 60,s 70,s even early 80,s
I had to rate this purley because it was the worst beer I’ve ever had.  Aroma was skunky, taste was worse.  Taste is presumably of rotten corn and dead hops.  How does anyone drink this?
I am just trying all the winners lately.  I can’t believe that I thought this was a decent beer at one time.  Thank you Piscator for enlighteneing me.

This has been my favorite American mega-lager for years.  It’s consistent (of course) and has much more flavor character than many other American lagers.  I buy it a lot in my wife’s hometown where PBR is considered a good beer!

(i had this on the plane on route to baltimore)
fizzy yellow body with a half inch head.smelled of corn and rice.flavor was much of the same with some malts.pretty nasty stuff.

Looks nice and golden in your glass but tastes pretty bad, way too lemony for me. I couldn’t even finish the bottle to be honest. No bitterness, very light body and with quite a lot of sweetness.  


For some resaon drunk again at a later occasion: Horrible horrible horrible! Almost threw up when the stench of old boiled corn and other fermented vegetables hit me in the face like a sledge hammer!. It’s poison. Don’t drink it! Ever!!

My friend bought a 24 pack, so I slapped him in the face, pushed him on the ground, then shot him in the head with my 45.
Light sweetness, crisp bubbly watery. I think I can taste the can itself. eeh.
a great beer on a hot summer day, but be aware it is no miller lite.  The taste is a bit stronger.

On tap at Chili’s on Whyte Ave in Edmonton. Served frosty, so no aroma. Pale yellow, sweet, and icy cold so I can’t give any detailed breakdown of underlying character-- but no worries, it’s MGD, so there IS no underlying character!

the last time i had MGD was when i was in high school (naughty me).  i remember it as being sweet back then.  now it doesnt seem as much so.  very little aroma.  golden color, but looks more like apple juice than pee thankfully.  very little head unless you invert the bottle 180 degrees and let it slosh out.  pretty (if not absent) clean flavor for a macro; bottled so no taste of metal.  mostly clear/watery palate w/ a little slime feel.  was on sale for about 55 cents a bottle.  even at that price im not sure i’d buy it again.

Draft at Comiskey Park.  This really is better than Miller Lite or Bud Light, but not by much.  It still needs to be extremely cold to taste good - once it warms, its awful.  Still, a beer and a brat at the ballpark is a mighty fine meal.

Very few people realize the changes in flavor that pasteurization causes.  MGD filtered in such a way that pasteurization is not necessary.  The flavor is undamaged  and the body is full.  If you believe that fresh beer flavor is best, then look no further than this.

It’s a shame that this site  is only a resource to self proclaimed "beer experts";  people who would rather drink beer made in small buckets at some quasi trendy brewpub, not realizing how many bacterial contaminants are changing the flavors of beer they’re drinking hour after hour.  If you want your beer to taste the same every time you drink it no matter where you get it, reach for MGD.  If you want to be surprised at how differently you beer tastes then the same beer you got 2 weeks ago, go to the lactobacillus/pediococcus farm you call a brewpub...
If I have to drink a commercial american beer, then I will take a budweiser...But maybe that’s because I am a Cardinal fan.

For you snobs who know what "bar swill" tastes like (good for you) you can continue drinking beers that cost $8.99 for a six-pack. As for me, when I come home from work I’ll drink an ice cold, smooth MGD any night. Not every beer has to be new or a micro-brew to be good. Don’t be afraid to crack open a beautiful yellow MGD.
Its a little better than the lite variant., but still crap. Waterish taste overall

Beer. Grown up. Yeah this is beer grown up alright - This beer grew up to be the loser mailroom assistant-supervisor working the swing shift at the textile factory that makes the spandex lining for leather chaps. What garbage. Has the aroma of paint thinner and bar swill.  the taste is not bad, on the scale of 1-10 it would land somewhere between Aquafina and DeSani. I gave it a 3 on appearance because I think the bottle looks cool - like original Budweiser bottles and the new Budweiser Select bottles, very chic. However their Eagle they use on thier logo gives a false sense of patriotism being associated with cheap fizzy alcohol - The US should ban the use of the noble bald eagle on crap like this - I would rather see our national mascot on a can of Silly String than on this bottle, I would as probably injest a can of silly string before I would drink this again.  SEACREST OUT.

Bottled. Draft? Fizzy, pale golden with a diminishing white head. Strange aroma that reminds me of corn and tinned mushrooms. The flavor is just bad and the finish the same. Corn and DMS and a hint of bitterness. (060408)
It’s OK, I guess, if kind of bland, but there’s always something else available that I’d rather drink. Hell, I’d drink PBR over this; it at least has more flavor.
pretty crappy but clearly better than the rolling rocks i was also forced to down last night
the beer has a nice look but when comes to taste its pretty much a dull beer there nothin really there to taste
An American mainstay. Watered down, faint grainy taste, no skunky scent, decent finish. For an American lager, not bad.
Smells Great.  Tastes Good.  If only the taste would actually last a little while!  Bubbly head, yellow (NOT GOLD, yellow) color.
not good at all pours golden yellow with a medium white head i dont know how american beer can get this bad

Wow! Beats the Miller High Life.  I thought that High Life was good but I was definitely wrong.  The South Africans are doin a good job.  It is hard to believe that this is one of the top 3 in the US!!!!  Miller is definitely better than the Coors or Bud products.
12 ounce bottle. A hair and a RCH at that better than a silver bullet or a Bud Light. Very clear and brite yellow not much other than the grainy flavor.
After trying a number of different beers, I have greater respect for MGD. This beer is consistantly ultra smooth, easy to drink and never skunky.

This smells like roasting vegetables... There is no head of which to speak, or lacing.  The flavor is also interesting, like carrots and corn.  The mouthfeel is thin and the finish reminds me of eating broccoli and burned asparagus.  This shows a terrible representation of malt and hop contingencies.  If their new campaign for this brew is "Beer Grown Up", then I’m adding it to the list of adults I don’t like.

Keg: Tastes like every other Miller product. I’ve been told that Millers brewerys are too small which makes all of their beers come out burnt tasting from their quick brewing process. Its hard to beleive that theres that much demand for this swill that they have to burn it.

Bottle and draft or can  This stuff is everywhere.  People tell me they like it because it has a more robust flavor.  I don’t want to think what lacks flavor to them.  Pours a clear gold with a white head.  Not much of an aroma and taste was very watery.  Typical american mass produced swill.  Good for the after work softball game.
Well, it’s better than Miller High Life, but then again anything is. Very little flavor in this typical American Macro-Brew.  Overly carbonated, with no malt or hope flavors to speak of.

355mL clear bottle.  Not skunked, but I’m not sure that’s a good thing.  Aroma of weak malt and bread.  Looks little different than it will in a couple hours.  Tastes like bread and adjuncts, leaves a horrible slimy taste and feel in your mouth.  No hops noticable.  I worked through half of the bottle before giving up.  Horrendous.  I’m not sure how people drink this swill.  That’s the end of my beer drinking tonight, I don’t want to insult any of the more deserving beers I have in my fridge.
Way overrated, not on here but from people I talk to.  If I bathed a sweaty dirty bum in water, carbonated and bottled it, it might compare to this.
Tastes watery and metalic, looks insipid. A triumph of marketing. Why the heck this gets imported here is beyond me... would rather have a coke.

Mild cereal aroma... and nothing else. Looks like urine. Mild  watery grainey flavor....and nothing else. A flat metallic aftertaste...and nothing else. Thin unappealing mouthfeel. Do not buy this beer even if there is....nothing else.
This is actuall the best beer that you can buy at a sporting event.  It is better than your Miller Lite, Coors, Bud Light.  Im not saying it is good.

I Like this mass Cheap beer. When stocking my beer fridge, I either buy MGD or Miller Lite.  This Is a Good Cheap Beer For the money.  I pefer Miller Prouducts when buy from the big 3.  I thinks its funny how everybody bags miller as not fairly decent beer.

Bottle. White lasting head. Clear golden body. Aroma, I think they have used malt. Sweet lemonade flavor appearing to containg carbon dioxide.  How they manage to make a lite version is a riddle to me.
a light yellow color with a very light malty taste and had some lacing. not very interesting

Almost no aroma, which is at least better than a bad aroma. Very light in both appearance and flavor. Virtually no head, and what there was disappeared almost immediately. Clear, yellow color. Slightly sweet, if at all. The only redeeming quality of this beer is its watery palate, which makes it a good choice after mowing the lawn.
Bottle. What can I say - boring boring boring. Not much flavor and mostly malt can be tasted.Small head that fades right away.

Gross, sick, disgusting!!!

Like afterbirth!  Upsetting to the eye & stomach!

Miller brewing is not our friend, people.  This beer sux, even worse than Miller Lite!  I would have given it a negative rating, if possible.  And why, oh why Lord, would anyone with half a brain, put beer in a clear bottle?

This stuff is so thick you have to scrape it out of the glass.  Avoid at all costs.  If I were to give this to a friend, I would expect a kick to the balls in return.

No sir, stick with a winner.  Stick with Blatz.  Even Lite is a step up from here.

So what do you do when you have band practice and the corner store only sells swill? You grab a random unrated macro and chuckle about the inevitable rating you will give it. I even wrote down notes for this one like it was a real beer! Pours a piss-like yellow with almost no head. Aroma is of um.......something beer like with corn. Flavor gets an extra point for being unnoticeable which is better than offensive. Overall I think I probably won’t drink this ever again.
I give it a decent score overall due to the price.  I’ve tasted a lot worse cheap (and some not cheaper) beers.
Its not great, but much better than Budweiser if you just want something cheap. For 50cents a bottle its not bad.

Yellow grainy watery.  This beer is an OK thing to consume if you are thirsty and have no better beer near you. If you find yourself in the one situation I decribe as being OK to consume this beer, I wonder why you have MGD on hand.

Drinking this reminds me of playing blackjack in the casino’s, where you can’t get a decent brew to save your life. The beer is like the game also, play it too long and your bound to lose. Drink this stuff too long and you will be sorry the next morning. Nothing redeemable about this swill, other than ice cold it’s drinkable.

Rating added 1/29/2006
Very light in color. Very low scent, a bit malty. The taste was not bad for the first two or three sips, then it just turned plain boring. Perhaps suitable when very warm outside and you need to clench your thirst.
3/2/3/2/5=1.5

Yes indeed, #299. 1 sip of this sampled from a friend. Taste had traces of farmhouse manuere (fresh!), pine-sol, tar-pits, and other disgustingness. Not a pleasant experience in any sense of the word.
miller, miller, miller... recherchez une autre compagnie de biere a boire! sans contredit, cette biere est quand meme la meilleure du groupe mais a eviter si possible en echange d’un verre de lait.
Sans contrefait aucun, je dirait qu’il s’agit de la meilleur broue du brasseur (Miller).  Sans corp en bouche, elle se boit comme une corona, c’est-à-dire, en appréciant le moins possible.
Bottlet. Golden colour, white head  . very little aroma and very little taste.There is not much else to say
Golden.White head. There is not much of anything in this. Some malt and some hops, but very little.
Very drinkable beer, nothing too special about this beer.  Would pick this beer over Bud and Coors, but it isn’t anything more than that.

From the bottle, poors out golden,little head. Smells lightly of hops and corn. Lazy carbonation, doesn’t really scream "drink me!". Heavy on the tongue and lips. Not the best I’ve ever had, but better than Bud. Really hits hard in the stomach too.
One of America’s fine corn beers.  I don’t like it, really corny, but better than bud
Pours a little darker gold than the other macrobrewed american lagers. Aroma of corn, light hops.  Flavor follows aroma. Thick, unpleasant mouthfeel.

Retasted in Gothenburg, bottled. really no difference, still a disappointment.

Bottle, at home (030718). Light pilsener colour, a sweetish beer with a light flavor of malt.
bottle. Poured a very light yellow colour with very little head. The little aroma that was there was of corn. Basically this is water with a small amount of beer flavouring added.
Poured pale yellow.  Smells like corn.  Nothing good here. Very bland. I am beginning wonder if Miller makes anything drinkable.  Gag
Another commercial American beer.  Way too carbonated for me.  I’d drink it again if it’s all I had.  Definitely wouldn’t buy.
Pours a golden yellow with white head that lasts.  Aroma of corn, grains and hops. Flavor is better than many other Miller products.
Pours a little darker than most american lagers.  Aromas of corn, hops, and you know the rest.  Flavor is a little more pronounced in this lager.  Just a bit more flavor than most.
not too bad....Id pick it over dudweiser. that crap is crap. only good fro pouring on girls

MGD had very little aroma except for some slight cereal grain.  The color is a light golden yellow with a small, rapidly diminishing, white head.  The flavor is of cereal grain and the carbonation is readily apparent.  Very light on the palate and no aftertaste.

Long overdue re-rate from a 24oz can.  Nose is sort of like cold turkey out of the fridge.  Ultra-pale yellow-golden that’s clear and otherwise trending toward brown, head is dense and rocky bright white.  Taste lightly sweet, no bitterness or tartness, lightly grainy with floral accents, touch of metallic impurity but not much.  Watery light body.  Really bad top-end grainy-yeasty combo is scandalously bad.  Relatively still with a light body, some mildly pleasant malt but not enough to make up for other aspects.  Smoothness, definitely.
light golden color with very watery taste.  Perhaps acceptable watching football... if you want to feel connected to the miller commercials you will be seeing insistently during the timeouts.

The only good sole purpose this beer has is when you’re warming up for a night of vodka. I usually down one of these before the first shot so I can have an empty bottle to throw up in. I could probably carbonate my piss and pass it as some of this shit.

Used to drink this in high school.  Pours dull and piss-yellow with an aroma of corn and sourness.  Flavor is sligthly tingly, with a dull hops presence rounded out by adjuncts of rice and stuff.  Ah, memories!

Again, Miller is never a good call. Somehow this rated better than Miller Lite, only because I kinda like the bottle style. But as far as taste goes, its like drinking Codliver Oil mixed with seltzer water. For those of you who know what drinking codliver oild tastes like I feel for you. Please folks, don’t waste your time unless you’re trying to get drunk for little money.
Aroma smells very much like miller lite, appearance is pretty evident,just like in the picture, flavor was was also like millier lite but better with less of a yeasty after taste, palate is watery.

not much to talk about here.  the look, smell, flavor all very watered down.  kind of a soapy taste.

softsoap

Bottle at releaseparty for Clawfinger’s new CD
Ha! I never thought I would rate this beer, but I was given one for free as part of the entrance (which also was free). It almost tasted something that might have been beer. Not too discusting, but very, very boooring.
Boring, crappy, dull, watery. Need I say more slighty better then Bud I think.
Pretty much just another macro pale lager.  Maybe a little better than bud but I’d only buy it if I were having a part and didn’t want to spend a lot of money.

My father in law keeps this in his house and I frequent his place often, so I drink it often, even though it’s not my favorite, I do like how I can smell and taste the bananna in this bmc brew.  It goes ok with wings, pizza, and some other stuff.
Not worth the bother.  Any commercial beer like this is, for the most part crap.  Drink a microbrew instead, much healthier for you.
Bottle. Pours a clear straw color with a small rock head that was gone instantly. Light grainy aroma. Light body with a thin texture. Small flavor with no finish. Cold wet with alcohol.

We used to buy kegs of this for our friends who didn’t appreciate good beer. (I would only drink it if nothing else was around - and then only in small quantities.) This year we got a keg of Payton’s Pilsner from America’s Brewpub and we’re going to stick with the PIls.  Even those who have not developed a taste for beer (except 1) agree the Pils is an order of magnitude better than MGD.

330ml bottle.  OK so I was coming back from London and the shop at London Bridge didn’t have anything else I hadn’t rated.  I admit it.  Gold colour with thin white head.  Thin buttery aroma with some citrus crispness.  Malts are fairly dead in moouth.  More butter on finish with dryness.  Funny, I used to think of this as quite pleasant before I discovered real beer.

It kinda makes you taste it in the morning. Never had to pay a lot for it though. Always on offers. looks better than water, and ice cold tastes better than water. ice cold, as it warms up you get this sorta sweet piss taste. However, it is one of the most easily drinkable beers out there.

I love Miller’s beers.  The reason I rate MGD so low is that every keg in college was filled with MGD.  I became so f’n sick of drinking it that I can’t even think about it now.  This is also probably the reason I prefer Bud Light to Miller Lite to this day.
Bottle. Nothing special. Average everyday pale lager. watered down malt flavor, slightly better than bud.
Yuck, i will always prefer bud to miller.  This beer stinks, and it tastes like s%$^. Thicker than bud, but damn, its like they dont even try to produce a quality brew.
Just another bad macro brew. Aroma smells like rotten eggs. Tastes even worse. I can’t believe I parted with $3.99 for this crap.
gave me a really bad hangover after 15 of them but other than that this beer really is not worth anything
nothing does a better job if your looking for beer farts. this beer is the shittiest of shitty beers. any miller fans out there? hey i thought high schoolers weren’t aloud here.

12 oz bottle.  This beer is disgusting.  It has almost no aroma, rapidly fading head.  Much like other American mega-brews, it’s yellowy, fizzy, and tastes a lot like water.  Mostly tasteless beers are at least not offensive, I guess, except they’re not worth parting with actual money.  But in this case it’s even worse due to a nasty sour finish.  I’d much rather drink water.
Not that great. I like Miller High Life more. Try it if you want, but don’t tell them I sent you.

This MGD was ’brewed under licence in the EU’. I don’t know to what extent it resembles the home-based version. Pale golden with a small white head. No perceptible aroma. No perceptible taste beyond a faint trace of woolly bitterness. (To be fair the final few drops, consumed after it had warmed up, did have a slight malty aroma.)
Pale yellow with big foamy head, Aroma is of sickly sweet corn and alcohol. Flavor is almost nonexistant, what you can taste is corn. No hops. Watery texture.
Bottle poured a clear yellow with a small white head. Aromaof sweet malt and corn. Palate is thin and watery. Flavor issweet hayand a flavorless finish. Another uninspired lawnmower beer.

Bottle. Absolutely gross. Like drinking yeast-and-turkey-flavored water. Aroma is fair, mostly of yeast. Pous a nice golden color with a mild head. Flavor is like drinking meat and yeast. Absolutely gross. I drank a bottle of this and felt like I was going to give it back to the bottle. A really gross beer.
Miller... well it smells like beer, tastes sweet. there are definitly better beers out there to drink even for the price.

I honestly hate Miller beers, this one just tasted like crap, I do have to say that Massey is right if I was drunk when I tried it i might of liked it, but when I’m drunk I can drink just about any alcohol.
I might like this beer better if I was already drunk when I drank this beer, but unfortuanatly I was sober.
i dont know if words can explain how horrible this beer is if i wasnt i beer lover i would probably flush it down the toliet but thats alcohol abuse
Just what you would expect from a mainstream American beer.  No body,very little taste resembling mostly grains.  I would drink it again in a baseball game in the middle of July.
Pours a very light gold straw color. Head is thin and dissipates quickly leaving little lacing. Taste is almost nonexistent and no bitterness. But, not the worst beer I’ve had.

I can’t believe I never got around to rating this fine american brew.  The Iceman and I grew up on this shit.  To all those underage I encourage you to not go for the light shit and man up to a sweet, sweet draft.  Cheers to draft and god bless america.
ewwwwwwwwwww i drank this on vacation andremebered why i didnt drink it any more. it tastes like peee pee

Well it was a beer.  Or sort of a beer.  Too lite for me.  This was a classic draft beer that the kids from college will like or the rednecks watching cars doing endless circles will love.  Light malt, hops, barley and too little time under a mash tun.  Heres to my dsay back in College.  Wooo Hooooooooo
3.79 a 12 pack

"Beware beer in clear bottles", this one should have a warning sign on its label reading ’Do not consume’. It’s beers like this one that make buying micro-brewed beers so much worth while. Pours a clear pale gold with a thin, quickly dissipating head of white foam. Looked like creaming soda in the glass. Tinny, wet dog and mineral-like nose with an odd hint of chaff. Seems you have to knock it back quickly with your fingers clenched firmly over your nose as the aroma follows straight through into the mouth. Soft in carbonation, slightly sour and slick as butter; cardboard malt, rice starch and maize, and lifeless stale hops all combat each other to see who could ’turn’ my stomach first. Finish had some crispness cold, but it soon got nasty as it began to warm, and it was honestly hard to finish by that time. To be drunk quickly, chilled and straight from the bottle. Best avoided! (355ml, BBE 09/05)

Couleur blonde pale, pleinement translucide.  Faible mousse blanche rapidement diminuante.  Arômes végétaux, maïs, choux sur une trace de jeunes céréales.  Sucrée en bouche, très peu de goût mis à part l’énorme présence végétale…encore une fois.  Étalement ridiculement court, finale sèche et poudreuse rappelant les aspirines.  Corps d’épaisseur ultra-mince, carbonatation piquante.  Ridicule!

Bottle. Pours a clear pissy straw color with lots of bubbles that manage to form no head at all. Aroma of rotting plants, compost, and light skunk. Oh ye gods, the flavor is horrible: more compost, paper, and gross headache-inducing resins. It was all I could do to drink enough to rate it. No redeeming qualities at all. Down the drain with it.

Average beer all around. MGD has a slighty sweeter finish than other miller beers. Again, light in alcohol content so its easy to pound back a case of these in a sitting.(Also goes great with a bag of Spitz on a hot summer day!)

16 oz widemouth bottle - Consumed from the bottle at the Blue Jacket PSL Party - Golden with a short white head.  Aroma is grain and a touch of corn.  Flavor about the same.  More robust than many of the other macros but not robust enough to make me want to drink it again anytime soon.  Still though in the hot sun it got the job done as a thirst quencher.
Slightly worse than it’s Miller lite companion.  But hey it’s cheap and it’s beer...
Very bad beer. No body, skunky smell. Metallic taste of old water that has been in a rusty barrel. Avoid.
As long as it is cold it is o.k., otherwise I think it allways tastes skunked.

Okay, I gotta bump this one up a couple points because this time I had it in a can. This helped the brew actually, it was less offensive with no skunked quality. Basically just some light corny sweetness and some paper.
My father’s beer forever.  The first beer I had in fact.  At the time I thought it wonderful, but now all I notice is corn, water, a touch of DMS and other crap.
This is just another mass market chug beer that someone gets when they  really dont  cares about what they drink.

I love MGD.  I think it is the best of the American mass-market-pale lagers.  It has a great color, more golden than yellow.  And it always goes down smooth.  There isn’t much to it as far as spices and flavors other than the usual beer taste.  But if I have a choice of true American beers, I always reach for MGD.

I like Miller beers, except Miller light. They are minimally hoppy by nature, which makes them a good break from Bud, which is haoppy, but low on grain taste. MGD has a solid corn smell and taste and very bubbly. Poors a weak head with no lacing. Decent, hearty palate for a macro, less watery than Bud. The citrus hops come out in the aftertaste. Not great, but fine for a bucket.

No head, goes off in a few seconds; unpleasant smell - not a good first impression. The taste was rather bland, some corn flavour can be felt. Very light, watery, not that awful as some say - drinkable if you can ignore the look and smell. (tried from bottle bought in Poland, brewed in Italy)

Another day on the golf course another day of limited beer selection from the beer cart.  It has a little more flavor than the typical light beer, but more doesn’t always equal better.  All my humorous reviews were already used by others so I’m left with this unfunny pointless review.
(bottle) Clear golden body with a big collapsing frothy white head. Skunky aroma and unpleasant taste. Industrial crap.

Bottle (355ml, clear)  Ah, I have fond memories of when this first came out in the late ’80s - I would buy it at the Publix in Lakeland FLA and have it in my motel room at night after a day watching spring training baseball games.  What an idiot I was.  Poured like ginger ale, only not as much "head".  What aroma there was was like public swimming pool water after the first graders’ class, with a bit of sour corn and some nasty icing sugar.  Tasted like wet cardboard, only worse.  Sour grainy-corny aftertaste just keeps building.  Time to pour it off ....  It’s true, you can’t go home (back) again.  Thank god.
i dont know what cold filtered is but apparently it didnt help it taste any better it probly made it worse.
mmmmmmmmmmmmm cold filtered bottled draft beer???? this one is a waste of time.
Sweet maize aroma and flavour. Piss-coloured and piss-poor. Disgusting swill.

Of the major labels, this is probably the most drinkable beer. It has nothing on the worse microbrew, but it spanks Bud and Coors. On a side note, everytime I go into the supermarket, I can’t believe that the major labels (Bud, Miller, & Coors) sell their beers for the same price as microbrews. It’s not the beer that you’re paying for, IT’S THE ADVERTISING!!! Anyway, if you’ve got to drink a major label, this would be it!
This is the "best" of the Miller Products?  Maybe, but I really don’t like it.  MDG sucks.  Always will.  More "taste" than Miller Lite.  Is that a good thing?

Draft: Pale yellow with a half inch head.  Aroma is pretty faint but what’s there is mostly grain and bready yeast.  Very thin and light bodied with faint flavors of yeast, alcohol and sweet corn.  No real finish to speak of, or maybe I had just lost interest by then.  I used to think this was a very good beer; it’s amazing how trying a few craft beers can change your whole perception.  It’s not a bad beer, it just seems very weak compared to what else is out there.

DRAFT:  Hadn’t had one of these since college.  Beer distributer screwed up my Sam Adams keg order and this was the only non-light beer they had in stock.  Can’t have an empty kegerator so I took 1/4 keg to hold me over until my Sam comes in. 
Not much of an inspiring aroma on this although it poured nicely from tap with a nice 3/4 inch head which lasted throughout.  Flaovor was a little lighter than I rememebered. Tastes like Bud light.  Won’t buy this again.  WIll have to invite some neighbors over to get rid of the rest until I can get some REAL beer in there.

How is this a "draft" beer when it isn’t widely available anywhere on tap? Not something I’ll turn down if it is offerred to me, but not something I’ll ever buy. Not quite Skunk City, USA, but it’s in the same county, I bet.

I’ve had this plenty of times before. Surprised I haven’t rated it. Some of my friends wax poetic on this crap. Pale, pale gold. Sickly pale. Medium sized foamy white head which stuck around for a while. Sniffed it for a good ten minutes before I dared to take a sip. Sweet grain and corn aroma with notes of cardboard and glue. Fizzy flavourless nonsnense. Mouthfeel is particularily poor. Minute traces of hop in the gag inducing finish. Infinitely better with cigarettes. Good god.

Draft at Giordano’s.  Golden pour with some white head on there.  I’ll add a point for some lacing, even though it wasn’t pretty.  Quite an awful and skunky aroma, especially as it warmed.  Corn and urine provided most of the flavor, and it was really hard to swallow.  I avoided the aftertaste by consuming copious amounts of fantastic pizza.

I never poured it -- just drank from bottle.  Carbonated, light, and capable of being guzzled.  Tastes like most macrobrews with all corn and water.  Somehow though I find this one easier to drink than the typical varieties.  Alcohol content is good for a macro.  Nice buzz if you drink ’em fast.
the first time i had it was 1 to many... nothing else to say about this beer other than its worse than the light variety as it seems to contain more urine of dog

Same pale colour as Bud. Rank sulpherous smell. Didn’t think there was a beer as worst than bud, but there is.
Rank.
i call this sugar beer. All i taste when i drink it is sugars. needless to say i only drink in extreme circumstances.
A mass produced watery lager. Insert: blah blah blah.. is that 75 characters?
Pale yellow color. Skunky flavor. Very artificially. Pure drain. Drink something else
College Bar swill.  There are hundreds of  better choices for folks.  Available everywhere.  Skunky taste that actually makes my stomach sour a bit.  I recommend looking else where.
grainy aroma. pale yellow color, white head.  mild, grainy flavor.  similar (and equally forgettable) to most american macro-brews.  i drink this at corner bars that have nothing more to offer.

Terible. Yellow and almost flat,  skunky taste, barn yard grains, metalic undertone, corn, water water water. Why do people want a flavour less beer, just smoke crack is all you wana get is "Fo Uped!"
Why do they call this a pale lager, I get that the taste is pale and very bland but come on, this sucked, how do people drink this garbage.

Yellow with mostly diminishing white head.  Tiny bubbles and very thin mouthfeel.  At proper temperature (ice cold) in proper glassware (bottle) aroma is restrained.  Upon warming, mild aromas of cooked vegetables and cereal malt.  Metallic flavors taste more like metal than hops.  I taste adjuncts over malt, hops, or yeast.  I made the mistake of eating some Brie right before drinking this beer.  It was woefully unable to overpower the taste.  Engineered to be tasteless, the taste is hard to qualify.  Often consumed during local games of beer pong, if that’s any measure of it’s quality.
Pale and fizzy with a slight skunk and big corn flavor. Slightly better than Bud, but that isn’t saying much.
MGD is a typical american pale lager. It tastes and smells like metal, unless it’s tongue numbing cold, then it olny smells like aluminum

The USA’s great microbrew revolution has bypassed Australia. Walk into the average Aussie beer outlet and you’ll find two brands (three if you’re lucky): Budweiser and this. (If it’s one of the better bottle shops, you might find Sam Adams Boston Lager.) I mention this because it’s marginally more interesting than the beer. Miller Genuine Draft (why "genuine"? Do they really think someone might copy this?) poured pale gold with a skinny head that retreated faster than a French army. Sugary aroma with some corn, metallic hops and a whiff of sickbag. Desperately thin bodied - this makes some of the Aussie macro lagers seem like heavyweights. If you could give a minus mark for the ’palate’, I would. Horribly sweet, like corn dipped in honey. No hop presence at all. This is so awful it almost makes me feel better about the standard of Aussie macro lagers. I said almost.
clear yellow.  foamy rocky head.   i’d comment the aroma but i dont want to smell it.  goes down easy.  better than most american macros.
(botle) Blind tasted against Bud.  What a competition.  Poured a depper yellow, but little natural carbonation and no flavor.  At least it was smooth.

well there are worse beers out there.  i don’t understand how all these people get tricked into drinking not good beer like this.  i guess cause its cheap well anyway, it watery and taste isn’t that great..

Always in the clear bottle leaves plenty of room for skunk.  I usually pass this up when it is in the camping cooler.  Two minutes in the sun and this beer turns to skunk butt.  Very weak beer smell.  Hint of skunk.  Tastes like funk’n skunk.
bad bad....  I have never had the chance to drink this from tap.  If given the chance, I would pass it up as I would anything this is made popular with a clear bottle.
355ml clear bottle. Pale straw colour, held a small soapy white head. Sweet aroma. Corny sweetness, a little dash of honey.
MGD ice cold in a plastic bottle at the ball game.  What great Corny sweetness.  One mistake I did not make was to lett this one get warm.
Im not sure what to say, its like watery with sugar thats too carbonated to drink fast. I mean u cant even force it down yourself to get u drunk asap. Too sickly sweet after a while aswell.
A little watery for my tastes...It’s a slightly refreshing beer...but, just slightly flavorless.

What can you say. Nothing really offensive, but nothing much great to say either. Aroma was typical icky pale lager. Appearance was a nice yellow. Flavor was better than I expected. Watery finish but a slight bitter aftertaste redeemed it. The ironic thing is that they would be horrified to learn of that! Palate/feel was also better than expected. Overall, not terrible.
One of those beers that’s bad, but a staple at backyard bar-be-ques.  After a few PBRs, you can drink anything, even this.

Yellower than other macros.  I have to say that this beer lacks some of the stale skunky odiousness of other macros.  It is very carbonated and thin palate, but it doesn’t taste as bad as others of its ilk.
oh god, what can i say another crappy macro-brewed beer, although it is drinkable doesnt live up to its commercials.

Can. Stale cardboard, bread. Pale, pale yellow with lots of carbonation, a thin head that dissipates very quickly and leaves no lacing. Very little taste, except for some skunkiness in the finish. I can see why this is the beer of choice at frat parties. You can drink a lot of this stuff and not feel a thing.
A mediocre lager. It reminds me... water. Good to go with spicy food. And even in that case... well, let me just say that i hated the experience.

What better scenario to enjoy an MGD than while Cosmic bowling at Hickory Hills Lanes (emphasis on the "hick"). Between cigarettes, the very pregnant bartender handed me an ice cold bottle of medium yellow lager, enhanced by swirling disco lights and the wicked riffs  of Journey on the PA. Without a glass, I could only smell faint whiffs of corn and a sweaty sourness through the long-neck. Seemed to be more full-bodied than LIte, although I couldn’t concentrate that well, entranced by Nascar on twin 13" monitors above the bar. When all was said and done, this brewski was a fine compliment to the beef, chicken and meatball buffet.   


Available everywhere, fully appreciated at Hickory Hills Bowling Alley, Hickory Hills, IL
a low budget kind of lager...one that doesnt particularly please although it is drinkable.  the pale lagers just dont cut it for me.

Of the Miller family I would have to say this is my favorite, but I have to be very low on cash and it has to be ICE COLD.  For some reason this is the only way I can drink it.  Gold colour, white head, some flavor.  Not much else to say.

From a bottle, no glass! Gold/straw in colour, some lacework as the level dropped, cheap cereal dominates the palate...hops??? no! I dont think so. If this is "innovative American brewing" it must be struggling. An unpleasant experience.
tastes like average swill beer. Has taste unlike another marco-brewery located in Missouri....eh heeeem.  Budweiser.

miller golden shower,shampoo flavour,
my wife uses this beer if left over by guests
as hair conditioner,wash hair,rinse,
add miller beer,wait 3 minutes,rinse,soft hair,just dont drink it.
Builds onto where Budweiser comes up short.  Has a richer flavor than most macrobrewed American pale lagers.
This stuff tastes completely disgusting.  I don’t know how they can get away with calling it beer.  Tastes like grass.

24 oz can poured into a Chimay chalice. Yea, that is going to cost me karma points. Nose smells like burnt plastic. Straw with a foamy head. Taste is very, very stale. Very cardboardish with hints of adjuncts. Enjoyable in a masocistic kind of way. If I had to drink swill, I would probably choose this. That had being said, I hate Miller.
Man havn’t had one of these in years. This beer always gave me a headace and guess what had a Draft for dinner no headace but no aroma and watery taste. Not good to me, but somepeople love this stuff

esther: serions nous trompez de flacon et prit un produit sous l evier...remarque ca aurai pu etre dans le cabinet de pharmacie...
produit nettoyant, spray a cheveux, ou salve anti croute au pied.. tel reste la question...
A ne pas racheter sous aucun pretexte...

Juju c degeu c pas bon bref c gerbi ca pas le gout de biere, plutot de produit a retirer les furoncles... le gout est excecrables...pire il reste longtemps dans la bouche (paradoxe son seul atout)

9.99 pour pack de 12
A weak watery taste hidden beneath a faintly found aroma. Really does anyone expect a beer such as this to rate well.
Not sure how I would compare this to the other domestics.  I guess I will have to look at the numbers to see which I really like best.  Honestly, I don’t know.
this is alright if you compare it with the normal domestics but really is not that great of a beer.... good to eat with and ok on dollar draft night
looks decidedly unwell, smells a bit grassy and lemony but you have to struggle to get this, weak and boring and bad. how many times has everyone done the same review?
rich golden color.  Somewhat malty like stale bread.  Weak body and little head.

pale gold, medium, fizzy white head.  Pretty watery.  A substantial improvement over some of the other macro-brewed stuff I’ve had in terms of aroma, and flavor; but that’s not really saying a whole lot.
My personal favourite from the mass produced American giants.  It is a very smooth beer, but is in no way deserves the love that it gets in commercials.
a decent beer from the miller family not as good as miller lite but still not as bad as a bud. nothing to special

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Neat golden colour, decent head - and that’s about it. Soft and sweet in a sticky way - too much corn in the brew. No hops. In Denmarkk this is a beer for the café-segment of beerdrinkers - those who don’t really like beer. Even a plain Carlsberg Pilsener is better
I can’t believe I never rated this. Clear yellow, fizzy and thin. Not incredibly foul, not pleasant. Lots of cereal grains, clean finish. Light sweetness. It’s crap.
i wouldn’t drink this in a party, unless people try to be friendly and offer it to me.  i always appreciate such gesture, but i’d rather they don’t though.
Although pretty bad, ill drink this over most other mass produced crap. Very bland.
Another crap product out of wisconsin. Is it possible that milwaukee buys the recipes of the worst tasting beers just so noone else could claim themselves as the worst?

Wow you people really hate this beer. I kinda like it. No doubt it is a mass produced beer with an average faint aoma. The flavour is watery and fresh with a hint of melon. I like its appearance  - it looks like a great thirst fighter and it is. A simple beer for fish and chicken dishes also drinkable alone.

i’ll drink it if its free, but dont expect me to buy it unless there is nothing better available.  better than the Lite version but that’s not saying much. taste isnt offensive and its pretty smooth mabye from that fancy "cold filtering" bah
Ever tear into a 12 pack of these?  Well, you should just to get drunk as hell off this one.  After you pound 10 or 11 into ya, maybe you will pick a better beer next time you cheap bastard.
I can drink this beer because it is beer.  It however does not have flavor.  Ok maybe a little.

Very clear amber gold, looks like a million other beers. Sweet nose with a manufacturered feel. Syrupy. Palate shows reasonable balance; plenty of fizz but offset with more syrup like sweetness (corn?).  Easy to be critical of the label but showed up ok this time around.
Really watery, which isn’t so surprising considering the clear straw color. Pretty standard entry in area of the major domestic lagers. Usually tastes kinda skunked.

They charge way too much for this little better then High Life in Canuck Country. We have enough of our own shitty beer in Canada, why do they have to import the stuff? Goes down like water, tastes like the same, comes out like water. I knew free trade was a bad idea.

I don’t like the straw color of this beer, reminds me too much of some of the other, less flavorful cheapies like bud and coors.  I get this stuff fresh since I live right next to the brewery, so I’ve never had any problems with skunkiness.

had about twenty of these over the weekend, at FBR open, so for shits and giggles gotta rate the swill.  had this almost every other with the lite and the mgd is slighty better. at the tent they had troughs of these in ice water...they only way one can palate this type of beer. easy to drink and not too offensive, can drink lots before intoxication sets in...nice adjunct combo.
Took me a while to realize I hadnt added this one yet.  Cheap, tastes good, standard easy drinking beer.  Good for my money.
another party staple, this brew is what I pick when the only other choice is Bud.
In terms of all beer, this stuff is next to awful.  But if you’ve only got a couple of bucks on a hot day and you walk into the 7-11, choose a 24oz of this over a Bud or Coors and you can’t go wrong.

I give the flavor a 5 because I love corn, It’s one of my favorite veggies. Wait, you mean...this is beer? Man, you got me. I’m actually drinking one right now. After drinking good beer all morning, it’s going down like water.
Light skunks beer.  So you put this one in a clear glass bottle.  I don’t understand.  This stuff is just plain bad.
Never really enjoyed Miller in general.  MGD is no exception, probably the worst of the bunch.

24oz can. this brings back memories, good ones at that. of high school and hanging with friends on a saturday night and grilling som steaks and thinking that this was the best beer ever. unfortunately i no longer feel that way. unlike most macros with mgd i can actually taste the presence of hops, too bad it isn’t a good taste. there is a sourness to this there is a noticeable adjunct taste but it isn’t that bad when you consider how bad some of the others out there are. plus it was  $1.09 for a 24 oz. but it is an awful water yellow with a bad aroma that isn’t skunked but  is just corny. it washed down the burritos i had nicely so it’s got that going for it. i find myself enjoying this , and i’m o.k with that.
This has cold filtered out any taste. Its not horribly offense and it is better than Bud. Served ice cold its tolerable with wings. Yellow pissy water basically.

Bottled. Golden colour, not much of a head. Aroma and taste mainly of corn. Smooth and soft taste. Easy to drink. Though many people seem to dislike it, I enjoyed. (Was rated in December 2004, but I temporarily had lost the papers with results from this particular weekend)
all I have to say is yuck. I had this beer on the weekend and could barely finish it. Out of the big three, this is the best, but not by much. A beer to pour down the sink.
I used to really like this stuff when I was about 20 years old. Eighteen years later... what was I thinking! Aroma of corn, color of corn, taste of corn. Overall impression- corn.

This is about the only American macro lager I will allow past my lips once in awhile. Like most American macros, it has that aroma of corn, and a somewhat metallic taste to it. But once in awhile, it is a nice, refreshing beer.

If I had to pick between this, bud, and coors.... I would have to chose this.  It tastes ok... at times.  Other times it doesnt taste so great.  What can I say... I am just not a fan of the big three.
Had it for the first time a little while ago but didn’t expect much so i wasn’t disappointed. It tasted kinda sickly sweet with an odd burnt taste to it. I could barely finish the bottle.

I’ve nothing new or original to say about this stuff. It’s very refreshing, clean, crisp, etc.
I consider MGD to be the High Life uprgade. The LS model if you will.
I love High Life, but when I drink this, the difference between the cheap and premium beers is clearly evident. 
Very good.
I know it’s not popular to like this beer, some kind of tall poppy syndrome or something i guess...however i really enjoy drinking the occassional MGD, crisp, clean and fresh, very easy to drink.

Aroma is virtually nonexistent.  Appearance is that of watered down urine.  Drinkable if only due to its almost complete lack of taste.  Palate has all the complexity of a Linkin Park track.  Bottom line: a good cheap buzz.

bottle from local bodega. smells of corn , rice  very little hops but i could be wrong. pale apple juice color, flavor isnt that bad just not much of it. they aint lying it is smooth and drinkable just not good.
The sort of beer you struggle to find much to say about...its crisp and refreshing, its perfectly tolerable, but I can’t think of anything interesting about it.

To be honest I can’t taste much difference between this beer and High Life. I think this one is more crisp and has a slightly dryer finish. Use this beer the same way you should use other Miller products. Cook with them or give them out at parties once everyone is already so drunk they can’t taste anymore and save the good stuff for yourself.

Had this beer many times while growing up. I have not bothered to have one for several years now. Sampled from a 12 oz can this beer poured a straw yellow color with a large fluffy head that lingers. The head is rather pretty really with lots of lacing. The aroma is light and sweet with strong notes of corn, a hint of hops and a vague spicy undertone. The flavor is corn, light malty and bit sour and has a very light hop presence. There is a slight tang on the finish. This brew is surprisingly inoffensive and drinkable but certainly does nothing noteworthy. But if your only choices are among macro you could do worse than this beer.
The bolder big brother of Miller Lite.  More color, and a richer & fuller taste.  It’s not one I’d regularly choose, but I have respect for Miller from what they do for the city on a local level.
Same christmas party, more miller products, get it. This was better then the LITE, but not much.
Better than Budweiser, but it’s still cheap beer.  Lack of flavor, lack of hops, very watery.
Bottle at the Hard Rock Cafe, Birmingham. Dinner with me Dad and we weren’t here for the beer!  Rubbish corn fuzz taste. Soft, rank, some water. Hopeless.
I’ll drink it if there is nothing else or iof someone else is buying,  Crisp and easy to drink but wouldn’t say it’s good.
Not bad for a cheap beer, has a slightly biter aftertaste that almost shows some complexity.  Better than a bud, but between you and me, Pabst is more bang for your buck.
Clear bottle, but not skunky, has the old Miller taste, a bit of a tinny aftertaste, not as bad as I expected.

Had it for free while playing craps at the Grand Casino.  Straight from the bottle and quite cold.  It was easy to drink but tasted like most macros, maybe a little better.  It did have a little sweetness to it that wasn’t bad.  I wish they’d serve some better brews there.

I remember drinking this 15 or so years ago and thinking it was pretty good. Well, I guess compared to some other macros it’s decent but there really isn’t anything there. Very little flavor or body.
If you drink it cold, at least it is a good thirst quencher.
Tap.  Served several degrees cooler than freezing courtesy of Applebee’s.  There were chunks of ice floating in the glass.    Unremarkable in every way.

March, 2003: I go all the way to Russia and end up having to drink this in a Russian bar because they have nothing else! There is little of interest here. Actually, to be honest, the bar was in the ballet theatre where we went to watch a production of Swan Lake!
I really tried to like this one but couldn’t. It smells like urine and is skunky as they come. Will drink if given for free.
Yellow color clearly. Extinguished, little fizzy. Too much sweet. Fine foam and fading.

Pour is as expected...smell has a little more hops than I’d thought...which, considering I expected this to smell like leather, that isn’t really saying a lot...tasted much more grainy than regular Miller Lite...flavor nothing more than cold and corn...blech...

Very pale yellow colour. Bubbly head. Weak, corny aroma. First impression is nothingness. This tastes like water, with a slight hoppiness and tartness in the finish. These were 1.90 euro and 5 minutes of my life I won´t be getting back.
If you are going to spend more than Busch and less than Heineken, get your damn hand off the Bud and on to this.

Aroma is weak and slightly stale. Has an ok look to it - rather thick head and lots of bubbles. Good carbonation but, ultimately, that cheap, cardboard American "get drunk" kegger taste dominates. This is calming connoisseur material to many a redneck, so what it lacks in taste is sort of made up for in social value. Plus, sad to admit, swill like MGD is the kind of thing that goes down easy "beer after [plastic cup of] beer" - part of Miller’s ad campaign in the past.
better beer then the other big breweries put out. I prefer the highlife for taste and price.
drank this nasty beer in the past too at first thought it was good stuff and gave a good buss back then

I’m not allowed to say that this stuff sucks because I’d be stepping on the toes of a few people around here...but this stuff sucks. Just cant get into it. I’ll take an Original coors over one of these.
Yiacks!, It tastes like a tire, a bad taste tire, I must say, It was horrible to drink 6 cans of this once.
A watery macro swill, However, I will drink this before alot of BMC stuff. Not a good beer, but It does well at barbeques, most will drink it.
:s It tastes like Icebear piss.. and the aroma isnt good either... This beer is only for alchoholics..
This was one of the first beers I have ever had.  I have grown to the age where I can handle it but don’t want to.  Definately not a Budweiser or Coors.
Can on the flight to Detroit.  Easy on the chemicals, some real malt, kind of refreshing, and of course, forgettable.

Hmph *with surprised intonation*!  That beer ain’t so bad!  I definitely like it better than Budweiser, because it has a definitely wheaty taste.  Almost like a piece of sandwich bread.  The carbonation gives a little twang to the palate, but for this price...who cares?  Not half bad for a watered down domestic.
A macro swill that costs way too much considering what it delivers, a very watery macro beer that I’ll only drink if its the only beer around.

This beer is my #1 choice for events where I don’t know what anybody is going to like.

This is a beer that everybody can drink without being offended in any way.  It is definitely better than fake-ass "high quality" beers like Anheuser World Select.  A very good but not excellent generic beer, that almost anybody can drink and enjoy.  Pick this up for your next barbecue/party and any beer drinker will be sufficiently appeased.

I should make it clear that I did not purchase this beer, so I am relieved of all guilt associated with drinking it.  I am witness to its watery, unbalanced, tangy/acidic body.  I am witness to the corn flavors.  I am witness to the almost complete absence of hops.  I am witness, shall I be punished?
Easy dringing beer. Light in taste and alcohol. Yellow colour probably, little fizz. Makes you run to the urinal often.

I think this is perfectly acceptable if you just want to drink a ’beer’.  No observation or contemplation, just slam them back.  Can be drank during all seasons too, so it has some versatility.  Another commercial beer universally panned, but I will give it a vote of confidence.

Poured from a 16oz. can into a pint glass ... I almost put it in a snifter just to be ironic. ANYway, the beer pours a clear yellow with a thick, fizzy head. Aroma is faintly metallic (can, maybe?) and malty. Sweet corn and malt in the taste. Not as watery as I had expected. It could have been a lot worse. Might do in a pinch.
Light gold color.  Kind of a musty aroma.  Not much taste, but perhaps a little corn.  A tad on the sweet side.  Swill could be a lot worse than this.
A pale yellow colour, slightly yeasty aroma. Slightly sweet amd malty taste. Watery. Poor.
I actually don’t mind MGD when i need a real cheap beer fix, its fairly criap and refreshing and sometimes hits the spot rather well.  Better malty body than Bud or CL.

(on bottle) I can tell this is the hate-beer no. 1, but I diden´t grow up on it and to me it´s an ok macro-thing. Smells like sour  tap-beer on a bar a slow night. Kind of soft in the mouth and , mainly, not as gassy as my hate-beer: tuborg.
crap. wtf is this beer good for, i’ll going to pour some down the sink right now and see if it will taste better when the bottle is empty. okay one good thing is the is dirt cheap
My personal swill. Best on draft (imagine), and good for a football game. Naturally there are better brews out there, but can’t go wrong with this one.
This is what I would refer to as a typical southside (Chicago) sports bar beer.  There’s little of any real flavor, and it only tastes good if you’ve already had too much to drink.
Average all around. Drink when it is practically freezing for best results.  Urine color, not much head. Hints of corn. For some reason, girls like this stuff.
Cold and in the bottle it is ok for a summer beer.  No head when poured.  Ballpark beer.
better than bud, but leaves much to be desired in its body and head. Make sure its cold at least though.
very yellow with white head. Goes down very easily with little after taste. Almost watery but Better than bud. I would buy as a casual outing beer.

Pale yellow body without anything that looks like brew. Aroma is a mix of corn, CO2 and skunk. Flavors are almost absent, but I give a bonus point for the taste only because it is not as horrible as some other stuff I’ve been trying during the last days. To buy only if there is no more carbonated water at the grocery store...

Das ist aber Kornwasser! Tested my dad’s MGD alongside a Pilsner Urquell as he barbecued some corn, and lemme tell ya, this stuff smelled more like corn than the goddamn corn! That, and Double Bubble brand gum. Extremely flat, I guess that’s the "draft" part coming through? This is genuine crap. Proof that beer is a "depressant," because it’s straight-up sad.
Bottle. Not much to say. It has the generic beer look and taste. No real aroma, just an easy drinking beer. I almost feel guilty rating this one.
Pale gold. Almost no aroma.  Slightly metalic initial taste.  Nice mouth feel, goes down smooth. Slightly sweet aftertaste.
For a Pale Lager it is usually the default I will drink when I am out in a bar.  But still...
This is a corny, adjuncty mess. It’s somewhat drinkable while ice cold, but generally speaking this is one to avoid, even when free.

Draught.  A little better than the high life version.  Has less noticeable corn malt 
flavor.  Head is still fizzy and aroma is still thin.

keg stand...ok, is there a good beer to do a kegstand with??  actually, not to brag but i did this one unassisted(no spotters) and drunk(off good beer).  at least it was cold but what ultimately made me come down was the fact that it tasted so horrible.
Very pale straw colour, no head. Adjuncty sugary aroma, taste of water with some sugar added. Neutral and clean.
Light taste,Bit sweet but but not bodied very light.Good for mass production type beers.

Had this icey cold at a BBQ. It was cold,wet and free. It didn’t suck as much as I remember but when I got pre occupied and drained the last 1/4 cup which was warmish it was pretty nasty and made me wish I had a tongue scraper.
Not too much to taste when it comes to this stuff. Doesn’t seen to have much of a scent either. Carbonation is pretty good though.

A good beer. not bad, but not perfect.
Good for friend reunions. But i will say that Miller high Life its better than this.
Pick this one if they dont have High Life
Good for get-togethers, average American mass-produced beer, not bad though
A decent beer at parties and picnics.  Definately not a choice beer, but in some establishments this is the best they got so I go for it.
The best I can say is that it is better than Bud.  But that’s like saying a Kia is better than a Yugo.
Golden color, light weak aroma, watery taste, light body, light watery finish.

A little bit better than most American Lagers, but I still think it tastes bad.  Maybe it is this watered down nasty beer taste of mass brewed American beers or I just don’t have a thing for blonde lagers.
Bizarre sweet taste - like artificial banana flavour. Almost as sweet as Belgian beer - except this is foul, whereas Belgian beers are great. Thoroughly disgusting.
This beer is repulsive at best.  it serves absolutely no purpose in this world, and it’s lite version is even worse.
Quite sour. Unpleasant flavor.  Like expected a really bad beer.
Another really bad beer, way too plain, I don’t understand the commercials I hear about being very tasty haha.
Well it could be worse. If cold and the day is hot I guess it is drinkable.
definitely not a beer for the distinguished beer drinker. Tastes ok for a grocery store beer...
A very mediocre beer. Certainly not as flavorless as Budweiser or Coors, but still lacking a full beer taste. If you want a cheap beer that is bearable, this may be the pick.
The color isn’t much to speak of.  Only the lightest of yellow.  Virtually no aroma when its cold, maybe a bit skunky when its warm.  Flavor is only the lightest sweetness and some corn.
Hardly rates as a beer.  Lolly water with a bit of alcohol.  Some hops and  malt would not go astray.  No after taste at all. A poor show.

Just got back from the NASCAR race where I met a hottie with a couple of teeth. We hit the beer tent where my favorite was tapped, MGD. After 8 hours and not watchin’ any of the race me and my hottie crashed in my truck.

(tap.) One of Millers finer offerings... can be chugged and be used as a pick me up beer.. not swill... just above the swill level and a good thing for sure...Hey its not a freakin’ bud product. No Head.

I can’t say I love it - but I do kinda like it. The maltiness and cheapness apeal to me. I like the affordable price. I do prefer Rolling Rock on taste and palate though. Other than the malty alcohlic water, there isn’t much here of which to speak (or type).
Easy drinking beer,great for parties, not much taste at all, to bubbley for me, easily chugged

Bottle: Compared to other shitty beers, this one ain’t bad.  Not much aroma, but there are some decent malts in the taste which are unfortunately downplayed by the common metalic taste and watered-down mouth feel.  For what this beer is meant to be, it isn’t bad.  And by that I mean it’s not meant to be a good beer.  Why did someone on the page give it a 17/20 overall???
I hate this beer more than just about any other.  Always tastes like I’m drinking a copper mine.  Horrid, Horrid stuff.
Still like the taste of this macro draft. A little high on carbonation. Very little aftertaste.
The lesser of the three evils. Some good malts happening. Stil retains metallic adjuct flavors typical of all macros, but this seems to disguise them.
Between this and the MGD light, I actually preferred the light.  Less to offend, I suppose.  Then I went to the gas station on the corner and bought a six pack of SNPA.
Vilest of the vile.  I’d honestly rather drink the water you see on those feed the children commercials.  Very rancid, metallic taste.

Clear light golden yellow with a thick diminishing fizzy white head.  Aroma of cereal, cardboard and corn.  Light watery body with fizzy carbonation.  Flavor of corn, light bread and a hint of spice with adjunct related sweetness.  Pretty bad, but not yet into undrinkable/drain pour territory.
Too many bars are devoted to this....oh to be born in ignorance...how skunky.
Very bubbly, probably why it gives me headaches. Too watery. Dominating skunkiness. If you like Miller than this is your ultimate beer.

Pours light yellow with a fizzy, white, evaporating head; lots of bubbles!  Bubbles!  Sweet aroma, maybe a little apple but probably just corn; not offensive, it just smells macro-beery.  Flavor is relatively bitter all around for a macro with maybe just the tiniest bit of skunkiness to carry you through.  There is a hint of hops in the finish, moreso than with many other comparable beverages.  Somewhat metallic/pee aftertaste but nothing a meal can’t overcome.  Palate is exceedingly light, but this is a lovely summer drink.  Overall, perhaps one of the better macro lagers I’ve had.  And the bottle is kind of pretty.
graduation party . armoa corn flavor besides the corn not much else another one that you need to drink ice cold and fast
Not bad for a beer that looks watered down, comes in a clear bottle and it really does taste better than the High Life stuff.  But you goota have this Ice cold.
mass produced beer flavored water. much better than coors. this is definitely not my first choice.
