The only remarkable thing about this beer is how many people drink it on a regular basis.

There are different types of beers. Outstanding as an affordable beer and, what I would describe as a drinking beer. That is one can drink bottle after bottle and it tastes delicious. Doesn’t give the nasty headache Bud products provides. It has body and tastes like BEER rather than watery Coors which doesn’t taste like anything.
Light corn malt aroma.  Medium yellow color with minimal head.  Sweet barley malt flavor.  No better than most of the other Miller pale ales at a higher cost.
Another classic American lager.  Not sure if it tastes like draft beer because it seemed alomst absent of taste.  Looks like urine in a cold bottle.
A good bear if your camping and just want to dring A LOT OF BEER and have a can that burns all the way down in the camp fire,,,I can drink a lot of this!! its good!!
this one goes down really well with no aftertaste....or any taste at all for that matter.

[bottle] Pours a clear straw color with a very thin looking white head. Very faint biscuit and corn aroma. Very stale and dry corn and grain taste that’s very watery and lacking in the aftertaste department. On the whole, it’s not really as bad as some of the other session beers out there.
This beer was only cool when I added chocolate syrup too it. I didn’t like it before, barely distinguishable from the other Massproduced swill out there...
I’ve been on RB how long without rating this BMC standard?? The epitome of corn beer. This beer captures the true flavor of rotting corn better than any other beer I’ve tasted. Nice work Miller!
Reminds me of cigarette smoke. cheaper than bud. one dimensional. what else is there to say? im out of clever analogies likening it to liquid iron ore.

In a free bottle at a business dinner. I’m not sure of the appeal. I’m really not sure of the process. Isn’t this simply a marketing gimmick? Just what is cold filtering and why would this make a bottled beer become a draft beer? And isn’t the word "genuine" somewhat disingenuous? I mean, if it were genuine draft, wouldn’t it come out of a keg like it’s supposed to? This whole nonsense reminds me of the "dry" beer craze about 15 years ago. I suspect that there’s just less hops in it. It’s not the worst beer I’ve ever had, it’s just the first cousin of the worst.
Hummmmmmmm. no se me ocurre nada bueno,... bueno que se puede beber a morro con una rajita de limon :)

I’ve spent more time in the company of this beer than I’m comfortable with, but not by drinking it, no, through serving to the customers at my bar. Happily, it’s the only macro-crap I’ve got on tap, but it’s exceedingly popular among those masses that I haven’t the time or power to change their minds. In the name of research, curiosity, or maybe sadomasochism I venture forth to review a small sampling of this wretched brew.
Color: very pale yellow,nearly invisible, the very match of urine. Head: tall, fluffy, pure snow white. Aroma: zilch, zero, zip. I flared my nosrtils deep to try to detect something or anything but came up bone-dry, with maybe a touch of soap and flowers. 
Mouthfeel is a rough and harsh terrain, with a grainy sweetness to be traversed in every sip. A horrid brashness exists in every attempt to gulp and it leaves a non-existent finish, as if the offending liquid wished no memory to remain of it’s brief stay in the mouth. It passes through quickly, leaving not a trace, but only bad memories. The perfect beer for those who don’t give a damn what goes down their gullet. No hops are felt, no malt, no body, no texture.
That’s when I got it. I’d gone about it all wrong! Every time I tried to taste this sad excuse for a beer, I winced and pulled away, embittered and beated aback, every time this swill passed through my lips. When I merely gulped back and stopped thinking, however, there was no problem, no sirree, bob!
I wonder how people drink this stuff, then I realize that they’ve been hoodwinked! Somehow, they’ve been convinced that this foul concoction is actual beer and the Miller Brewing Co. is happy to provide. Lord save us all...
This is what I stock my vending machine in the garage with.  Has the most flavor of the Millers and cheap enough that it’s o.k. for my brothers to come over and steal em’.
Canned at a family party. A free rqatings. It’s yellow. Tasted like a beer. Not bad from the main three.
Not the worst macro out there. Actually, it’s not that bad if it’s free. Pours a golden piss color with a boring but crisp lager taste. Not good but I’ve had much worse.
Yes, I know, another terrible beer for me tonight.  Cant wait to crack open a real beer.  It would be an ok beer after a hot day working the yard.

Minor DMS in sweet aroma. Clear golden colour with decent white head and good carbonation. Flavour is very plain and slightly swwet. Inoffensive but boring. Light, refreshing body and lively mouthfeel. Tastes as if it was made as cheaply as possible bur Hat’s off to Miller - it’s a good "product" although it ain’t much of a beer. Bottle (clear).
Way tooo sweet for a pilsner beer. If this beer had a bitterness to it, it may be alright to drink.

if i had to pick one domestic to drink it would be this.  a distinct cold flavor and lasting impression on your mouth.  still no good but if you are up north in the boonies you can always order one of these.
Bottled.  Almost colourless liquid with huge carbonation and a thick, sticky head.  Taste is almost non-existant except for that lager "kick".

Just not a good effort. Miller made some good beers a few years back in their reserve line up, but those didn’t make it. Too bad, because Miller’s surviving beer line is good for nothing but headaches and producing burps.
This beer is watered down, but has a nice golden color to it. Not much flavor. This is the best miller beer I've had though.
Corn aroma.  Taste is sweet corn with a horrible metal/chemical aftertaste which grows stronger as you drink it.  blah.
Had a smooth, sweet, corn, and a taste that in the end i decided taste like a penny, so copper. I like the yellow glow it has in the bottle and has a light yellow head. Too sweet though.

...and sometimes you drink a beer you haven't had in years - just to be able to add to your ratings.  Actually, I used to kind of like this beer - chugged it at card games.  Maybe this is why I lost so much cash - constantly running to the bathroom!  Pale in colour, pale in flavour, too sweet.  Produces good burps though.

Bottled, pasteurised. Weird yellow colour almost luminous, gassy. Broke my normal rules of tasting, borrowing a swig from a friends bottle. My preconceptions were confirmed, this is a nasty sweet boiled cooked corn flavour with an underlying chemical flavour. Glad I didn't pay for it.
Nice color, cool bottle, the second best Standard American beer of the big 3.  Good beer taste serves its purpose

Kind of a ripe metallic taste to cover the lack of effort.  Not impressed.  This is a holdover round, not even something you would drink by the six-pack on a summer night.  The color is an attempt at class, obviously not slipping entirely into a black hole, but doesn't carry it nearly far enough.  In summation, a bizarre beer.  [Further, later comment agreed upon at a bar last night: "Drinking Miller beers is like taking Draino for the stomach."]
Did not enjoy this beer at all. The average score of this even seems too high. I remember everybody in the room complaining about how bad this tasted when this is the beer that was suplied.

Pale yellow appearance, with white head that completely disappears.  Aroma of corn syrup, some faint maltiness.  Thin body and faint maltiness.  Incredibly sweet, which isn't really noticable until you've drunk the whole bottle, at which point it is disgustingly cloying.  Otherwise very little taste.  This is definitely not good beer, but it's not super offensive either.  I don't entirely understand the hatred of American Standards since you pretty much get what you expect.
Not a bad beer.  Not a great one.  Pretty middle of the road, and one of the few brews from a macro that I'll buy.  Aftertaste isn't too nice.
Never really drank this a whole lot with budweiser being around but it isnt a bad beer
It's pretty bad, drank it a lot freshman year of college, roommate got me into it, it beat drinkin Keystone or Natty Light
Clear bottles, awful smell, tastes like yak piss.  A little better than Bud and Coors, but not much.

Bottled, BB 15.12.2004

This bottle cost ~2 euros here ... 
Typical lager color, nice foamy white head. Lots of CO2. Smells cooked corn - extremely bad. Extremely watery mouthfeel, some corn taste. Gives oily mouthfeel in aftertaste.
Bottle - clear.  Looks like yellow food coloring.  White head.  Sweet.  Tasted like fizzy corn Kool-Aid.  Hadn't had one in a long time.  May have been my last one.
Large creamy head that completely dissipates after a while. Clear yellow body. Paper/cardboard lemon aroma, same for taste with some corn or something. Not completely bad, but it still isn't good.

Sort of dark for my likes.  The advertising does not shine through the otherwise skunked taste.  Leaves me desiring a quality head, and any quality taste.  "Cold Filtered"  yuck.  Nothing bottled to me is draft.
Not that bad of a beer for BMC swill.  I'll admit it kind of tastes like it was on tap.  I'll take this over a Bud easily.
This beer is much better than expected. Slight fruity aroma, mostly corn. Pretty good for a macro brew.
MGD is somewhat fizzy and incredibly bland. If you have to drink it make sure it is ice cold or try drinking water instead
It is a very cheap beer but taste so good. I know there are better one's but expensiver.

Not that great. Urine colour, and some sort of weird corny/fruity aroma....but not like any other fruit I have smelled in a beer before. Decent if you are stuck at a sports bar and can only pick between MGD and bud.
Not much to say, pretty nondescript.  I like the cornish flavor that it carries.  Does not stick to the palate.
One of the few beers where I like the light style better. But still a good brew if its one of limited choices.

Urine is the color for the beer and what can really be said for this.  I tried one because i love to experiment.  That was 4 months ago and I don't think I will ever drink another macro beer again.  No flavor, no taste, had trouble getting it down

Pours a urine gold color with little head and lots of carbonation.  Aroma is very light, sweet malt and corn.  Flavor is to follow the aromas, corny sweetness and thin body.  Not the best beer on the block.
It’s not the best beer one could drink, but at the same time, it’s a low cost beer that tastes pretty all right and doesn’t linger on the palate.
Good color and clean smell.  This beer is not overpowering and accompanies food well.  An easy drinker

Pale yellow, highly carboated. Not much aroma. Tastes sweet and metallic, finishes dry. Light taste led me to beleive this could be consumed easily, but drinking it fast kind of makes me gag. Do not let it warm up at all. Ain't my cup of tea.

Draught
Blond color. Fizzy beer-soda, with very light aroma. Dry mouthfeel, poor; just not disgusting…
Of the family of uneventful Amarican domestics, this is way more decent than most.  Very clean finish.  Refreshing.  Not exciting.  Not repulsive.  OK.
DIE. Someone tell me how this is different than High Life.  Please.  I only drink this when it is free and the only alternative is the beast.

A pale, clean beer without too much flavour. A perfect quencher for after mowing the lawn.
Spanner.

Light yellow color with a white fizzy head that quickly vanishes. One thing I like about MGD is that it never smells or tastes skunky. Other than that it has mild carbonation, and a nice smooth aftertast. One of my favorite domestic American beers.

adjuncty aroma (corn/rice).
watered down golden colouration, small head that faded fast.
tastes like dishwater, I can honestly say this is the worst beer I've ever tried, very adjuncty, no discernable hop or malted barley character at all.
thin palate.
I'm now in the process of repressing all memories of the taste of this beer, it hurt me to write this review simply because I had flashbacks of the taste, just. so. bad.

pours an extremely light and transparent golden color with a decent white head that hangs around for a bit.  smells of malt and really not much else the same goes for the taste...hardly anything there.
This beer has little to offer in terms of taste and quality. If Miller needed to be proud of something I guess this would be it.
This is the best Miller product...which doesnt say much.  I like MGD well enough.  No need to talk about the aroma, flavor, or appearance...it has no real character in any category.

I was served a few of these last night by someone who is suppose to be my friend. This isn't beer. It tastes like the liquid detergent one washes dishes with. I'm serious. I want to know how the nations second largest brewer gets away with selling shit like this. When did Americans start holding up mediocrity as the standard of excellence? What was the turning point? How can this be one of the best selling beers in the land? How could anyone think this is a good, quality brew? No head, no flavor, no hops,no barley, no aftertaste, nothing but a soapy taste & feel.
And it's pricey. $8.49 for 12.  I just don't understand how there can be a market for this. I want answers! I want justice!
I live in Milwaukee, and I am embarrassed!

I had absolutely no expectations towards this beer, but surprice this was a pleasent experience. This beers quality is in its taste and mouthfeel, the aroma is almost non existing, and the colour and the head is rather dull.

Yuck yuck yuck... why I tried this beer again is beyond me. I suppose I wanted to have one for an accurate review.

Urinelike in appearance... really cheap smell. Smells like a trash can at a beer tent. Tastes like the beer from the bottom of that trash can was dumped into cans.

Mouthfeel isn't awful... it's the best part of this "beer," but who wants this in their mouth? Undrinkable for me...
Terrible macro-brew. No effort put into this at all. Perhaps ok for beginner beer drinkers that havent aquired a taste for good beer.
Typical college swill.  A friend of mine gave this junk to me for free, and that's the only way I'll ever end up drinking this again, if at all.  Hardly anything to this one.
Annheiser Busch if one must macro.  Flim Flam.  Light hops, no malt, just wheat and rice.  Screw adjuncts.  Best served in a dog bowl.

(4,7% ABV, made by license within the EU) Pale yellow-golden color, smallish, lightly lacy head. Sweetish, corny malt in the aroma with hints of lime and no hops. Mild, sweetish lime flavor with some sourish acidity. No finish. Light-bodied, watery, somewhat fizzy but reasonably smooth at the same time. Is this the ultimate goal in American macro brewing: to remove the acidity from a lime-flavored cider, and hops from a corny pale lager - and combine these into an alcoholic liquid, to be drunk from the bottle while mowing the lawn on a hot day?

Draft, 1/26/04. Well, the "cold-filtering" produces something of a yeast bite, but after that, no real flavor at all. Just a generic, watery "beer-thingie." Smell is passable, but adjuncts are most prominent.
From can at Schaller’s Pump, Chicago South Side before the Sox upset of "Los Angeles." The only reason I took notes on this was because I couldn’t remember having reviewed it before. Same ol’ piss yellow pour, with a thin canned beer head. Okay, there’s something of a malt character here before it gets overwhelmed by corn. Not so much saccharine or cloying but like drinking from a cup smeared with lipstick. Empty barley pop.
If i have to drink Miller this i what i am picking.  the flavor is not bad and either is the finish.  it does have a smooth drinkability.
I didn't care for this beer very much it had an ok appearance but It had a wierd aftertaste that is hard to describe. didn't sit well in the palate either.
Water, hints of water, notes of water.  It was free, and sitting in the fridge.
Another bad beer.  Hey, I was at my friend's.  Don't blame me.  Worse than the Rolling Rock because MGD has more of an ass taste.  I try to be nice, but it's just too damn hard with this one.
Terrible. At first sight we often theorize about a beer's quality - or lack thereof. Pale yellow that doesn't inspire you to drink it and then the flavour proves the theorum.
Very light gold in colour.  Aroma of skunk and corn with the flavour not being any better.  Finish is all water.  Why bother.

Pretty gross.  I can't put my finger on the flavor, but it's somewhere between eating a wheat grain and a pile of sawdust.  Honestly, you can do so much better for the same price.  I do think it's better than High Life though.
Hardly any aroma. The flavor is fruity, but doesn't offer anything else. Lack of hops, lack of malt, lack of bitterness, lack of balance, lack of pleasure...
This parallels many American macro brews in that it is bland watery. No thanks - I'll eat my corn and rice on a plate please

a typical american macro brew.....good on price low on flavor.  has a thick metal flavor.  i prefer more premium beer such as busch, old milwaukee and pbr.  always best served as cold as possible and drink fast!
Very typical for mass-produced fermented rice water. Drink it ice-cold when your team is on a roll and you just want to roll with 'em!

The best cheap macrobrew, if there is such a thing. Perfect for bowling, though not as much so as High Life. MGD has more flavor than High Life – a sort of nutty flavor when really cold – don't let it get warm, though. Just the thought makes me want to hurl!
on draft which doesn't make it suck any less.  the taste of adjuncts is over powering.   the funk aftertaste is god awful.   i'd rather visit dante's inferno than drink this ever again.
Can. This is one of my least favorite macros. Ice cold it is drinkable, but once it warms up, even just a little, it became drain pour. I'vd had worse--something I'm not proud of.

This beer only has a bit more flavor than Corona...

and that's not a compliment.
if i were stranded on a island dying of thrist i might drink it but im still gonna die from to much salt and no water so avoid

Pale yellow. Tiny white head that goes away fast and leaves nothing behind. A hint of hops, a tease of malt and a whole lot of water. Nothing really offensive. A beer to drink  when you are thirsty , plain and simple.
Not the worst thing on the planet, but of course not the best either. Perhaps the best of the worst?
It's better out of the bottle.  I guess it is more alcoholic than Miller Lite, which is a plus.
Typical american pilsner. Clear light yellow body. Very watery in aroma and flavor. Crispy palate.

Average American Standard in taste.  I personally think it tastes very crisp and refreshing when out of a bottle, but I shy away from it out of a can or on draft.  There's just something about it that tastes especially good at a BBQ with some burgers and friends.  Overall, watery taste, pale appearance, and goes down smooth.  Better than Bud I'd say but Coors may be a little better.  Either way you aren't paying much for it
Coloured water. Bottle of piss. Who hasn't heard those descriptions of Miller? As a sane person, I agree. No character at all in this.
Better than the average American mega-lager. Average flavor--beats Bud anyway.
MGD is CHAMP. dont kid yourself people. MGD has it all. good price and it taste grrrrrrreeeeeeaaaaaaaaaaaatttttt.
Not too much to say, sort of a different deeper flavor, average aroma, head, nothing to brag about but is cheap.
This is a cheap beer I don't seem to mind.  It has a decent clean crisp taste that isn't too harsh.  Better from the keg than a bottle - one of the better college keg party regulars.
I don't really have anything to say about this beer one way or the other. I wouldn't buy it, but seeing how it's a tailgate kinda beer, i wouldn't turn it down either.
a quality beer and only 89 cents for 16ounces out of a can, cant beat that with a stick
I love this one. Not pretty to look at, but goes down really easy and tastes quite smooth.
Not a good brew.  small white fully diminishing head on a light yello body.  Some aroma of malt.  Taste is lighly sweet and a little hoppys shows up in the lightly bitter finish.

I found this in the back of the fridge..my wife's best friend left it yesterday after she visited with us. 12 oz bottle.
Appearance is very bland indeed..bright yellow urine appearance small head.
This beer smells really bad..its hard to describe..its "terrible..maybe its skunked?
Taste is very dry..nothing special
feels prertty bad in the mouth and its not very drinkable..and to think Miller put this AHEAD of their much better product, High Life..strange world we live in!
Pale Yellow,Small head,very malty aroma.Very smooth in the mouth,but leaves a very long malty aftertaste.
Clear yellow in color, little fizzy head. Faint aroma , maybe malt? Flavor is water, slightly sweet. Finish is crisp and thin.
Good for drinking when youre already drunk and it doesent matter any more. Good lawnmower beer, ect. Slightly more quenching than miller high Life.

Tried again recently, like club soda with a hint of beer flavoring added. The smell was slightly meaty with some bologna. Old rating follows. Light gold colored body. The aroma is very light with some carrots and little else. The taste is a little grainy with corn.There is just a hint of grass. A decent macro lager.
Bottle: Pale yellow color, small quickly disappearing head, stale body with no distinct taste. Overall not a great one.
I'm not sure what it was about thins one but I have one hell of a headache from it!
The best of the US mass-produced crap but that's not saying a hell of a lot. Reminds of Carlton Cold back home and that, my fellow beer lovers, is a bad, bad thing.

Classic case of getting what you pay for.  I bought a 24 oz. can of this beer for $1.07.  For comparison a 22 oz. bottle of Avery Hog Heaven is in the range of $5.00.  The Avery is a bargain.  Beer has weak aroma, though more than some macros.  Appearance is yellow and fizzy though the head formation was modestly impressive.  Flavor is bland with a tiny bit of hop bitterness.  Forgetable.
Tastes slightly watered down. Gets warm way too fast and just makes you wanna toss it. After about 5 you cant even taste it. Drink when ice cold, other than that, dont really bother.
This beer is digusting, almost nil flavour but what it has is bad. I havent come across a great cold filtered beer, I never was looking forward to it, off straw colour, weak, thin and watery.
Glad I didn't have to pay for this one. Pretty much what I expected from it also. Anyway colour is light straw, decent head, good lacing, and taste  well I just cant find some kind words for it.

Whatever the hell they do to it, it's unnatural.  Water, water, water, minimal bite, cheap sweetness.  American Standard is also the name of a major bathroom fixtures manufacturer.  You'd do better pouring an American Standard into an American Standard than drinking it.  Why do I keep buying full size samples of this stuff to rate?
this is a beer that i don't to much care for but will drink if i have to. bottles are best
Its beer nothing special.  Clean and crisp but  rather have many other beers instead.
Well what do you know, it's better than Miller Lite. Just another one of those "take it if there's nothing else" beers. Corny adjunct sweetness. Cardboard aftertaste.
A nothing beer, built for mainstream consumption.  Just enough to indicate its a beer, but not much else. cheers
Poured a golden  color with a large white head.  Terrible taste of phenols, metal, and corn.
Probably the best of the mainstream american beers but still awful.  Golden colour and watery taste are not really highlights

The good news is that it was free at the golf tournament I played in today. The bad news is, well, it's MGD and it was in a can.
The flavor is more sour than bitter and it should be served ice cold so as not to inflame your taste buds.
I actually like this one. It's not the best in the world, but good enough to share with your friends.
Clear golden color. Quite typical american style beer. Some rice in the taste. Weak aroma, bit brackish.

24 oz. bottle with a Rusty Wallace twist-off cap. Classy. Pale yellow and clear as water. Aroma of stale malt, hop pellets, and dirty socks. Weak flavor of sweet boiled vegetables and water. Thin palate.
probably the most disgusting beer i've had. tastes/looks like cold urine..miller probably even uses some urine in this beer to cut costs in half..those workers gotta pee somewhere!
Only slightly and I do mean slightly better than Bud. FFS a 75 character minimum I've already typed more than this swill merits.
Horrible.  My buddy brought this stuff over for a football game.  No flavors struck my fancy.  I would rather drink almost any other beer.
This isn't a good beer. A little bit better than Miller Lite but really does not satisfy any taste buds. Has a little sweeter taste than High Life.
Not too bad for an am. standard. A bit too sweet for my liking tho. Just like the picture shows, a very golden yellow, lots of bubbles and not a lot of flavor.

nowhere near the amount of adjuncts that Budweiser uses.. but still a blah yellow beer. When there's nothing decent on tap, I'd have this with BBQ or a burger. Taste that filtered corn/rice-water everyone!
Another crappy and cheap college beer.  Unappealing yellow color, bland taste.  Steer clear.

Nice try run of the miller beer.Like a Budweiser.,yet a miller.COLD filtered(woo-hoo).Not a horrible lager.Not somthing I’d really want but.. I had two  of these bottled on 7-21-05 and it was quaffable(this ,after 3 Dominion Octoberfests and 3 Three Floyds Alpha Kings.It was ok.Very cabonated and very almost middy, while being ok.Almost a pinch beer.Close to decent and cleaner than a yuengling.Still not as good as one.~
I'm not a big fan of this beer. Prefer Bud over this. Very watery. Pale yellow color.
The interesting thing about Miller products is they don't suck as bad as A-B.  There is a little more hop flavor and enough to keep you interested.  This is smooth, plus it was free at a wedding.

Cold filtering somehow keeps the flavor in this beer, so they say.  So exactly what would it taste like without cold-filtering?  Truly a innovation in American Brewing? Its probably just a Brita or something cause this stuff is water.  Better than Beast or Bud, but not saying much.

Miller has a unique taste that is better than Bud and Coors. This is one of their best brands. I've had this at the bowling alley too many times. What would you rather have- Bud or Miller? Any day of the week and twice on Sunday.

Yes, it sucks.  Other than a weird metallic tang from the can, this beer didn't seem to have any adjunct flavor.  Or any flavor period.  Appears a very yellow yellow, fizzy, no head.  Mouthfeel is nonexistent - it's like drinking yellow flavored water.
IT SUCKS! IT SUCKS! It's a near flavorless macrobrew that discourages people from drinking real beer! Avoid Miller!

Bottled.  Poured with a thick head befitting of the draft name.  Sweet taste with a faint aroma of corn.  This used to be my regular beer many years ago, before my palate evolved.  Still good on a hot summer day and it is better than the regular Miller High Life.
not really sure what makes this "genuine", but it's genuine crap as far as I'm concerned.  true innovation?  whatever
Golden straw colour.  Very minimal head. Weak aroma.  Washes down food and pain I guess.  Not much to it.

What can i say...its a thirst quencher...never on tap in uk..always get metallic tasting tinned beer...Drank quite a lot in Arizon,California,Nevada..goes well with the heat.....forget water...go for the headache! Kick Bud ASS!

Clear yellow and a surprisingly nice had. I cant find much of an aroma at all, and there is not much taste either. It has a weak bready, strange taste that takes all the refreshment away. A good thing that can be said about american beers is that they can be nice of a hot day. But for Gods sake, choose water instead of this beer.
Was much better when it was introduced in comparison with the champaigne of beers. In my circle of friends it was a fad beer that after we all left school moved on to more sophisticated brews.
Smells like rice and corn, tastes like rice and corn.  I don't think they even bother to whisper the word "hops" in the same room as the wort.  Truly one of my least favorite American Standards.

Wow.  Big carbonation with a decent snowy white head.  Was not expecting that (the decent head part that is).  Initial aroma of my 11 month old's Gerber stage 2 ground chicken baby food.  Quite repulsive!  Does not get much better.  Color is a medium gold color.  Flavor is watery and thin with a slight hop and malt presence.  Finish is smooth but that is about it.  No real flavor or redeaming quality.  A mass produced beer for the ignorant masses.  Ah, if they only knew what they were missing.

I'M A PRETTY BIG FAN OF THIS BEER OVERALL.  I DON'T LIKE THE FACT THAT YOU'RE MOSTLY PAYING FOR THEIR COMMERCIALS WHEN YOU BUY THIS, BUT WHAT THE HELL, THIS IS AMERICA ISN'T IT?  VERY EASY TO THROW BACK 8 OR 9 OF THESE IN A HURRY. BE CAREFUL THOUGH, YOU MAY HAVE SOME LOOSE STOOL THE NEXT DAY.  IF MILLER WOULD LOWER THE PRICE A FEW BUCK A CASE I WOULD BE ALL OVER THIS STUFF.
The pain of increasing my number of sampled beers.  Yellow, looks like beer. Scent: Nada, taste, nada, pleasure? - Nada.
This is better than the miller high life line, but not as good as Miller Lite.  A little more sour, with some flat stale notes that linger, though not nearly as stale as High Life.

Considerably more offensive than Miller Lite and you don't look nearly as cool drinking it as you do MHL. Once, in high school, lipskin came over to my dad's house and we drank warm cans of this from a 30-pack in my bedroom closet. Sometimes I would use ice to cool it down but I don't know if the extra water affected the beer much. Ten bucks says it doesn't make a damn bit of difference.
There is nothing here to detract from the wonderful fizzy, slight adjunct taste.  Although the MGDs that I have had were not defective, they were not in possession of much beer character either.
A little skunky. Taste is nothing that stands out (nothing in capital letters) but it's not totally unpleasant like other commercial beers or microbrewers errors.

From the can.  We got done with a big outdoor project at 12:30 a.m.  Somebody had brought a cooler of "beer" to be "enjoyed" afterwards.  OK, I'm sweaty & thirsty.  Popped the top and detected a beer-like aroma.  That's probably the best feature of this beer, though I couldn't get a look at it because there was no glassware available (hard to rate the appearance in this case so I gave it a middling "3" just to be fair).

The taste was fairly lifeless; quick initial maltiness followed by...well, nothing.  Maybe there's a slight hop taste in the background if I try really hard to imagine it. But maybe not. And that's the name of that tune.

A few additives to Miller High Life and presto---a higher price and a bigger marketing campaign.  The beer that brought the Miller name back into households?  I like this better than Budweiser but like Budweiser, it's not really worth the hoopla.  Spend an extra dime and get Rolling Rock or Michelob instead.
good olde MGD. A rancid yet amazingly bland and drinkable taste. I do like the way the palid yellow jaundiced color reflected in the sun after a hard hour of mowing the lawn. No flavours to report.

I always wind up drinking this at sports event my logic being the other option is Miller Lite and this has more alcohol. It comes off as sweet and heavy in the belly. The main redeeming quality of this style is that they are light, crisp and refreshing and this has none of those three.

Pretty good. This isn't a beer that I'm going to sit and sip with my finest pint. The appearance is faint and thin, with little to no head that is white and manufactured. Tasted mild and nice, went down smooth. Better than many of the mass produced beers.
Poured yellow color with a little white bubbly head. Typical Macro beer, not much flavor at all.

Golden yellow beer with an average frothy, white head.  Has no real aroma or flavor to speak of.  Not really a beer but more of alcoholic water.  Not the worst macro brew I've ever had.  At least it's clean feeling.
my wifes favorite beer, yellow fizzy, clean taste(no taste) a little sweet and dry, no finnish

Had this at TGI Fridays after the Bon Vivant Beer Lovers Club on 6-27-03. Predictable as all hell and a typical American Standard macro. Maybe I've should have gotten the overpriced "imports". Nah, why waste the money. Yellow with a thin, weak, watery nose. Very smooth due to no taste whatsoever. Not the worst BMC macro, but nothing I'll rush to try again.
Bright yellow in color.  Alcohol aroma.  The flavor is ok but could use some work.  Decent american beer.

the color is bright for some reason. i don't know want to know why the color is bright, however. i drank this in my college days but not afterward. definitely an acquired taste. some people will like / some will hate. natasha, did you get my money yet?
At least it isn't Bud, so its not the worst beer in the world.  Should only be drank with hotdogs or sausages.
Okay, I may be harsher than normal due to the fact that this was the best "beer" available at an Irish Music Festival, but this really sucks. The best that can be said about it is that it is not Bud.

I used to drink this a lot when I was out of funds.  I just can't stomach it anymore.  Decent head is short-lived.  Pale urine-like color.  No aftertaste that I could notice.  There's much better cheap beer than this.
Tolerable at the most....most Miller is tasteless to me though and this is no exception.

Surprisingly frothy head, though the party doesn't last long. Champagne-like bubbles rise through the clear, pale, light-yellow color. Corn-like malts loiter in the mouth. Very fizzy and watery texture. Slightly sweet. No major aftertaste off-flavors to complain about, but definitely nothing to brag about either.
My personal favorite.  When ever i have enough money i always get this.  taste alot smoother then anything else.

The only thing worse than this is the Light version. This is pretty wattery and does nothing for me. I was at this little get together where people were drinking this and they seemed to love it. I asked them what they liked about MGD and they said that they can "drink about 20 of them before they get a buzz." How sad.

this is an abomination. i think they tried to go with a pils type malt flavour, but all they ended up with was a shit smelling sickly sweet beer. budweiser is much better than this, but i don't rate that beer either. i am also led to believe that this is sold as a "premium" beer. that is an utter disgrace. i reckon they decided to substitute hops with chemicals, in this beer. mine was out of a bottle, and was 4.7% alcohol. i can't believe someone who's tasted this beer before, would pay the rip-off price for this. i would rather drink emu export.
It quenchs my thirst and I get what i pay for. Affordable and no crummy aftertaste... I can't believe I'm writing this.

This falls in the 'swill' category.  Had it in a can, it was just plain nasty.  While other cheap beers go down easy and flavorless, this had a horrible taste to it.  I had to force myself to finish the stuff.

Ok I have drank a lot of this swill in the past but it had been years ago and I wasn't going to try and rate it from old drunken memories. But I sinned his week and drank one of these oxymoron’s “draft bottled beer”. Apparently this is the present unofficial beer of the local Fort Lewis Ranger battalion. No wonder those guys went to war, this shit would put anyone in a bad mood. It was free and I drank it (why insult a ranger). What a lovely piss yellow color and the smell of rotten hominy grits in the background. Yes in the watery bodied fluid one can taste that fine hint of caned corn and card board. But mostly this swill is just water
This is a great beer, even though it is high in price.  Still though, i suggest that you drink it, because you won't regret it.

Okay, my fault for going to a Memorial Weekend party without bringing decent beer.  My choices were Bud and MGD, so I poured off enough into a plastic cup to do a rating (may as well get some value out of it...), then gave the can to a guy who told me how much he likes the MGD.  "It's expensive," he said, "but I really like it and it's all I drink now."  My God, what was he drinking before???  Anyway, it poured a clear yellow color, highly carbonated giving rise to a fizzy white head.  Sickly sweet aroma, with a hint of lemon.  Watery malt flavor, slightly hopped with an almost objectionable finish.  I'm so ready and grateful for that good barleywine that I've been saving for tonight...
Clear golden, white head that soon turns into fluffy revolting big bubbles. Sour aroma. Somewhat sweet in flavor. No bitterness. (Un)believably lame.

a horrible nasty god awful beer.  i would rather drink king cobra than this shit.  you can imagine what it pours by looking at the bottle.  however you cant imagine the horrible smell of shit that is presented when the top is screwed off
For a moment I thought I tasted something, but I was wrong. DOA. Very fizzy and sweet.
Another one of my "drink at the bowling alley" beers. Better than Bud but still strickly a less than average macro. Draft what draft?
Hmm not bad, had better for half the price..................................
easy drinking beer started out fairly tastee but is getting worse and giving me a headache
Pale yellow. Pours w/ a big fizzy head that immediately diminishes to nothing. Sweet, grainy aroma. Sugary body. Very sweet, coarse, chemical-laden, corn flavour. Awful.

Minor Gravity Draught
Malts Gone Definitely
May Give Dysentery
My God Disgusting
Must Go Directly

Oh dear.  I had this at the bar right after having a few Guinesses.  This is not a good idea.  Like High Life, it's too sweet for my liking.  Sorta tastes cornish.  Smells horrible.  This used to be one of my favorite beers.  I must have been stupid.  As "standard" as American Standards get.
Increasingly popular at college due to the "hip" commercials recently aired.  Regardless, a bland beer with nothing to distinguish it from Bud and Busch other than the cool acronym

This brew poured a large creamy head of fine white bubbles. It has a urine yellow body. Its flavor is not bad, but is more like drinking flavored water with no bite. It does leave a slight aftertaste and is a little fizzy.

Miller, my brothers favourite beer, he doesnt know anything about beers. Once I poured him a nice glass of chimay blue, he said " Yuck a dark beer"
I dont like Miller but it is the probably one of few that I could drink at a party.
Ok decent drink when offered by neighbors (and the only other option is the chocolate milk you are saving for breakfast)

Fresh looking with a nice head.
A sour aroma, palate like water+sweet&low.
Flavour? No not really, some touch of licorice, maybe.
It's a lot better than Miller High Life or Miller Light, but that's not saying a whole lot.
Aroma is light. Gold in color. Beer is easy to drink when cold. When warm it taste pretty bitter. For a Amercian Standard not to bad.
The aroma is light and of tin.  The appearance is a pale gold with a thin bubbly head.  The flavor is sweet, almost to sweet.  The beer is crisp and easy to drink.  Overall typical for the style.

Yuck! Another typical American beer. At least I have this rating out of the way. This beer poured a large head with no lacing on the sides of my mug. It had a fruity aroma. It did have a somewhat smooth taste to it. There was no bitterness or aftertaste. This beer simply has no character.
As far as an American Standard goes, one could do a lot worse.  I might would actually drink this stuff as a last resort.
This has to be the worst beer I have ever drunk which was not skunked.  The best taste comparison I can give it is Rotten Fruit.  Why the clear bottle?
Very bad. This beer is: Piss and maize! I'm sorry that that Europeans have to be punished with this shit.

This beer really sucks. It is even worse than Budweiser. It's very weak in everything. The only flavour you can sense is of corn. Why the hell do they import this crap to Denmark instead of some great micros.

I actually liked this beer at one time, when it first came out. Dark yellow with a snow white head which didn't last long enough
for me. Tasted smooth, though. Actually has some hops flavors & aromas to it, but not much. To me, it actually sorta tastes like
a draft beer. Still has that grainy, midwest taste to it, however. Not such a bad beer, for a macroswill. I wouldn't go out of my
way to buy it again, but if it's all I can find, it'll have to do.

I'm with AustinMilbarge on this one, of the big three Miller/Coors/Bud this one is the easiest to take, and believe me when you're catching plenty of airtime in the states, sometimes it's your favoured option. Sad but true tails of an airbourne-warrior.

Thin aroma, thin flavor, and it goes down hill from there. Like club soda with a touch of something beery added, I think. Fortunately I bought mine in the plastic bottles which I can reuse to store water, juices, etc.
Urg, thats a bad one. ... WATER ... Virtually no taste, no aroma, smooth at the end and ... I'll never buy one again.
Delicious.  That is, if you lick the inside of toilets regularly............
I had this on draft at the baseball game tonight..it tasted like all the other beers that i dont like..and when it warmed it made me mad.
Miller is the sibling to Budweiser, with the same lack of color, no body and a strange aftertaste it leaves. For some reason though, I find the taste of this one more odd the Budweiser.

Out of the big three, Miller/Coors/Bud, this one digusts me the least.  It tastes good with pizza or burgers, unless you're in the mood for something good to go with your food.  Not bad for mass consumption, either.

As far as an over produced beer goes, this one isn't bad.  Mostly unoffensive taste of malt that is refreshing when cold.  Good with food and can be quaffed in mass quantites.  Won't win any awards, but still not a horrible offering.
This has become one of my favorite of the popular beers.  It never disappoints and has a pleasant yet distinctive taste.

My wife came home with this the other night, thinking she'd done something nice. It's not a horrible brew, a little better than Bud, but nothing special. The typical piss-yellow, and grainy smell, but fairly refreshing. Not half-bad on tap, either.

I'll never understand why these kind of beers are so popular and sold in the world: there's nothing special in this beer and just a few sweetness gives some flavour to this beer. In Italy the price for this beer is almost the same of Czechvar...it's not really difficult to choose between the two beers...
Pours the color of pee. Cold, wet and rather tasteless. Nothing bad, just not much there.

This could be one of those sentimental biased ratings. This was all I drank in college. But for an American standard beer, its not offensive. Pissy yellow of course, little aroma, smooth "cold filtered" taste. Which basically means they filtered out any taste. A good beer for hot days or parties where slamming beer is more important than flavor. And slamming beer IS more important than flavor in college. And only college. I was a very loyal Miller drinker back then for whatever reason. Decent for a quick gas station beer run.
Tastes overcarbonated and way too sweet.  Typical macrobrew, nothing special here.
When given the choice between this and budweiser, MGD wins hands down - but there's not much I'd prefer it to other than bud...

OK I'm re-rating this as I'm also adding a rating on High Life since I wanted to taste them side by side on the same nights. And Since I've also had more of this since my original rating as well. 
I still Can't say much for this, but as far as super macro's go, Not a bad taste, actually a little sweet, but not a strong sweetness by any means. Just not enough taste; kind of watery in mouth feel as well, but not as watery as Grain Belt Premium. Carbonation was good
the head poured light and fluffy, and did manage to linger with decent lacing.
This is so close to Miller High Life, in almost every respect, that if I have to take a macro, either one would do in a pinch.
Need to drink this one while its cold.  Not very good overall, but not very bad for a bottled draft beer.

Very light in color and has virtually no head at all. The aroma is weak and brief. Quite a bit of carbonation for the mouth and nose. Good as a cold beer on a hot day when you aren't going for flavor savoring.
a real cheap man beer. Not very good but if you want to get drunk from beer then drinking alot of these is a good way. Drank alot of this stuff in high school, nowadays I stay far away from it
what can i say? not too bad for its class. not as adjunct ridden as a lot of other pisswaters. cheap too.
Light amber color with  little to no head. Very little taste. The cheap man's beer if you must have one.

transparent gold with a cardboard/adjunct twist on it, fairly watery and not as carbonated as other American standards.

Acceptable for free & very cold.  Better cheap beers are available.
A faint hint of hops, but not much and not much else. Looks like yellow water, has the faintest of hop hints in the aroma.
MGD - back in the days of college, it was on top... now it just makes it by. A little flavor helps out its overall score.

You know, when I need a cheap party beer/summer brew/etc, I always go for a MGD.  Yeah, there's no comparison to many of the other fine craft brews available but for the money.. . MGD gets the job done. . . sort of .

Not great stuff but ok for a party beer. I used to buy 22oz MGD's for $.99 and i remember them having a bland and almost old grainy taste to it. Kinda like it was sitting around too long. Better than natty, busch, and the like.
Too watery.  There is nothing significant about this beer.  It's nothing but a typical American beer.

Aroma of cooked vegetables that someone threw into the trash three days ago.  The reason this comes in a clear bottle is because it is chemically altered so it can't get light-struck.  Not very comforting.  Flavor similar to the aroma, with a grainy/husky finish.  Gross.
If this is a genuine "draft" beer, then I might as well spend my money on wine. Tries to be "better" than the lights, but actually tastes a bit worse, somehow.
Another winner (insert sarcasm here). Hardly any taste, no head, unattractive pale yellow colour.
Golden.  Taste of sweetness and hops.  Thicker and more filling than many American standards, but still little to enjoy here.
I like this beer becoz it's cheap!I can't really afford expensive beer,and this beer taste pretty good.
Goes down allright when its cold. After a couple it develops a funky metallic taste, can or bottle. I personally prefer High Life.
Blech! Not a very good beer. Tastes like it was brewed with straw. It's a typical Miller product. Watery. You could save 5 bucks for a 30 pack and get PBR. It tastes better, too.

They don't call this the Black Death for nothin...well, maybe they do!?!!  This is pretty much a shit hole, but maybe that's because one time i was dared to drink one that was sitting under a couch in my frat house when we moved in.  And what the fuck is palate?

I had this after my Miller tour had finished.  I can say it is much better there than anywhere else I have had it.  Yellowish color, and white head.  Went down rather easily, but could use some work. Taste needs some improving as well. I strangely prefer this to Miller Lite, but don't really care for either.

Has a golden color with a good amount of carbonation and a not much of a recognizable smell.  Taste is your typical american standard.  Overall not my favorite, but for the money it is not too bad.  I would rather have a PBR or Shlitz.
The bowling alley beer.  Nuff said.  Smells the same way going in as it does going out.
One of the better Macro beers.  I can drink this if it is almost frozen in a frozen glass and it is 95 degrees out.  And then if it is the only beer left.
Tastes like nothing. Very nondememo  beer, much like most mass produced American beers. Smells like can.
It's not bad...you get get similar beer a lot cheaper. Probably the best Miller beer though.
Not one of my favorites. This is a beer which, has kind of a soapy, slimy mouth feel, with an accompanying soapy taste. It's sort of flat-tasting as well.

Good, clear, clean golden lager, not much head, does not last, but a nice continuing stream of bubbles.  Nose, not much there but hops ... do I actually smell hops? in a cheap American beer.  Taste brings back memories.  Millers was the first beer I ever drank, and I drank it in graduate school because at the local pizza place it was cheaper than Coke.  But coke tasted better then, and  I guess it still does.  A little malt, some other cheap grains, a little bitterness with no real character.  Has the best mouth feel of today’s experiment with garbage airplane beers.  Mouthfeel is the best part of the beer.  Overall, probably a little worse than Heineken, but at least it’s cheap and does not pretend to be a serious beer.
not my favorite of beers.. but if i have to drink it i will.................
Fine looking, but faul smell. Drink it icecold, or the smell gets in the taste. (-or don''t buy it).
My favorite. Good strong taste, but not a terrible aftertaste. Tastes like a beer should. Not flat and watery.  No next morning beer heartburn.
Thick head from the pour, soapy texture in your mouth.  Not ment for serious drinking.

Pale yellow color topped by a medium thick white creamy head.  Sour bitter aroma with a slight sweetness, however the nose was light and hard to smell.  Slightly sweet malt flavor but very watery, not much flavor at all.  A finish was non-existant.
very light and smooth.

Miller Genuine draft was the first beer that I consumed in great volume.

I continued to drink MGD consistently until I learned more about beer.  MGD is a easily drinkable abd somewhat refreshable lager, though a bit pricey for the quality.  A good entry level beer for new drinkers not accustomed to strong flavor.  A good summer beer, comparable to Cereveza like beers.
I good beer for when you you dont want that huge kick. Good taste...........

(can) Something is wrong here; i remember this being better in a bottle. Two sips and it was pitched out the window. Truly a vile liquid. Tasted like the post-coital sweat from Ron Jeremy''s buttocks. Oh the humanity.
Miller is probably my favorite Macrobrew company.  This is an alright beer.
Pretty good beer, left my mouth a little dry.  Ill drink it but i won''t go out of my way to get it
Medium body with a slightly drier finish....................................

The fact that MGD has a higher avg. rating than Miller's Plank Road offering, Red Dog, is a joke. Yet another marketing induced bias. I have long considered MGD and Bud Light to be the worst non-budget (e.g., Milwaukee's Best) beers made in America. They are the two beers that I would avoid at all costs, that I would not drink even if they were the only beers available. But, I had yet to rate MGD, so I managed to choke one down in the interests of Ratebeer. In the old days, MGD had a bit of a faint flourescent green hue. I didn't notice that this time; maybe they found a way to strain out the chlorine. I also didn't notice the skunkiness that seemed to pervade early batches. But, at least that gave MGD some distinction. This brew is about as innocuously bland as you can get. Miller makes a pretty decent Lite, but this stuff is bad. The best thing I can say is that it leaves surprisingly good lace.
Bottled(330ml). -draft, yellow colored, good for american standard beer.....
the mother of all beers. this is america. apple pie and mgd on ice. not a great beer by far. but nothing wrong with enjoying a few while you wait for dinner to arrive.

Poured into the glass this beer was a golen color. One of its highlights. The head was full and white. Disappeared quite fast. No lace. There was a small hint of hops but hardly. The taste was crisp when cold, and had small small small hints of hops. Has to be ice cold to be ok. And if it is free, it is better.
Cheap.  Bought it for a party cuz I could buy two twelve packs for cheap.  Good for the price.
Pretty crap.  I had it in Britain, so it''s probably brewed under license, but from the ratings here I think it''s the same stuff.
Think I even like High Life better..........................................
Tastes like what my friends refer to as beer. I''ve had it before, but wouldn''t drink it again unless it was free.
Yellow, bubbly, skunky smell, bland sweet taste.............................
Not a bad beer. Cheap. Reliable(gets you fucked up) and comes in big bottles!

Crisp beer that has a high poundability rating and a smoother finish then Heineken or Bud. Recent batches have increased rubbing alcohol flavor for some reason. This beer is losing its appeal quickly, but is still a good beer if you are a 40''s mood.
If MGD were the worst beer in da world, we''d live in Heaven (I don''t mean Jamtlands:). Very average anyway, 11/20 to encourage the Am. giants.
This beer is actually better in a can.  can be enjoyed when you and your other 12 y/o friends can''t afford any thing good.

Fizzy yellow color, small head. Chemical macro-beer aroma. EECH, this stuff reeks. Cornish flavor. Some malts, some hops and some flavor. Mass-market swill. Drank it cause it was free. Think I will drink a soda next time. Mouthfeel is thin and metallic. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is neutral.
I got a 15 pack of this as a gift.BAD BEER.smells like yeast,tastes like sugar water.this stuff comes straight out of a urinal and into the can.Even ice cold it will be bad.Dont drink it.
Went down quickly and didn''t leave a skunky aftertaste. Those were the pros. You all know the cons.

I sat and pondered the paradox of drinking MGD on tap for quite a while. What should a beer which is supposed to taste like draught out of a bottle taste like out of tap? The answer: I don''t know. Shouldn''t the double negatives cancel out and make it taste like an ordinary bottled beer on tap? All I know is that this is watery and stanky; the only redeeming quality being a kind of neat apple/pear taste that quickly disappears.
I like mgd.  It tastes good and gets you drunk, but i dont buy it much cuz of the price.

This makes me wanna go out and watch NASCAR!  Standard fakely carbonated corn water.  Foamy aroma.  Any hope of real flavor character is gone.  Best to drink it really cold so it seems like a soda pop.
Better then Bud, or High life. If only the beer was as good as their commercials.
One of the most commercialized beers with almost annual Hollywood facelifts. Typical American Standard beer: watery, flavourless skunkweed.
MGD is a decent beer. It''s better on draft, and it''s not a bad price usually at a bar. I like the texture of it but the aftertaste is rather nasty unless your faced.

Definitely my favorite below average beer!  This is a decent keg beer to have at a party where you are drinking to get drunk.  When I was in college, if they had a keg of MGD - you were having the creme de la creme of college party beer!
The worst of the Big 3 American standards. ..............................

When my father-in-law asks me "What should I buy for the party?", I tell him "MGD."  These are the people who think Sam Adams Boston Lager is a "heavy" beer.  I like it better than Bud, High Life, or Coors, though I''m not sure why.  Maybe it''s the clear bottles.  I''ll drink one or two, but usually switch to hard liquor asafp.  It''s inexpensive.  Unremarkable, but not repulsive.  Good on a hot day.
beats High Life. its good and tasty. goes down smooth and not as sugarey....

Its smooth, and it doesnt taste like crap, but it isnt exactly something pleasant to be drinking. Its heavily carbonated and extremely watered down though...cant drink much of it at all.

11/18...time for a re-rate...it is not smooth, it is not tasty...its crap in a bottle :-)
A click above Miller Lite and click below Miller High Life for my tastes.  One has to wonder if they wouldn''t be better off drinking a nice glass of water.
Not quite up to par with Budweiser (not saying much) but who is drinking this for quality.
water again i can get better out of the garden hose.........................

Bottled. Another American type lager, no doubt brewed in England but probably just as bad as the American version. Simular to Budweiser - but without the sourness and a bit more malty. This probably has a lower ratio of rice/barley malt.

Not too horrible, for a macro.  It's cheap, that's good.  Makes a good receptacle for a shot of Jäger on those nights you need to get blasted.  That's about all I'd ever do with this though, if you want beer get some good beer.
Ah good old MGD. Good domestic beer better than most of the others. And just a note on my fellow pennsylvania beer drinker below, dont forget about newcastle brown ale.
Why even drink it if it is in a clear bottle? (Unless it is Sam Smiths of course).  THis has so much nasty taste in it i dont know where to start.  Lots of metallic taste though.  ECCCH- awful.
Don''t ask me why I will always purchase this beer. ........................
It got me drunk and didn''t taste too bad...................................
Nothing special.  But not bad for an American macrobrewed beer.  Better than the light beers though.

I thought that I had previously rated this one but upon looking up some other info I found that I hadn''t. A completly boaring and tasteless beerr a little deeper in color than miller light but just as nasty in taste. There  isn''t much to say about these sort of beers, we''ve all had them we would drink them again if they were free at a party but wouldn''t buy it even with someone else''s money.
This brew is similar to High Life, and the difference is in the right direction. But it is so squeaky clean and sweet that I think the personality of this beer has been cold filtered out of it.
What in the hell is this??? It tastes like... water?........................
Pretty nasty. Good beer to dring on a hot summer day after mowing the lawn to get the grass out of your mouth
Semi-blarg. Somehow vaguely drinkable to me still, what with its basic lack of flavor. Always has some kind of coppery metallic taste to it.
A nice average beer. Its a little too light and tastes a little to watery for my taste, but it does not taste bad.
This beer goes down easy for a mass produced beer.  It is up on my list and i could drink it all night.  Easy on the palate but a tad bitter

Maybe it's just me, but this "Brewski" just rubs me as some serious NASCAR, wife-beating, Calvin pissing on ford/chevy sticker, unemployed, mullet having, sister fucking, marlboro smoking, trailor-park residing,  etc..  REDNECK BEER! I'll Have no part of it! I'll stick with the "High Life" thank you!

Slighly skunky aroma, snow white head, fruity flavor. Not unrefreshing - but not a masterpiece - good beer to quench a thirst. Beats the other macros in my opinion as it has a little bit of body to it.
Blond with a small head. Fruity hoppy aroma. Slightly fruity and a very short taste. Watery!

MGD
Miller, not that great.
Rusty Wallace's car was awesome when he had MGD for sponsorship, but now his miller lite car sucks.
This is a beer that is found under many different labels, miller, bud, canadian, coors, etc.... Wow, this one uses a patented cold filtered process.  I wonder how that affects the taste?

Pale gold clear under a medium-small size, lasting white head. Faint stale soapy bitter hops aroma. Thin soda-watery  characterless body. Underwhelming sweetish and faint bitter flavours. Bland tasteless finish. Depressingly bad.
Better than Bud. Aroma is quite bad (possibly skunky), but the taste is quite refreshing. Corny aftertaste.  Goes great with pizza.

A yellow beer with an OK head though disappearing fast. It has an aroma of the cereal grain which it has been brewed on. The taste is watery and that of the cereal grain - a bit metallic. It ends of in a very slight hoppyness - but not a type of hops that I like. A really lousy beer.
This is a little pricey for a domestic, however it is one of the better tasting macro beers.
MEDIOCRE BUT A GREAT 'EXCLUSIVELY CHEAP' PARTY BEER.........................
If I had to drink a Macrobrew, this would probably be it....................
i dont mind this beer. its very easy drinking, and goes down well when your really thirsty.

This beer is quite expensive here, especially when my favourite pilseners are much cheaper. Then it smells like water, in other words, not much of spices or delicious extracts in this one. Simple, though refreshing. Minus points for the price.

If anyone has ever been from a small town you will know that beer is important.  Being from a small town in South Carolina I know that Budweiser, Budlight, and Natural light are the number one, two, and three beers in South Carolina.  God do I feel sorry for me and anyone who grew up here. (that is besides the point)
Some how MGD is really big on the east coast.  I have went up north and decided that the "Champagne" of beers isn't as bad as everyone made it out to be.  I don't mind drinking it, in fact it's not bad.
I thorougly enjoyed the flavor and palate on this beer. I enjoyed the tase more than most of the bigger breweries.

this beer is very delicious. the only thing i am not pleased w/is the price it is a little high. i am gonna have to talk to the doldo brothers inc. into lowering the price. over all i think this is a quality beer. this beer is delicious and thats what counts.
Extremely smooth easy beer.  Nice aftertaste.  This is one of my favorite domestics.
This definitely has nose, flavor, aftertaste, and all that good stuff.  Unfortunately, that's bad.
Not much more to say, that I've tried it. Reminds me a lot of Corona, just without  flavour and aroma.
better than the high life...if that says anything...........................
Pale beer with a corrosive  palate.  Very mediocre..........................
Screw cans! Drink this one in a bottle! Tastes great!.......................

I had to re-rate this beer.  My first rating had some problems.  1) I was drunk when I was writing the review and 2) I was drunk on Miller High Life.  This beer is better than Budweiser, but still could use some work.  One of the better domestic macros I"ve had.
mimimal flavor for maximum enjoyment........................................
I'd take a Milwaukee's BEAST over this crap.................................
Not bad at the ballpark, even though it's rather expensive... hey, what the hell are you going to do? sue me.
Ah MGD the best of the Miller line (not saying much)........................
Suspiciously urine-colored, almost water-flavored.  ........................
not bad if your shit faced & it's ice cold.  Better than high life & all that other shit though.
This is the best tasting BEER in the bottle. Second only to Natural Light. Yeah Sonoma!

Typical pale yellow color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor were a little better than I had expected...slight hops bitterness, and some subtle banana tones. Very thin watery feel...too much large-bubble-carbonation though.

In truth, I'm sympathetic to this beer.  In graduate school I used to get this for 25 cents (early 1990s, Baltimore).  Tonight it was offered to me at a BBQ I was at, and although it was a bit dusty at times, thin at others, starchy at others...and was a bit heavy in carbonation...it resonated with something in me.  Not harsh, not overly plain, not ridiculously light.  My favorite macro and a good beer drinking experience in my book.
OK for late night sheepshead sessions in northern Wisconsin, where it can be passed off as simply part of the atmosphere.
A feint at the middle of the road.  Perhaps not as much corn in the profile as High Life.  Starchy. Buy Bud.

Pretty much the crappiest mainstream cheap domestic beer... has a flat dull taste to it, just not worth the effort at all . If u like to drink piss youd be better of with budweiser, or pay a litle extra more and get rolling rock
Average macro beer. Refreshing. Good for when you're on a budget and don't have money for the expensive shit. Drinkable and not skunky, but very dull tasting.
not bad, goes down very easily, very smooth, somewhat of a corona taste to it
Very thin and watery. Though smooth and drinkable especially when served ice-cold. Alcohol content 4.7%

Not as good as High Life. However, rather enjoyable and kicks the crap out of any Bud brew. I still don't know anyone who buys this consistently and I never see it in bars. This beer is an enigma to me, but really not bad.
Only a hint of malt detedted in the aroma. Sweetish taste with orange and pear. No hopbitterness, just a bit skunky and soapy. Thin.
I think I once had the same impression this beer gave me when I bit into a tin can.  Slightly metallic with something left to be desired...
Almost threw up after the first one.  By brother lived on this stuff for a while.
Smells sweet, straw yellow colour, little head. Small amount of malt and bitterness, some carbonation. Ordinary.

Best served on draft at the ballpark.  The best thing this beer's got going for it is that it's cheap and goes down easy.  With a hot dog, not bad.  Otherwise, use only when throwing a party with tons of guests if you are concerned about costs.

I was recently reminded how crummy these "corn-fed" american beers really are.  I was on a long range fishing boat at the beginning of June and forgot to bring some real beer with me.  My choices were Bud, Coors Light, and Miller GD.  Well, I chose GD - once.  From that point on it was Rum and Coke!
malt and pear drops in the nose, earthy malt in the mouth, faint hop in the aftertaste. I have a cold and my senses are dulled.
Rice, aluminum, plastic. These are NOT a few of my favorite things!.........
Thin.. Why an IRISH air company like Ryanair are serving this onborard their planes puzzles me..
I would prefer taunting a raging bull thank you.............................
One of the better beer substitutes.  It's flavored water but at a hockey game when you have no other options you can drink it.
Looks like beer. Smells like beer. Tastes like flavored water...............
UGH!  I remember when, for some unknown reason, I thought this was a "Premium" type beer.  (well, compared too Wiedeman's maybe...)

In the future, after the nuclear holocaust, when mankind is living underground in those plastic bubbles and all wearing the same kind of clothes, and there is no vegetation and all the food is fake, the beer will taste like this.

Here is the process for making this beer: An old stinky guy drives around in a green datsun frantically mopping up all the spilled beer from Anheuser Busch breweries.  Then, once a week, he wrings the mops out into a nice looking bottle, labeled with an acronym that has gained favor with the yokels.  There’s just something Cletis likes about saying, “I’ll have an MGD!!!!”

The aroma is tangy/dank and the color reminds me of...well...this same stuff about a half-hour from now...Same quality to the filmy head.  The flavor features slight sweet foundation with very mild-mannered hops and only moderate carbonation. The balance is quite acceptable if lacking any sort of complexity. This brew also has more body than most of its Milwaukee macro-brethren, leaving it a cut above many of them. Finish is essentially flavorless. Overall, the best endorsement is that it doesn't say "Light" on the label.

Picture this.. a man urinates in a cup. Another man drinks this cup, and then urinates in the now empty cup. 
A prankster comes along, and puts an MGD label on the cup, and serves it to me.
Now, maybe this isnt what happened.. but it may as well have. Proves absolutely anything can don the 'beer' label, regardless of quality level.
Avoid at all costs.
This is a regular in the fridge, because everyone who likes beer will drink this.  It's not bad, and very drinkable.
Really good beer, extremly smooth, very good flavor, a bitter aftertaste but a good one, not the kind that makes you gag. much better than miller high life.
If you have to drink American macro swill, it isn't that bad.  I would say it's between this and michelob in a redneck bar.
Is there any aroma? Watery beer which taste like most "stupid" germans expect american beer have to taste like
Smells lot rotten vegetables. Worse than Sol (see my rating) but I can't give lower than .5. "America's quality beer"? My ass!
better than high life but not a good beer...................................
Slightly more interesting than Miller Lite, but still nothing to write home about.
I have somewhat of a soft spot for this beer.  This is one of the first beers that I ever enjoyed.  I don't drink it much now but it brings back fond memories.  Does that make any sense?

Re-rate.  I don't know how I managed to rate this as high as a 2.7.  Like with many a macroswill, it just doesn't live up to my earlier memories, where I was under the impression that it offered more beer character.  This isn't really all that different that your run-of-the-mill macroswill, so it would be rather pointless to go into compositional details.  It's better than Bud, though.  (Budweiser, that is, not that jackass baseball commissioner -- though it's better than him, too.)

Original review follows:

Pretty average; had a lot of this relatively recently (April of 2001, to be exact) when going to Miller Park (Milwaukee) watching baseball games.  Good for a baseball-watching beer, I guess.  Actually, the best memory of that weekend, far and away, was seeing Barry Bonds hit 3 home runs on his way to 73.
If fate decrees I have a major, this is the one I choose.  I despise the taste of Bud and the politics of Coors, so this one is the least harmful.
Only drinkable when there is nothing else left..............................
Bottled MGD...I drank this when  worked long days diggin trenches, but anything will taste good on a hot ass day if its cold and wet.  Not the worst of the fizzie variety, but still pretty worthless.
Serve it ice cold at the barbeque and I'll drink it. I won't go out of my way to buy this. Will maybe try on tap after work.

2002 vintage. Head is initially small, fizzy, white, fully diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Aroma is trace malt (cereal). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. A little more bitterness in the finish than typical swill, but the filtered tap water I have in a glass next to me has almost as strong an aroma, except cleaner.

Sort of a worty,rubbery aroma with very little hops - best described as an "American adjuncty" aroma. Clear, off-yellow beer with foamy head that subsides as fast as a sodas. Watery palate with medium to heavy carb. Almost no taste other than a hint of hops and adjuncts. Not a very good beer.

Had a few free drink tickets at a club so I order a Becks or Heiniken, hmmm, only domestic beers with the ticket eh? OK, I slammed a few of these. It was that or Bud/Bud Light or Ice House, this was the lesser of the evils.

A pretty damn good beer.  This was my bread and butter in high school when I had money and now that I'm in college, its not even considered buyable because I have even less money!  The "back in black" look takes me back to the commercials where the guy is in a bar and the Allman Brothers song comes on and it starts snowing and somehow Rusty Wallace's car just appears out of nowhere, ahh flashbacks.
another laclluster american macro, barely better than bud, but still pretty bad

Ok - if I had to choose from the 3 mainstream domestic beers (Bud, Coors or Miller), this would be the one. Goes down smoother than Bud or Coors - but still would take a Corona if I had to drink a light beer. Not bad - but geez, why even bother?
Preferable to other Miller products.  Lacking in taste and aroma.  Nothing special about the appearance.  A weak beer all the way around.  Gets worse as it gets warmer.

Run of the mill, b ut still, you can't knock the MGD too much.  A lot more flavor than any of the other miller products, MGD gives a fairly decent taste with a lot of smoothness.  Unfortunately, Miller isn't too flavorfull to begin with.

Sucks out of the bottle, not so bad on draft if you're really dying of thirst, the only true innovation in American brewing by these guys is how they can make one pee immediately after downing one of their beers
An average beer for average folks.  It beats Miller High Life by a whisker.
Just plain nasty out of a can, tolerable out of a bottle. But nothing great.
Actually better than I expected. It is still not very deep or impressionable, but seems to be a decent, "I am burning up on a freaking 100 degree summer day, give me whatever you have" type of beer.
The bottled version seems to taste better than the cans.  It's a descent beer, but seems to leave me some nasty headache's if I drink to much.
This is one of the best tasting domestic brewed beers.  It has a full bodied smell and taste and easy to drink.

Smells nice, Looks nice, Carbonation fizzles out making it taste a little to sweet. The last quarter of the bottle is basically flat and boring. Must be served in a frosty mug and finished in less than 4 drinks. Tastes much better from a keg.
my friend said it best: it's the best of the worst..........................
This is the stuff I drank in high school to get drunk. On tasting it now I can hardly swallow it. Seems ridiculously sweet to me without much other flavor.
A good beer, hey, its better than High Life.................................

This is Miller at it's best as far as I'm concerned.  Even though there may be critics of typical American macro brews, this is definitely a quality one.  Certainly a beer of choice if you're looking to get loaded off a brew that isn't too strong.
Aroma is not even that bad, but flavor and especially palate are crap. Too bad i bought a 4-pack: now i have to drink 3 more... Damn!
A worthy candidate when you want a generic beer, but I would never look for it.  Slightly better than flavored water with the essence of beer.

High Rated maybe, But I stick to the princle that a beer should be rated by style.  A very decent American Standard.  Slightly to much corn flavor comes through, but not unexpected for style. Straw color with actually some lace.  No real faults.
My dad drinks this swill, so I can't help but drink it some times. AT least it has no taste...

Had me for a short time with the aroma...hints of something actually used in the creation of beer. Then I tasted it, and...well, it was sweet and bland and just like slightly higher gravity water in rolling waves of unpleasantness. In addition, this sparkling gem receives a 1 in appearance, in part because it hung on to its sticky head by some unnatural means known only to those "brewers" at Miller.
Pure shit. The Miller "Brewery" should be burned to the ground. All their beers are undrinkable.
Just another glorified mass produced beer...................................
I'd give it a better score if it were cheaper.  I can't imagine a situation in which I would actually buy one of these.
I had it in the plastic bottle at Safeco Field. Good with food. Must be a Ballpark breqw however. Otherwise, find something with more flavor.
Utter crap, the thought of drinking this makes me want to puke..............
It seemed OK at first but has kind of a bittery taste halfway down..very hard to describe.  Over carbonated.  What does "cold-filtered" mean?

Seriously struck by RateBeer addiction, I bought this beer only to rate it - and I hate myself for it! Hate hate hate!! I paid good money for this crap, in the US at least it’s cheap - here it’s expensive. Importing this shit to Europe is totally ridiculous! And the alternative in Norway, if you want an American beer, is Bud!! (If you’re ’lucky’, you might find Michelob!) My expectations were very low, but I soon found out that this ’beer’ was even worse than I expected. Aroma reminiscent of the wine yeast of my disastrous, short lived wine-making career 15 years ago. Excessive head that disappears rather quickly. Hardly any flavour at all - just a bland, metallic mouthfeel. Luckily, there is no aftertaste either (if there was, it would surely have been bad). ’Genuine draught’ my ass! This is just bad, real BAD!!
One of the best domestic beers, but still nothing to write home about.  ....
Maybe one of the best domestics, but still very tasteless and common........
Crap, and even their commercials are crap too...............................
Probably the least hideous of all the "Miller" beers.  Rah. . . . Rah.......

I cannot believe that they continue to pass this off as a beer. I'm not sure if anything, other than Miller 
High Life, is as bad.
Try Evian mineral water - it's tastier.    Beer should have some flavour!...
Another typical Miller product, which I will drink anyday over ANY Budweiser product. Fine example of an American beer.
A decent aroma and palate.  A pretty good beer for a mass produced one......
mgd is great. cheap and tastes decent.......................................
The smell is pretty bad. I tried to drink one at the end of a party (funny enough that there was only Miller left)and have to confess that it was one of the few beers in my life I couldn't finish.

The word “genuine” in MGD gives beer drinkers the impression that this is the “real deal” when it comes to beer. This is one of the top-10 domestic brands and it is Miller’s most popular full-caloried beer. That said... There is very little hop flavoring, no bitterness, and almost nothing in the finish that makes you stand up and take notice of what you just drank. Tastes like corn grits are used in the brewing.
Sweet and drinkable. Hardly a world beater but ok...........................
Looks like piss, smells like piss, but you can buy enough with 10 bucks to not care. And that's the American way.
the can and name make it look a whole hell of alot better then it actually tastes, rather drink the lite or champagne
I do detect a slight malt taste and hop bitterness.  however, this beer is made for mass consumption and works well especially when ice cold.

*Re-Rate* Ok, now that I've been around the block, I wanted to get back to this one.  This brew pours a clear light golden straw.  The mostly diminishing frothy white head is average sized with fair lacing.  The moderate nose is mostly hoppy with perfumed grass, citrus, spruce and resin.  Also detected are traces of straw, hay, soap, and a white wine like quality.  Let it be said that I don't care for the nose of nearly all Am Standards, this being no exception.  The light flavor is slightly unbalanced toward sweeness, but has a pleasent nutty yeasty finish if short.  The light body is watery with lively carbonation, and has a light astringency to the finish.  Bland. *Original Rate 2/24/02 *This is pretty decent mass production beer IMO.  Of course slightly above average qualifies in that category.  I'd consider myself a snob if I turned my nose up on this one.
Just not a miller fan what can i say........................................
Not a bad beer for the price. Smell is not all that great, but taste is decent. good party beer.
Flavor is OK but stays too long with a very typical simple flavor...........
Disgusting crystal clear yellow color.  Slight malt and a decent bitterness in the flavor.  Average white head with large bubbles.  Archtypical American macro.
I hate most domestic beers, but for some reason this isn't extremely bad, but bad nontheless. I'll drink it if it's around and there's nothing else to drink.
Leaves you asking "Is that all there is"....................................
Clear bottle and very light colour. Nice lacing on the glass, though. The flavour is very smooth, but somewhat uninteresting.

I rate MGD #2 in the rankings of the top 3 "American Standards" (Budweiser, Miller, and Coors).  I've actually found that I like Coors the best out of all three.  MGD in a can is what we drank as a standard in my early college years.  I would recommend you find something cheaper if you're going to drink this level of beer.
This was my very first beer I starting drinking as a kid on a regular basis.  No wonder I did poor in high school.
A hell of a lot better than the light, but that's not saying much at all....
Fine beer for a domestic. I like it and it is very good on tap..............

Well, this product is marketed for partiess . Light , smoth , drinkable , light . Not much aroma , not to bitter , not to enything . As a party drinker can't complain ,as a beer drink you might . To light , where is this "beer smell " etc...

Only reason I ever drink this is when its the only thing arounf or if my other choice is bud or Old Style. Don't see why everyone drinks this stuff. Everything Miller contract brews for Pabst is better. Maybe if they marketed that they would be #1
They should double check the recipe, somebody forgot to add hops. ..........

Don't know where my Miller was brewed, but it said brewed in the EU. Grain, horseblanket and earth aroma. Pale golden, white rocky head, some lacing. Clear white bottle! I hate that. Very light 'pilsener', bit sweet, bit hoppy, nothing more to dicover. Sweet long finish.
At Uni there was an American student.  He said Miller was nice.  it isnt....

This is basically the only 'corporate beer' I can consume and not be too bothered by it. Probably because it more closely follows a beer recipe than say 'Bud Lite'. My hopes should have vanished when I saw this beer supplied in a clear bottle, but this did not turn out to be an issue. Instead I was immediately disappointed upon pouring. It’s a pale yellowy golden color, extremely clear with good carbonation. There’s a decent initial foam but this quickly dissipates to something that looks more like a pond surface scum.

The nose is pretty much all-malt. It’s got a slight off-fruitiness, slightly grapey and a little vinuous.

The palate is light in body, with a slight smoothness. There’s some carbonation but really not as much as I would expect from this style.

A slight fruity initial flavor is even briefly appealing, with signs of apple, followed by a clean innocent malty-fruit middle. There are faint signs of hop in the finish but the aftertaste is very brief and mild. What does exist of the aftertaste is pretty unpleasant with a sour almost sickening sweetness.

One of the "better" Miller products.  I can drink this without hating it instantly.  It has the noticeable flavor that all Miller products have, only not as strong which makes it one of the better Millers.  I'd still try to steer clear.

Note): I resample beers if still in existence once every 4 to 5 years, so thus you'll see some reviews from me that normally I Iwould not bother with, but all beer deserves a fair sample/review.
